loans.name: Kazi Poa Shg Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is the facilitator of the Kazi Poa SHG group. Rebecca and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rebecca takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Rebecca had an excellent maize yield harvesting five bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rebecca was only able to harvest one bag of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rebecca and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Rebecca will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kazi Poa SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Rebecca is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” del centro poblado Poccona, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y cuenta con estudios de educación secundaria (incompleta).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro ciclos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio compra y venta de papa y chuño.

Con éste préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles comprará diez sacos de papa y chuño, los productos los compra en Yunguyo y los vende en la ciudad de Ilo.  Trabaja junto con su papá

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar y seguir  con el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el dialogo y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a partner of "Candelaria" communal bank in Poccona village, in the district and province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 21, single and has completed some levels of secondary education (not all).

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four loan cycles. Her first loan was for the amount of S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, that she invested in her business, which is buying and selling potatoes and chuño.

She will use this loan of S/. 1000.00 nuevo soles to buy ten bags of potatoes and chuño. She buys these products in Yunguyo and sells them in Ilo city.

She works together with her father.

Her dream is to improve and keep her business in the future.

What she likes the most about her communal bank is the possibility of dialogue and savings.

loans.use: To buy ten bags of potatoes and chuño.

loans.name: Sylvie Idé

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Sylvie s'est spécialisée dans la couture; activité qu'elle exerce dans son quartier. Ele  y associe la vente de pagnes, maïs et haricot dans son quartier bien peuplé ayant le monopole de son entourage; ce qui lui permet de commercialiser très rapidement son produit. Pour accroître sa productivité et  satisfaire  la demande haussante de sa clientèle, elle fait donc recours à Finadev. Sylvie vise à maximiser alors son profit pour  renforcer son stock et surtout pour subvenir en partie aux dépenses de son foyer.
texts.en: Married and mother of four children, Sylvie is specialized in sewing, an occupation that she practices in her area. She combines with this the sale of pagnes (colorful wax cloths), corn and beans in her well-populated area, and has the monopoly in her circles. This allows her to rapidly market her products. To increase her productivity and satisfy the increased demand of her clients, she has turned to Finadev. Sylvie aims to maximize her profits to reinforce her stock, and especially to provide for a part of her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 30 pagnes, 4 sacks of corn, sacks of beans and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Leydi Beatriz

texts.es: Leydi compró medicina natural, con la que surtió su negocio aun más y sus clientes lograron acercarse en mayor cantidad. En la actualidad requiere comprar mas medicina natural y necesita invertir en mayor volumen, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará medicina natural y su inversión muy seguramente será exitosa porque cuenta con una clientela que la acredita y está basada en registros que hace de los productos que rotan mas rápidamente. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Mis agradecimientos por haber confiado en mi y en mi negocio."
texts.en: Leydi bought natural medicines for her business and so has increased the stock in her store as well as the number of customers who buy from her. Now she needs to buy more natural medicines and in larger quantities so she is seeking a second loan with Kiva. Her investment will certainly be successful as she has a good reputation with her clients who know that her products have a rapid turnover. Leydi has a message for Kiva donors: “Thank you for showing confidence in me and my business.”

loans.use: to buy natural medicines

loans.name: Sylvanus

texts.en: Sylvanus is a mechanic. His business has been in operation for 20 years. He is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He learnt of Milango from an employee. Sylvanus is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a welding machine. The main challenges facing Sylvanus are finding customers, price fluctuations and some customers not paying on time.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Adrian Isidro

texts.es: Adrian de 31 años vive (libertad ecuador) el decidió unirse a este trabajo por la mama y de su esposa- ahora se dedican el y su esposa a la artesanía. Haciendo cadenas, anillos artesanos. Con mucho esfuerzo trabaja todos los días junto a su esposa . a futuro el desea tener una distribuidara de su producto. Con el préstamo comprara (hilos perlas para hacer mas artesanias).
texts.en: Adrian, 31, lives in Libertad, Ecuador.  He decided to join this work with his mother and his wife.  Now he and his wife are artisans making artisanal chains and rings.  He works hard every day alongside his wife.  In the future he'd like to have a distributorship for his product.  He will use the loan to buy thread and pearls to make more crafts.

loans.use: to buy pearls and thread.

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a 33 year old married woman who supports 4 family members from Bani Kenanah Irbid Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements,she will be repainting her home and she wants to buy a new furniture.In the future she is planning on adding another room.
Roula is conservative woman she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her husband.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Sandra del Socorro tiene un negocio de producción y venta de películas y discos musicales ubicado en el centro  de la ciudad de león desde hace 12  años, sale de su casa a las 7:00 am y abre su negocio a las 8:00 am cerrándolo a la 6:00 pm  siendo este trabajo el sustento de su familia.

La señora Sandra del Socorro solicita crédito a  CEPRODEL el cual utilizara este crédito para compra de materiales de construcción tales como: arena, cemento, bloqueos, hierro, etc., esto le permitirá poseer una mejor presentación en su centro de labores logrando el aumento de su cliente al igual que su cliente, el cual conllevara a mejorar sus ganancias y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus 6 hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra del Socorro has had a business making and selling movies and musical disks located in the center of the city of León for 12 years. She leaves her home at 7:00AM and opens her business at 8:00AM, closing it at 6:00PM. This work is the livelihood for her family.

Sandra del Socorro is asking for a loan from CEPRODEL which she will use to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, blocks, iron, etc. This will allow her to make a better presentation where she works building up her customers as clientele, which will take her towards better earnings and give a better quality of life to her six children.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron for improvements to her business

loans.name: Jérôme Kossi

texts.en:
Mr Jérôme Kossi A., is a young welder aged 26. He is married and father of one (01) child and is in charge of his. Very dynamic, modest and very motivated, he has created his own workshop for just one year now, but he has at his disposal ten (10) active apprentices. His serious, good work and timeliness make his reputation and he is more and more solicited. This considerably increased the number of his clients. But he is confronted with the insufficiency of equipment and supply to better respond to needs of clients. His small school training allows him to hold accountancy for the good management of his workshop. He was able to reimburse without incident, his first credit of $ 300. Mr Jérôme Kossi A. can well manage the credit of $ 550 which he is requesting to finance the sheets for the production of the wheelbarrows, moulds, doors, metal gates, etc.

Monsieur A. Kossi Jérôme, est un jeune soudeur âgé de 26 ans. Il est marié père d’un (01) enfant et à sa mère en charge. Très dynamique, modeste et très motivé, il a crée son propre atelier il y a juste un an, mais il a déjà à son actif dix (10) appentis. Son sérieux et son travail bien fait et livré à temps fait sa réputation et est de plus en plus sollicité. Ce qui augmente considérablement sa clientèle et au même moment, fait face à l’insuffisance de moyens matériels pour mieux répondre aux besoins des demandes qui lui sont soumises. Sa petite formation scolaire lui permet de tenir une petite comptabilité pour la bonne gestion de son atelier. Ce qui a été constaté dans le remboursement sans incident de son premier crédit de $ 300 obtenus Monsieur A. Kossi Jérôme peut bien gérer le crédit de $550 qu’il sollicite pour acheter des tôles servant à la fabrication des brouettes, des moules, des portes, des grilles de protection, etc.

loans.use: to finance the sheets for the production of the wheelbarrows, moulds, doors, metal gates,

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a big-time dealer in grains and cereals. These are maize, groundnuts, beans and others. She buys her items in bulk from Techiman in the central part of the country. She is 38 years old and married with 5 children, 4 of whom are currently schooling.

Efua's major problem is the transport cost for her wares. This is gradually draining the little capital with which she is trading. She intends to use the KIVA loan to support her capital to cover the transport payments for her goods.

loans.use: For transport costs

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid O. is from the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan, where he currently lives with his wife and three children. He started selling agricultural food products, such as vegetables, about twenty years ago. He recently began selling his goods at the local bazaar. Vahid has requested a loan to expand his business in order to sell a wider variety of agricultural goods, such as fruits and other staple goods.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 34-year-old single mother of two: Salandre (10) and Davis (14). She works out of her small house, making bags and clothes with a sewing machine that she bought with her first loan. She also knits and crochets different types of clothes as well. With this loan Ana will buy more materials and possibly a different sewing machine, which will enable her to make more complex things and hopefully in turn earn more money. With this increase in profit she hopes to expand her business and possibly have her own store someday that is separate from her house. She would like to be able to provide more for her family.

Note: Ana is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $975 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. This money will go towards the next loan received by this Bank of Hope; once they finish paying back their current loan it will be activated.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials and new equipment for her business

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria is originally from Monterrey, Nuevo León, and has two kids, ages 5 and 13. She lives with her common-law husband, and the salary that he receives is insufficient to cover all the household expenses. Being a very enterprising woman, Maria started her own business selling cookware three years ago. She works at open markets, and with the help of her oldest son she has been able to increase the variety of products they offer.

To keep the business growing as it has to this point, Maria is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to purchase supplies to meet her customers' demands and stay in their favor. She plans to repay the loan within three months. You can help this family by contributing to the growth of their business. They are very thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria del Socorro es originaria de Monterrey, Nuevo León, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 13 años de edad, aún vive en unión libre con su pareja y el salario que él obtiene como empleado es muy bajo para solventar todos los gastos de su hogar, por lo que Maria siendo una mujer emprendedora, inició su propio negocio con la venta de artículos para cocina hace tres años, ella se instala en los mercados rodantes y con la ayuda de su hijo mayor han hecho crecer su negocio incrementando la variedad de productos que ofrecen.

Para continuar creciendo como hasta ahora Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, muchas gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang's husband died three years ago, and she works as a day labourer to earn money to care for her children. Her two oldest daughters (15 and 12 years old) are in the 10th and 7th class, and her youngest is too young for school. Their average income is $8.5 per month/person. Hang is requesting a loan of $75 to raise chickens to improve her income pay for her childrens' schooling. She will repay the loan during four months.

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: Mahsad

texts.ru:
Mahsad G. is 46 years old, is married and has one daughter. She has been receiving loans from MicroInvest since 2002. At the start of her business, she was buying fabrics from local suppliers, since she did not have enough money for transport expenses. Because of that, her profits were lower. As her business grew, Mahsad’s turnover and profits began to increase and she was able to travel to buy fabrics herself. Mahsad wants to use her new loan to add winter fabrics to her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Махсад Гайбуллаева - возраст 46 лет замужем имеет одну дочь. С 2002 года является кредитором в Микроинвесте. В начале своего бизнеса она закупала товар, материи у поставщиков, т. к у нее не было финансов на транспортные расхода по бизнесу , что ей не позваляло иметь нормального дохода. Но со временем она стала ездить за товаром сама,т.к. ее оборот стал увеличиваться, и прибыль соответственно тоже. Взяв следующий кредит она хочет увеличить зимние ткани.

loans.use: To buy winter fabrics

loans.name: Marta  Lorena

texts.es:
Mrs. L. lives in La Libertad and has had her business in the same place for four years. She has always liked business, and prior to having the store in her home she used to sell clothing as traveling salesperson, but while her children were growing up she decided to open a business in her home which would allow her to dedicate more time to ther children and attend to their needs. She has three children, two of whom still depend on her income. The store has helped her be able to cover some of her childresn’s school expenses and contribute with her husband to the household expenses.

She is well-known in the area and has a good number of customers that pay her bimonthly or monthly. That money she collects is reinvested and used to stock her products that the customers seek. She needs a loan to invest in purchasing clothing for the school year as that is what her clients are asking for the most at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

la señora L. vive en la actualidad en la Libertad, de tener su negocio en el mismo lugar tiene cuatro años siempre le a gustado el comercio antes de tener la tienda en su casa comercializaba con ropa de forma ambulante , pero mientras sus hijos iban creciendo decidió el poner un negocio en la misma casa que le permitiera el poder dedicarles mas tiempo y poder atender algunas necesidades que ellos tenían, cuenta con tres hijos los cuales dos únicamente dependen de sus ingresos, la tienda le ayudado a poder costear algunos gastos de estudio de sus hijos y a contribuir con su esposo con las responsabilidades.

Es muy conocida en la zona maneja un buen numero de clientes que le pagan de manera quincenal o mensual , ese dinero que recoge le sirve para poder reinvertirlo y surtir con los productos que le buscan, su necesidad actual es invertir en ropa para la época escolar ya que es la que mas le solicitan sus clientes.

loans.use: She will buy basic grains to sell in her store: beans, corn, rice; in addition she will buy items such as  underwearp for adults and children that she sells out in her neighborhood

loans.name: Ay

texts.en:
Mrs. Ay O., 29, is the mother of one child who works making Khmer wine. She earns about $5 a day reselling this wine in a local market. Her husband makes about $3 a day growing pigs on his farm. (Many Cambodians raise pigs and grow wine at the same time, because pigs like to eat scraps from the wine-making process. After they eat the scraps, the pigs become intoxicated, fall asleep and grow very quickly.)

Mrs. Ay O. hopes to use this loan to expand the pen in which her husband keeps his pigs, and to expand her wine-making business. (Only her husband is pictured because Mrs. Ay O. was unavailable when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: to expand the pen which holds his pigs and expand a wine-making business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina K.  is a trader who sells building materials like cement. She is a single parent of 2 children. Sales are increasing but she lacks enough capital to buy more cement to meet the demand of her customers.

She is requesting $525 as an additional fund to purchase more cement for sale.

loans.use: Additional funds to purchase more cement for sale.

loans.name: Guldith

texts.es:
La señora Clorinda Pérez Salas pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio está ubicado en el Pasaje 6 de Setiembre Nº 336 en el Barrio Huayco donde también funciona su taller de Carpintería, negocio al que se dedica. 

La oportunidad de un préstamo en el Banco Comunal  le permite desarrollar junto a su esposo este negocio y estar preparados con un capital para las temporadas en las que los colegios solicitan mobiliario, paralelo a esta actividad ella presta servicios como profesora en un centro educativo local. 

Con el crédito de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 250 pies de madera que le servirá para fabricar los pedidos de mobiliarios

La señora Clorinda tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos dependiendo de ella sólo el último, trabaja en coordinación con su esposo ya que el es el que realiza los trabajos de carpintería.

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara prodcutos para su negocio

loans.name: Nassra's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Nassra is married and has two children (ages 6 and 3). She sells phone vouchers, a business she has had for a year. She is able to make about $180 a month from her sales.

Nassra has received a loan in the past to increase her inventory of phone voucher cards. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She is a member of loan group Umoja and will be sharing this loan with Sauda, Zaituni, Fatma, and Fauzia.

loans.use: To purchase additional phone voucher cards for resale

loans.name: Mohijon

texts.en:
Mohijon S. is 54 years old. She and her husband have raised four children. Two of Mohijon's sons help her in the business. She bakes the national bread “lepeshka”. The family works hard; they start baking the “lepeshka” early in the morning so that their customers shall have fresh bread in the morning. They go to bed late in the night after making dough and preparing the firewood and coal for baking the next day.

Mohijon has great customers, so she sells the majority of her products just from her place. However, she is also running a trading place in the central local market for selling the”lepeshka”. Thus, keeping the business stable, Mohijon helps her husband in supporting their family and allowing her sons to have a significant source of income. Now Mohijon requests $300 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. She is planning to purchase flour wholesale required for her business. Mohijon is grateful for all those supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Mohijon would like to purchase flour wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Eligio

texts.es:
Eligio is 64 years old, is married to Iluminada, and has children who no longer depend on them economically.

Eligio is a very hard-working man who has set up a small grocery store and also earns money from basic wooden rooms he has built on the patio of his house, which he rents for low prices.

He is asking for a loan to improve these structures; to refurbish the rooms and to make them more comfortable. The walls are made of wood and with a new investment they will be made of brick. Then the people who rent them will have more security and therefore the cost could be increased and in that way more income earned.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Eligio, tiene 64 años, es casado con la señora Iluminada, tienen hijos mayores que ya no dependen económicamente de ellos.

Eligio es un señor muy trabajador tiene montado una pequeña despensa, además obtiene ingresos por renta, ya que tiene construido piezas rudimentarias de madera en el patio de su casa, el cual alquila a bajos costos.

El crédito que esta solicitando es para mejorar dichas construcciones, pues va a refaccionar sus piezas y así ofrecer mayor comodidad. Actualmente las paredes son de maderas y con la nueva inversión, ya va a ser de materiales (ladrillos). Entonces los inquilinos tendrán mayor seguridad en las adquisiciones de sus comodidades y por ende el costo va a aumentar y así lograr mejores ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials: bricks, cement and others.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is 61 years old. She is a single woman with no children. She lives in the North of Lebanon.

Hana, whose name means tranquility, is indeed a calm and peaceful woman. She is a seamstress. She needs a loan of $200 to purchase wool threads for her business.

This is the first time Hana is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. She is committed to reimburse her loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To purchase wool threads

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer dedicated to studying the land and to the cultivation of potato, corn and beans. After planting his crops he spends six anxious months awaiting the fruits of his labor. His farming generates earnings that allow him to support his family. He takes his products to the city of Huancayo to sell throughout the primary markets of that town. Marcelino is always vigilant of his farmland, making sure to keep tabs on any possible pest infestations or diseases that may harm his crops. While he waits for the planting season (six months), he dedicates himself to selling small electronics that he buys on his trips into the city to acquaintances. This activity, however, does not generate the desired income. Marcelino is motivated, day in and day out, by his desire to better provide for his family and by his wish for his children to complete their educations so that they can look forward to bright futures. He seeks a loan with which to buy products for planting his crops, such as sacks of fertilizer, to be able to improve his yield in the future. He also hopes to continue to grow his small appliance business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelino tiene 40 años y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos. Es un agricultor dedicado a las tareas de la siembra, y a la cosecha de papa, maíz y arveja que luego de sembrar espera 6 meses la ansiada cosecha, que le permite, con sus ganancias, sostener a su familia, para lo cual, lleva toda su cosecha directamente a la ciudad de Huancayo para venderla en sus principales mercados. Marcelino siempre está vigilante todos los días de sus campos de cultivo para estar pendiente si entró alguna plaga o enfermedad en sus plantaciones. Mientras espera la época de la cosecha (6 meses) se dedica a vender a las personas que conoce pequeños artefactos eléctricos que compró en su viaje a la ciudad, para él lo más difícil es cuando no valoran el precio de sus productos, eso no le permite obtener las ganancias deseadas. Marcelino está motivado cada día, porque desea darle lo mejor a su familia, que sus hijos se superen a través del estudio. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar para la siembra, sacos de abono y fertilizantes y a un futuro poder mejorar su cosecha, a la par mantener su creciente negocio de venta de artefactos.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for planting his next crop.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna D., 39 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des graines d’arachide pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Maimouna D., age 39, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané Viviane Wade for six years. She wants to buy peanuts to make into peanut butter to sell. Her income enables her to help with family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell peanut butter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more products to her salon.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Раджабова Матлюба проживает в городе ДУшанбе. Возраст 46 лет. Имеет четверых детей. Имеет миниателье. Обратилась к нам за кредитом, для того, чтобы закупить две швейные машинки. Таким образом она увеличит состав ателье и сможет принять учениц. Это поможет населению пользоваться данными услугами. Кроме того она даст возможность обучаться молодым девочкам. Погасить кредит может в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Matluba R. lives in Dushanbe. She is 46 years old and has four children. She has a small tailor shop. She turned to us for a loan in order to buy two sewing machines. This will expand her shop so she can take on apprentices. Local residents will be better able to take advantage of the shop's services, and she will also be giving young women an opportunity to learn the trade. The loan will be repaid over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two sewing machines

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos; Rosmery de 14 años, Milton de 12, Elizabeth de10, Talia de 8 y Yesica de 6. Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 12 años, ya que al velar por una familia numerosa requería trabajar en un oficio que le permita cuidar a sus hijos y al mismo tiempo obtener ingresos para su sostenimiento, siendo ella la única fuente de manutención de sus 5 hijos. Felizmente el trabajo de Claudia obtiene buenos resultados, ya que las ganancias son buenas y alcanzan para cubrir las necesidades de todos ellos, teniendo además una ayuda extra, ya que sus hijos al ver la esforzada labor de su madre la apoyan incondicionalmente. Claudia se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para vender en época navideña.
texts.en:
Claudia, 32, is a single mother of 5 children: Rosmery,14; Milton,12; Elizabeth, 10; Talia, 8; and Yesica, 6. Claudia started selling clothes 12 years ago, to support her children and at the same time be able to care for them. Happily, Claudia's business is doing well, and she is able to cover the needs of her 5 children, who see their mother's tireless efforts and help her in the business. This is Claudia's first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to offer during the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restocking for holiday sales

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred A. is fifty-three years old. He is married and has six children – three boys and three girls. Some of his children are currently in senior high school. Some have completed their schooling whilst others are in junior high school. Alfred lives with his wife and family in a business town called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are engaged in commerce.

Alfred is a farmer cum palm oil producer. He cultivates cocoa and palm nuts. He says he produces palm oil using the palm fruits from his farm and also buys from other farmers. He buys the greater part of the palm nuts from the local farmers and adds to that the little he harvests from his farm.

According to Alfred, customers come from the cities to buy the palm oil by the gallon and retail to consumers. He has been in business for ten years. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the fruit of the palm trees. Alfred desires to use the loan to expand his business by buying palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply more customers.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa N. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children: three females and five males. Five of her children are currently in junior high and primary schools. The grown ups have completed and some are learning trades while others are also working. Adwoa’s husband operates a drinking bar in the locality in which they stay.

She lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in a small town near Offinso in the Ashanti Region. It is a farming as well as a commercial community in Ghana. Industrious as she is, Adwoa trades to support her husband in taking care of the family. She trades in maize. She buys bags of maize from farmers in the surrounding villages and sells at affordable prices to retailers. She also sells at the local market, especially to the food vendors. Adwoa has been in business for fifteen years. She wants a loan to buy maize in large quantities so she can distribute to more customers.

loans.use: To procure maize

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap P., a resident of Kampong Svay village in Kandal Province, is both a construction worker and a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice. In order to make his crop more productive, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and a water pump.

Mr. Sopheap P. is a 30-year-old father of two children who are yet too young to attend school. His wife, Mrs. Sek Chreb, a garment factory employee, is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a water pump in order to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Copacabana Group

texts.es: El grupo "Copacabana”  esta representado por la señora Graciela  y se encuentra un parentesco familiar entre las señoras, cristina y el señor José Miguel que son primos pero con ingresos independientes cada uno. Las socias del banco comunal se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como, venta D.  frutas, venta D. abarrotes, promotoras D. diferentes marcas D. cosméticos  y ala venta ambulante D. ropa. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero la experiencia D. las socias les permite salir adelante para llevar el ingreso diario para el sustento D. su familia.  El crédito otorgado es para ampliar el stock D. productos para sus negocios y a la compra D. materiales e insumos para mejorar sus ingresos y brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. La mayoría D. las socias han trabajado con fundaciones o organizaciones financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital por lo que  tienen experiencia en grupo solidaR..
texts.en:
This group is called "Copacabana” and is represented by Graciela. Two of the group's members are related: Cristina and José Miguel are cousins, but their incomes are independent of one another. The members of the community bank have a variety of businesses such as selling fruit, selling groceries, promoting different brands of cosmetics and selling clothing as street vendors. As with all business, there is competition in the market but the members' experience allows them to continue making a daily income to sustain their families. This loan will be used to increase the stock of goods for their businesses and to buy materials and ingredients to improve their revenue and give their families a better quality of life. Most of the members have previously worked with foundations or other financial institutions like Fundación Agrocapital and so they are familiar with group loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rehana M. Saleem Group

texts.en:
Rehana baji is forty years old, married, and a citizen of a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. She has lived in this city for the last seven years. Rehana baji completed her education to the fifth standard level but couldn’t study further because her parents couldn’t pay for her education. Her husband's name is M. S., and he runs a business selling seasonal fruit. He has been in this business for the last eight years.  Rehana baji is the mother of five children, two sons and three daughters. Her elder son works in a factory receiving a monthly wage. The others are enrolled in a local school, getting an education. Rehana baji is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her husband’s business. 

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Sara bano baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Taj baji wants a loan to buy wood for her wood selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
"oàn Trần Thị (20213030001) is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc N..  H. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Gạo 2 - 10 (10).


H. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, H. operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Chu Thị

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosela L. is 38 years old, married, and lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has four children: two are in primary grade. Her husband is a salesman in a mini-mart.

Determination and hard work are what Mrs. L. believes in. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in February 2005 having faith in its true service and assistance to the needy people.

Abject poverty is inevitable to them. It urges Mrs. L. to do her part in uplifting their livelihood. She obtained a loan from Paglaum MPC in order to have additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store.

The couple’s aspiration is to have a concrete store, a house and a refrigerator someday and be able to send their children to school and have them obtain a degree and be able to provide a good quality life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Maria Judith

texts.es:
María es una socia que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor de la Canela 2 “ y vive en la Urbanización Municipal Mz.A2 Lt.7 en la ciudad de Pucallpa ,tiene 40 años y vive con su esposo y sus 7 hijos ; su  esposo trabaja en una institución del estado.

El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles con ello  pudo construir un mostrador para su tiendita donde vende gaseosas, gracias a ello pudo apoyar en la economía de su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles lo invertirá  remodelando su tiendita y también comprará más mercadería para la preparación y  venta de su comida y  gaseosa.

            El apoyo de  los préstamos que Manuela Ramos realiza, me permite generar  ingresos económicos  en mi familia y así  crecer en mi negocio y darles una mejor calidad de vida a mis hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Flor de Canela 2" Communal Bank. She lives at Urbanizacion Municipal Mz.2 A2, Lt7 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 7 children. Her husband works for a government intitution. She used her first 300 soles loan to build a counter for her little store where she sells soft drinks. Thanks to this she was able to contribute to her family's income. With this 1200 new soles loan she will invest in remodeling her store and also purchase raw materials for the meals she prepares as well as to purchase soft drinks. The support with loans that Manuela Ramos makes helps me generate family income thereby helping my business to grow and give my children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her physical plant, purchase raw materials for her meals and to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Sara Amparo

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Sara M. desde hace varios años se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras como ayotes, tamarindo, limones, entre otros.

Con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones económicas, ha buscado la manera de salir adelante  y ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las verduras y de esta manera mejorar su condición económica y salir adelante en el negocio.
texts.en:
For many years, Mrs. Sara M. has had a business selling vegetables such as pumpkins, tamarinds, lemons, etc. in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua.

In a bid to improve her financial situation she has looked for a way to move forward and approached Ceprodel in order to ask for a loan to buy vegetables and so to improve her financial situation and move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Aurea Marie

texts.en:
Aurea Marie B. is from the village of Danao. She is 24 years old. Aurea Marie is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Aurea Marie operates a business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Aurea Marie has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Aurea Marie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Aurea Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. Aurea Marie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Aurea Marie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the fishing business.

loans.name: Dal Jan Group

texts.en: D. Jan is the group leader of D. Jan group. There are four members in this group who all want to expand and grow their businesses. D. Jan wants a loan to open a new shop for her carpet weaving business. M. Nazer will use the loan to expand his metal working shop. Merza Ahmad will use the loan for his vegetable business and Khatera for her tailoring business. They would all like to say this loan is very useful because it provides a good opportunity for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Año Nuevo Aymara Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer  “Los Andes” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Año nuevo aymará”, están juntas hace  5 años aproximadamente, su presidenta es  Julia F. quién las organiza para elaborar su reglamento interno, además la Responsable Popular de Salud las orienta para hacer uso del consultorio. Todas tienen sus propios negocios como la producción de sillones, artesanía en macramé, salón de peinados, atención de librería, servicio de estampados, fabricación de cordeles y venta de cosméticos. Necesitan el préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprando insumos y mercadería.
texts.en:
The Community Association "Año Nuevo Aymara” is located in one of the focal points of Pro Mujer "Los Andes". The members have been working together for about 5 years. Its president is Julia F. who organized them and developed internal regulations. She is responsible for Health guidelines for the use of the clinic.

All the members have their own businesses such as the production of chairs, macramé crafts, beauty salon, bookstore, print service, twine manufacturing and sale of cosmetics. They need the loan to increase working capital and to buy supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Fakonam

texts.fr: Cette femme est une vendeuse ambulante de pagnes de qualités. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2005 et ce commerce lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 02 enfants. Grâce à son expérience, elle a beaucoup de clients fidèles. Actuellement elle doit renouveler son stock ; pour cette raison, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 04 pièces de pagnes Hitarget, 04 pièces de pagnes phoenix, 04 pièces de pagnes Fashion et 04 pièces de pagnes Holywood.
texts.en:
This is a woman who goes door-to-door selling quality pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  She started doing this work in 2005.  It's a business that allows her to provide for their two children.  Thanks to her experience, she has many loyal customers.  Currently, she must renew her inventory.  For this reason, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 4 bolts of Hitarget pagnes, 4 of Phoenix, 4 of Fashion, and 4 of Holywood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quality cloth

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Emmy M. from Mbeya. She is married with one child, 7 years old. Emmy has been running a business since 2008, purchasing and selling clothes. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and currently earns about 150 USD from her business. Emmy is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Emmy thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma S. is from the village of Northern Poblacion. She is 29 years old. Vilma is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Vilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia B. H. reside en Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Marta tiene 30 años de edad  se encuentra casada y es madre de dos niños Erik de 10 años de edad y Jackeline de 8 años de edad. Martita como muchos le llaman trabaja arduo junto a su esposo quien es comerciante ambos tienen el deseo de darle lo mejor a sus hijos razón por la cual Martita ha instalado un  negocio con el que logra generar mayores ganancias que son de gran utilidad para la familia, en el negocio ella ofrece frutas y verduras , pero hoy solicita de un crédito que le permita surtir su inventario ya que como se puede ver en la fotografía carece de variedad, razón por la cual desea mucho que este crédito se le sea otorgado y así poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia B. H. lives in Cojutepeque in the department of Cuscatlán. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two children – Erik (age 10) and Jackeline (age 8). Like many other people, Marta and her husband work very hard in order to provide the best for their children. She has an established business selling fruits and vegetables in order to generate income for her family.

Marta is currently requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory. As seen in the photograph, she lacks a variety of products and hopes that her loan will be approved so that she can restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 31years old.  She is married and the mother of a child who is currently in school. She is a very hard working woman and committed to her work. She prepares and sells pastries and food stuffs including doughnuts, peanuts and washing soaps, in her neighborhood. Her doughnuts are prepared from flour. Her pastry (doughnuts) is enjoyed by many. Theresa sometimes sells the through hawking. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. Theresa requests the loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine, washing soap and peanuts etc. to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy supplies flour, margarine, sugar, cooking oil, peanuts and washing soap etc.

loans.name: Nuufou

texts.en:
Nuufou I. is a 59-year-old woman living in the town of Laulii Maagila.  She is married and has 5 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Nuufou owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members.  

In 2009, Nuufou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nuufou is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Nuufou plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Eufemio Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Eufemio Nicolás O. trabaja de albañil desde joven aprendió el oficio. Cuando se termina el contrato de la obra abecés se le hace difícil trabajar a la semana. Es por eso con ahorros puso una pequeña pulpería para poder mantenerse en los días difíciles, tiene 47 años de edad, su esposa procreo tres hijos y ella lo apoya en la pulpería ambos es superar para poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios y lograr que sean personas con un nivel mejor. Ya que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad para estudiar. Con el crédito anterior compro una computadora para poder apoyar a sus hijos con los trabajos de sus colegios. Con este nuevo financiamiento invertirá en la pulpería el cual comprara arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón de lavar, productos de condimentos, shampoo, gaseosas, golosinas, productos enlatados y una variedad de alimentos que día a día es la alimentación. Su meta es pode seguir trabajando y incrementar la venta. Ya que con el tiempo solo se dedicara al comercio. Da las gracias Afodenic por el financiamiento ya que se hace posible mejorar la vida de muchas familias de recurso económico y social.
texts.en:
Eufemio Nicolás O., 47, has worked as a mason since he learned the skills as a young man. However, when work contracts end, often it is difficult for him to find work that lasts an entire week. For this reason, he used his savings to set up a small grocery store to support himself during off days. His wife helps out in the store. They have three children. Both he and his wife share the goal of helping their children to get an education and seeing that they become adults with a better socio-economic status since they, themselves, didn't have the opportunity to go to school With his previous loan he bought a computer to help his children with their school work. This new loan will be used to buy stock items for his store: rice, beans, sugar, oil, laundry soap, condiments, shampoo, soft-driks, sweets, canned goods, and a variety of food items that are used daily in meal preparation. His goal is to continue working and increase sales because, in time, his only job will commerce. He thanks Afodenic for the financing because it makes it possible for many families of limited social and economic resources to improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, canned goods and others.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane E. is from the village of Magcamiguing in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Jane is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jane sells new clothing to local community members. Jane has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Jane's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo de 55 años, desea salir adelante por sus  tres hijos a quien lamentablemente ve cada quincena; debido a que esta separado de su esposa, él vive en su casa propia ubicada en la selva central del Perú.Desde hace 17 años maneja un vehículo de servicio urbano donde traslada pasajeros  dentro de su  ciudad; los fines de semana también lleva  algunos productos con una camioneta que alquila, ambas actividades ,según refiere, son rentables y le permiten ahorrar por lo que quiere  terminar de construir su vivienda para alquilarla ; además le gusta el trabajo porque es tranquilo ;ahora que los años han pasado,lamenta no haber invertido bien el dinero antes , por eso para el futuro planea comprar su propio vehículo para trabajar y enseñar el oficio a sus hijos.Es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y desea seguir siendo puntual como siempre para acceder a más créditos; el trabajo en su banco comunal le agrada bastante porque está integrado por personas  responsables.Ya tiene planeado invertir  el dinero del préstamo en mejorar su auto para seguir trabajando además de comprar algunos materiales que le falta para terminar de construir su casa, como 400 unidades de ladrillos y  varios metros de fierros.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 55 years old and wishes to be successful for his three children who sadly he sees every 15 days as he is separated from his wife. He lives in his own home located in the central jungle of Peru. For 17 years he has driven an urban public transportation vehicle where he transports passengers within the city. On weekends he also takes some products with a small truck that he rents. Both activities, he indicates, are profitable and enable him to save as he wants to finish building his home in order to rent it. In addition he likes to work because it is tranquil. Now as the years have passed, he is sorry that he hadn’t invested his money well, but for the future he plans to buy his own vehicle for work and teach his sons his profession. This is the fifth loan he has with MFP and he plans on being punctual as always in order to be able to access future loans. He is pleased with the work in the communal bank because the bank is made up of responsible people. Now he plans to invest the money from the loan in improving his vehicle in order to continue working, in addition buying some materials that he needs to finish building his home, such as 400 units of brick and various meters of metal.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve his vehicle and buy construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20211020036) is a 39 year old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội nhóm 07 (7).

H. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  H. owns & operates a handicraft business.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month (about $162 US) from these activities.

H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  This loan will be the first loan H. has taken out from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20211020037) is a 37 year old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20211020038) is a 55 year old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20211020039) is a 36 year old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20211020040) is a 37 year old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

5.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20211020041) is a 34 year old woman who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.

6.  Nguyễn Thị Nhị (20211020042) is a 43 year old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

H. Nguyễn Thị (20211020036) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm H. trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội nhóm 07 (7).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hàng mỹ nghệ bằng tre cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã H. trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20211020037) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20211020038) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20211020039) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20211020040) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

5.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20211020041) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.

6.  Nguyễn Thị Nhị (20211020042) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Dorcas Nabisino

texts.en: Dorcas Nabisino M. is married and the mother of five children. She has a second-hand clothes business in Nambale, Busia district. She started this business in 1999, fresh from employment as a clerk. She buys her stock from Nairobi, Kisumu and Mombasa markets. Dorcas would like a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to restock her business. Her main plan in life is to achieve self-reliance as a woman.

loans.use: To restock her business

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Мачитиев Дилшод проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Дилшод имеет среднее образование. Он более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Дилшод выращивает оващи и вывозит на рынок. В этой деятельности ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа семян, чтобы посеить и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
26-year-old Dilshod M. lives in the Djalaladdin Rumi region. He is married and has three children. Dilshod has a secondary education. For more than six years, he has been involved with raising crops. Dilshod grows vegetables and sends them to market. His wife helps him in this activity. The loan allows him to buy seeds in order to plant and receive a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick I. K. is 38 years old and married. His wife sells clothes and they have six children whom they hope to give quality education to the university level. His business is located at Kakamega within a busy market. He makes sideboards, beds, sofa sets and tables and sells to mostly the teachers and local businessmen. He has been in this business for the last 12 years and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the increase in price of materials. He also says that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business so customers are not so loyal because they are spoiled by all the choices. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 15,000 to buy more timber, plywood, vanish, and velvet materials to expand business. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase timber, plywood, nails, velvet materials and vanish.

loans.name: Faaofo

texts.en:
Faaofo M. is 57 and married with 9 children (ages 12 - 35).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faaofo has many years of experience in this business.  Faaofo needs a loan of WST $3000 to purchase additional crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2005, Faaofo joined SPBD.    This is her 5th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faaofo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faaofo M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD :http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional  crops to raise

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn S. is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Purok Ipil-ipil, Brgy. Vito, Sagay City.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  Roselyn owns & operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5,000 Php a month.

In 2005, Roselyn joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,500 Php from NWTF. She is now requesting a new loan of 19,500 Php which will be used to purchase fishing equipment such as hooks & nets. The loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Roselyn from NWTF. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Elizabeth Mbodza

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 37 year old widow with five children. She lives in Malindi town where she has owned a retail shop which for three years now. The business earns her a profit of 5,800 Kenyan Shillings (KSH) a month.

Elizabeth was introduced to Kadet by an existing member and she is currently accessing her third loan. She will utilize these funds by stocking the retail shop with 24,000 KSH and sourcing for firewood and charcoal with 8,000 KSH.The proceeds from this loan will enable her build more rentals on her plot and pay school fees. She hopes to expand her investments in rentals and establish a wholesale shop.

loans.use: Stock the retail shop and source for firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Amistad Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento AMISTAD POR SIEMPRE, se encuentra en su 5º  ciclo., es uno D. nuestro grupos mas antiguos y fieles a nuestra institucion ; el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco  esta representada por las siguientes socias:

Como Presidenta esta la Sra. Rosa quien es una persona D. edad, por su responsabilidad y solidaridad con sus compañeras fue elegida la lider del grupo, es casada y tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales 2 son casados y uno sigue viviendo con ella , como negocio tiene la venta D. sandalias en el mercado Santa Barbara, le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes y ella ya venD. hace 20 años, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia para surtir su puesto y asi incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

Como Tesorera esta la Sra.Jhovanna  quien es soltera no tiene hijos es una persona joven y con mucho entusiasmo  y tiene su negocio es la venta D. comida en la puerta D. un Colegio ubicado en la zona sud y que ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos con el dinero del credito comprara insumos para la elaboracion D. sus platos y la Secretaria es la Sra. Prima es casada tiene 4 hijos   y tiene su negocio D. dulces en la puesta del colegio  quien es vecina D. ventas con jhovanna. El dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra D. dulces para surtir su puesto. Todo el grupo sacò para la compra D. mercaderia y asi incrementar su capital D. trabajo. todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurial Bank Amistad Por Siempre (Friendship Forever) is presently in its 5th cycle with our institutions: it is our oldest and most loyal group, composed of responsible and hard-working people. This bank is represented by the following members: Rosa is the President: she is an elderly lady who has been elected leader of the group because she have proven herself to be responsible person and because of the solidarity shone to her teammates. She is married and has 3 children: 2 are married and one still lives with her. She sells sandals in the Santa Barbara market: the business is going very well, she has a lot of customers and has been working there for 20 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products to furnish her stall and so increase her income. Jhovanna is the treasurer: she is single and has no children. She is a young and enthusiastic woman, and for a living she sell meals outsiD. a school in the southern area of the town. She has demonstrated being responsible and accurate with her payments, and the loan she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients to prepare her meals. Prima is the secretary, she is married and has 4 children. She sells sweets and candies outsiD. a school, the same school where Jhovanna works. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sweets and candies to furnish her stall. The whole group has obtained money to buy products and increase their income this way. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cereals and vegetable business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: For more than ten years Charles K., a married Tanzanian entrepreneur, has been operating a bar selling varieties of both soft and alcoholic drinks in Yombo Kilakala ward in Dar es Salaam.  He employs three staff to help him run the business. Earnings from the bar have enabled him to open a guest house and also meet the daily needs of his family.  Charles is now requesting a loan of T.shs 1,200,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Moisés Bismarck

texts.es:
El señor Moisés Bismarck T. A., es casado de 41 años de edad tiene dos hijas adolecentes que estudian la secundaria y primaria respectivamente, viven en un municipio de Masaya, el señor labora como agente de ventas, desde hace 6 años, dando el sostén económico y alimenticio a su familia.

Dentro de sus principales necesidades esta la remodelación de su vivienda, pero sus limitaciones económicas no le han permitido llevar a cabo este proyecto y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento, piedrín,  y cerámicas, esta inversión le acceda a mejorar en gran medida las condiciones en las que actualmente habitan sobre todo que sus hijas se encuentran en un momento en donde demandan mejores condiciones, e independencia por la etapa de vivencia que actualmente conllevan.
texts.en:
Señor Moisés Bismarck T. A. is 41 years old and married. He has two teenage daughters that are in secondary and primary school respectively. They live in the city of Masaya. For the past 6 years he has been working as a salesman to provide for his family. Remodeling his home is among his most pressing needs, but his economic limitations are an obstacle. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy building materials such as sand, cement, gravel and ceramic tiles. This loan will help him to greatly improve his family's living conditions. His daughters are at a time in their lives when they are asking for better conditions and independence.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to remodel his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for cement, iron and labor to finish construction on his house and provide a better environment for his family

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en: Mrs. Fedila C. is from Barangay Bitoon, Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years of age and is married. She is blessed with four children, all of whom are already married and have their own families and businesses. Fedila is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for eight years already and earns approximately 5,000 Php a month. She is also receiving support from her husband and from her children in times of need. In 2008, Fedila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is an active member of PMPC under its Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a loan of Php 25,000. Fedila is now requesting a loan of 5,000 Php as her 4th loan to be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, to save for future use, for loan repayments and insurances, and for possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Samai

texts.en:
Mrs. Samai K. ( in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Sam-oeun K., live on an Island in the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1970 and have five sons and one daughter. 

Samai sells vegetables and meat in her village, while her husband sell mangoes, he buys mangoes on contract for the future season and when mangoes grow big enough he transports them to sell in the market located in Phnom Penh City.  

Samai has asked for a Kiva loan once before. She now is asking for her second loan of $1,000 to continue improving her husband's capital to purchase mangoes on contract for resale and to buy pesticide to prevent destruction of the mangoes by insects.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her husband to purchase mangoes on contract for resale and to buy pesticide to prevent destruction of the mangoes by insects.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc H. P. is 19 years old and has 2 children. She has been running a grocery shop in her village for 2 years. Her business creates very stable income. Having been a client of SEDA for 2 years, she paid her weekly repayments well.
