Currently, she wants to access a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy  more products for her shop to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: to buy more products for her shop

loans.name: Good Hands Group

texts.en:
Sarah F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Good Hands.  She is 29 years old, single, and has four children who are between the ages of 2 and 11 years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For 12 years she has been selling oil and fish in the “Old Road” Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 48,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice and gallons of cooking oil. 

She describes herself as an easy-going woman whose dream is to improve her business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mary is inset at the lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and gallons of cooking oil

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
El cliente Mario Antonio M. Rivas. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peño Barrio Antonio Ivan Ultima Calle al norte casa No.20 del departamento león, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo trabaja actual mente en la alcaldía santa Rosa del peñón desempeña el cargo como Auxiliar de contabilidad.  
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación el cual la quiere mejorar y el destino del crédito es para la mejora de su vivienda.  
El destino del crédito es para la compra de pintura para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Mario Antonio M. R.lives in the Santa Rosa Del Peño municipality in the area of León.  He has 1 child in his care, and currently works in the town of Rosa del Peñón as an accounting assistant.

This client has a home that he wishes to make improvements to, and the loan would be intended for these types of projects.  He would like to buy paint to do some work on his house, which would in turn create a nicer living environment for his family.

loans.use: To purchase paint.

loans.name: Angela Janet

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

E este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela que nos cuenta algo de su vida. Tiene 40 años de edad está casada hace mas de 20 años y tuvo tres hijos de 8 -6 y 2 años, los mayorcitos ya están en escuela. El marido es albañil.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos de paja toquilla, para lo cual viaja todas las semanas a Quito, Guayaquil y Esmeraldas  a entregar a comerciantes de allá sus productos, nos dice que en estas ciudades se queda dos días hasta que le cancelen sus productos. Luego regresa a Montecristi a comprar a artesanos de los Bajos de Montecristi para poder viajar la siguiente semana a otra ciudad. Entre los productos que mas vende están: los sombreros, chocolateras, servilleteros y otros.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mas mercadería ya que tiene varios pedidos que llevar en esta ocasión a Quito. Esta en el Banco Comunal mas de 5 años y le gusta por la ayuda recibida. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The Aníbel San Andrés community bank meets every two weeks in Montecrisi which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are known both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

This is where we meet Angela who tells us something about her life.  She is 40 years old, has been married for more than 20 years and has three children who are 8, 6 and 2.  The older children are already in school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Angela is a merchant who sells products made out of 'toquilla palm' (a native plant) and travels every week to Quito, Guayaquil and Esmeraldas to deliver her products to merchants there.  She tells us that she stays in these towns for two days until she has sold her products.  She then returns to Montecristi to buy from craftsmen in Bajos de Montecristi so that she can travel to another town the following week.  The products she sells include hats, chocolate pots and napkin rings.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise since she has a number of orders right now to take to Quito.  She has been a member of the community bank for more than 5 years and she likes it because of the support she has received from it.

Her dream is to have her own home because right now she lives with her mom.

loans.use: To buy hats, chocolate pots and napkin rings made from 'toquilla palm'

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

She has operated a food stall business for over three years, selling from home to manual laborers constructing houses, to neighbors and to passersby. Fridah faces a challenge of manual laborers taking food on credit and failing to pay. She hopes to build a permanent cafe to provide faster and prompt services to customers.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a sack of rice, a bundle of wheat flour and cooking oil for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu because of its affordable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of rice, a bundle of wheat flour and cooking oil for her food stall

loans.name: Los Claveles (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Los Claveles, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada de esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo. Este es un grupo de  12 señoras y 1 señor que se conocen muy bien ya que este es su quinto ciclo. Se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios).

La señora Mariela es parte de este de este Banco  hace tres ciclos y está muy contenta de haber ingresado en el Banco ya que aquí ha encontrado mucha ayuda por parte de la Fundación Espoir y del Banco comunal, ella se desempeña como fiscal de pagos función que cumple con mucho agrado. Tiene 25 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta tiene tres hijos de 11 – 10 y 4 años los mayores están en escuela, su marido es chofer.

Además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). también vende sabanas y ropa en general, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta o por pedidos, trabaja cuatro días en la semana por las mañanas, sus productos los compra en Guayaquil.

Este crédito ella lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería pero de preferencia en ropa de mujer que es lo que más vende. Su sueño es tener una casa propia ya que donde viven es alquilado.
texts.en:
In the residential area called El Progreso, located in the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank Los Claveles meets every 15 days.  This is a very densely populated, marginal area of the city known as the prison sector, since the Portoviejo women's prison is located here.  The group is comprised of 12 women and one man who know each other very well as this is their fifth year together.  They are involved in different activities such as trade, sales, production and services.  

Mrs. Mariela has been active in this Bank for three years and is very happy to have gotten involved because of all the help she has received from the Espoir Foundation and the communal bank.  She acts as payment inspector and enjoys her work.  She is 25 years old, lives in a common law marriage and has three children from this union, ages 11, 10 and 4.  The older children go to school and her husband is a driver.  In addition to being a homemaker, she also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accesories).  And she sells bed linens and clothing in general.  Her activity involves door-to-door sales or processing orders and she works four mornings a week.  The products are purchased in Guayaquil.  She plans to use this loan to acquire more merchandise, mainly women's clothing which is what she sells mainly.  She dreams of having her own house one day since her family currently lives in a rental property.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, bed sheets and women's clothing.

loans.name: Asernal Group

texts.en:
Fortunata A. is in her late-thirties and is married with four children.  She has had a poultry business for one year.  The business is open from 7.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Fortunata's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy chicken feed and equipment for the poultry business.

Fortunata will share this loan with her loan group Asernal, which has 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

In the picture, Fortunata is 1st on the left second row, in a blue and white dress.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and equipment for the poultry business.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Josphine is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya. She is married and has been blessed with 10 children who are all adults. She has been farming for the last 13 years and sells her milk and bananas to the local market. She mainly depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the needs of her family. 

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her meet the basic needs of her family. Her biggest challenge in this business has been transportation of her products to the market due to bad roads. In future, she would like to acquire more dairy cows and a chuff cutter (grinder for feed) that will help her increase her milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly B., 52 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 6 children. Melly is a farmer, and so is her husband. They own and till their own land to plant and harvest rice crops. Melly makes sure to manage her time between business and family. She makes sure to provide food, clothes and their daily needs.

Melly wants to improve their business and have a stable income for her family. She currently needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. She applied for a loan of PHP 8,000 from CEVI which will be used to buy what she needs for the farm. She is hopeful that this loan will help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kipailoi Ole

texts.en:
Kipailoi Ole N. is 37 Years old. He is  married to Nasieku N. and is the father of four children. Kipailoi is a farmer who has farmed his own piece of land for the last eighteen years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area. This will be his third loan which he is planning to spend on preparing his land to plant maize. Maize has been doing well in the area due to good climatic conditions.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Kipailoi's dream is do large-scale farming and build a rental store. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for maize planting.

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar, 33, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. His son attends school and his daughter goes to a kindergarten. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, and they have been residing at this place for 4 years. 

Mendbayar started making wooden furniture in his backyard in 2007. Mendbayar is a hard-working and active person who is eager to enlarge his business and open his own workshop in the future. He expects more orders than usual due to Tsagaan Sar, the Mongolian traditional New Year, and is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to get more wood and other necessary materials to make more furniture.

loans.use: To get more wood and other necessary materials

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men S. has been earning a daily income by growing rice in the province of Kompong Tom. She and her husband spend most of their time working in the farm field. This family typically earns an average profit of $5 each day in order to meet their family’s need. They are blessed with four single children, two of whom work in the construction field. 

One of Men S.’s children will marry soon, but she doesn’t have sufficient cash to hold the ceremony. To deal with this situation, Men S. would like to ask for loan to add to her personal savings so that she can prepare the wedding ceremony for her child on time.

loans.use: To prepare the wedding ceremony for her child

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his bakery

loans.name: Bethy Elena

texts.es:
Bethy tiene 38 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de sus padres en la parte urbana del distrito de Olmos,  ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella vende por catálogo ropa de mujer y hombre. Visita a sus vecinos y amistades y les ofrece sus productos.  Aprendió esta actividad de su madre, lo que quiere decir que conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y no hay mayor competencia en la zona. Es muy trabajadora y creativa. 

Desea ampliar su negocio y comprar más mercadería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. Espera mejorar sus ingresos para obtener una mejor calidad de vida. Su anhelo es un día crear su propia marca de ropa y tener su propio taller de fabricación.
texts.en:
Bethy is 38 years old and single. She lives in her parents’ house in the urban part of the Olmos district, located in the Lambayeque province more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells men’s and women’s clothing by catalog. She visits her neighbors and friends and offers her products to them. She learned this business from her mother, which means that she knows this area of work perfectly. She has an established clientele and there is no other competition in the area. She is very hardworking and creative.

She wants to expand her business and purchase more merchandise. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN). She hopes to improve her earnings to have a better quality of life. Her dream is to one day create her own clothing line and have her own clothing workshop.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Santa Isabel

texts.es:
Santa Isabel Y. O. tiene 43 años, vive en Union Libre vive con el compañero  y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.   Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada EN EL RECINTO Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas en ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Santa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño comprar terrenos.

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Santa Isabel Y. O. is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband and children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.  She has two children.

The communal bank "V.R.C. NUEVA UNION" is located in Guamayacu which belongs to the Echeandia canton. This farm group mainly grows short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Santa grows corn and rice. She buys her supplies in Comercial Murillo and sells her produce in the same place.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for her corn and rice crops. This financial support helps her meet her needs. She is up against challenges such as plagues, sickness and weather change. Her dream is to buy land.

She enjoys watching television.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchae all kind of cloth and thread for her business

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lamay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LAMAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina; ella es casada y tiene 51 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y fideos entre otros productos, la socia atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y fideos al por mayor.


Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de maíz, tienda de abarrotes, restaurant, negocio de papelería, servicio de taxi y venta de artesanía.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Santa Rosa de Lamay.”  This bank is located in the district of Lamay which is part of the Calca province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Sabina.  She is married and is 51-years-old and has three children.  The member works in her grocery store business and sells much needed products like rice, sugar, milk, oil, and noodles among other products.  She opens from 9am until 9pm.  She would like to expand her grocery store business.  The member is requesting the loan to buy products like rice, sugar, oil, and noodles at wholesale prices.

The other members work selling corn, in a grocery store, in a restaurant, in a stationary shop, providing taxi services, and selling artisan crafts.

The member would like to thank those who are a part of this dream through this medium and promises to comply with making her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, oil, and noodles at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, Lucienne est revendeuse d’ustensile de cuisine, elle  est une femme mariée à un coiffeur et mère d’un enfant. Elle a commencé son activité en 2000 et tout  son commerce d’achat et de revente  se déroule à lomé.Ce  crédit apportera un plus à ce qu’elle a commencé car elle compte  augmenter son actif .
texts.en:
Lucienne is 36 years old, married to a hairdresser, and the mother of one child. 

She sells kitchen utensils. She started this activity in 2000, and her entire business of buying and selling cookware takes place in Lomé. 

She plans to increase her working capital, and this loan will help to bolster her business.

loans.use: to buy pots, plastic plates, and bowls for resale

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en: Maimuna sells paste, onions, bananas and passion fruit. She is 37 years old, married and has 6 children, none of whom go to school. Maimuna took a loan to stock more paste, onions, bananas and passion fruit to sell. She hopes to expand her business, in the future, with the extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more paste, onions, bananas and passion fruit to sell.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 45 years old and married. She has seven children who are aged eight to twenty-two years old; two are not yet in school. Her husband sells sand, which is used in housing construction.

Valerie sells produce such as sorghum, beans and maize. Her business is going well. Valerie’s enterprise has helped to feed her family and educate her children. She is requesting a loan to buy more produce such as sorghum, beans, etc. to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with three children.  Her eldest child is 26. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Aida helps her husband till the land where they grow rice crops. She helps keep the farm free of weeds and pests. Aida also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sell them at the market.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seed and feed. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seed and feed

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar tiene 44 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, el sacrificio y la necesidad le ha brindado a su familia el pan de cada día todos los días.  Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, a quienes le enseña  a trabajar honradamente y ganarse la vida de una manera más humilde. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de llantas, focos y repuestos para su taxi.
texts.en: Julio Cesar is 44 years old. His business is providing taxi services. He has operated this business for more than 16 years. Through his sacrifices, he has provided his family with their daily bread and fulfilled their needs each day. He has 3 minor children in his care, and he is teaching them to work honestly and earn a living in a humble manner. The loan he is requesting is to buy tires, lightbulbs and spare parts for his taxi.

loans.use: to buy tires, lightbulbs and spare parts.

loans.name: Shayne Mae

texts.en:
Shayne Mae is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital for her clothing sales business.
Shayne Mae has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from her food-vending business. Shayne Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 40-year-old single woman with eight children. She lives in her own home in Fort Portal, Uganda. Joan's dream is to educate her children at least to attain diploma level. 
Joan distills and sells alcohol and has been engaged in this business for four years.The major obstacle she faces is customers who get drunk and refuse to pay. Her dream is to rehabilitate her banana plantation where she gets bananas for alcohol distilling – and it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to rehabilitate her banana plantation.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, 47, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a laborer on construction sites. 

Hoa supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater range of products such as sugar, soft drinks and household items to stock her general store.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina vive en un lugar muy bonito en donde ella aprendió a elaborar camisas de mantas, ella es casada y a su responsabilidad tiene a  cuatro hijos.

     Ella es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo en fundación y es para  invertirlo en  la compra  de  mataras para elaborar blusas y camisa artesanales hechas a mano, en esta actividad lleva cinco años y cuatro mese en donde comenta que le va  bien ya que con ello a mejorado  su ingresos económico.

     Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó desde muy pequeña pero lo practicaba muy poco  y hace cinco años se  asocio con otras compañeras para trabajar este tipo de actividad y luego salir a venderlo en la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutiérrez y san Cristóbal y comenta que le va bien.
 
     Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad  pueda seguir trabajando y así tener sus propios a horros para  sacar adelante a su pequeña familia  y así también  tener un lugar especial para trabajar.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina lives in a very beautiful place, where she learned to make shirts from handwoven manta cotton.  She is married, and is responsible for four children.

This is the second time that she has requested a loan from the Foundation, and it is to be invested in purchasing materials to make hand-made artisinal blouses and shirts.  She has been doing this work for the last five years and four months.  She says it's been going very well for her, and that with it she has been able to improve her financial income.

Her inspiration for doing this work began when she was very young, but she wasn't doing it very often.  Five years ago she got together with other partners to do this type of work, and then sell it in the cities of Tuxtla Gutiérrez  and San Cristóbal. She says it has been going very well.

What she most wants to is to be able to continue doing this kind of work, and so have her own savings in order to move her small family ahead in life, and also to have a specific premises for her work.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of handwoven Manta cotton and thread for making fabric shirts.

loans.name: Latyr

texts.fr: Monsieur Latyr  est âgé de 40 ans. Il vit au Sénégal. Il exerce l’activité de maçon  et en meme temps  s’adonne a l'élevage  depuis plus de 15 ans.  C’est après avoir abandonné les  études que Latyr  a choisi la maçonnerie  pour se faire un métier. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2006.  Il a déjà soldé un prêt antérieur. Actuellement il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour gérer les frais de voyage de ses enfants qui doivent partir apprendre le Coran. Ce financement lui permettra de se libérer socialement.
texts.en:
Latyr, age 40, lives in Senegal. He's a mason and, in parallel, has been raising livestock for 15 years. He chose masonry after abandoning his studies, in order to have a job.

He's been a member of UIMCEC since July 2006 and already completed a loan previously. He's now seeking a loan of XOF 150'000 to pay his children's travel expenses to go study the Koran. This loan will enable him to free himself socially.

loans.use: to pay his children's travel expenses

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
Javier Antonio tiene 19 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.

Javier tiene una casa y se dedica a realizar conecciones electricas en Ventanas, el material que necesita para relizar estas instalaciones los compra en Guayaquil. El crédito lo solicita para poder invertir en otro negocio ya que el negocio al que se dedica es de mucho riesgo y lo va ha invertir en compra y venta de calzado para poder obtener mejores utilidades.

El sueño es  comprarse un carro para poder transportar el calzado a los diferentes lugares que visite. Los desafíos al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia.

En los momentos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Javier Antonio  is 19 years old. He is married but has no children. He lives with his wife in Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. The First of May VRC is located in the First of May citadel belonging to Ventanas in the province of Los Rios where people are dedicated to trading work.

Javier has a house and is dedicated to making electrical connections in Ventanas. He buys the material that he needs to make these installations in Guayaquil. The loan he is requesting is to be able to invest in another business since the business he is dedicated to is very risky and he is going to invest in buying and selling footwear in order to be able to obtain better skills.

His dream is to buy himself a car so he can transport the footwear to different places he visits. The challenges he faces daily are the competition. In his free time he likes to spend time with family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase and sale of shoes.

loans.name: Emina

texts.en:
Emina is 53 years old and is single without children. For more than ten years, she has run a shop in Agsu city where she sells clothing for women and children. Emina’s brother helps her to run the business. 

Emina is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase additional seasonal clothing and expand her business. She promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has seven children with all currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a mechanic. Rose operates a business selling charcoal, maize and firewood and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for three years and her primary customers are cafes and neighbors. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. She describes her greatest business challenges to be transportation and seasonality and her largest monthly expense is school fees. 

Rose will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy charcoal bags and build a shelter to cover the firewood. Rose aspires to earn enough capital to open a poultry business in the future. She joined Yehu because of their low interest rates and membership fees compared to other organizations.

loans.use: To buy charcoal bags and build a shelter to cover the firewood.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Teresita has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles, and detergents. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy noodles, canned goods, and detergents.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, and detergents.

loans.name: Norbil

texts.es: Norbil, de 22 años es un joven emprendedor. Vive en compañía de su mamá Emilia su papá Leoncio y sus 3 hermanos menores; en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Huancayo. Como todo joven, tiene planes y los está concretando. Siempre ayudó a su padre en su negocio de compra y venta de sombreros típicos de la zona. Ya cuando comenzó a estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil, en una universidad reconocida; se abrió paso el mismo y con la experiencia heredada, comenzó a vender sombreros de paño boliviano; pero esta vez en diferentes lugares del Perú, como Huancavelica, Huanuco y Bolivia, donde el viaja constantemente. Le va muy bien en su negocio tanto así; que hace 2 meses abrió un pequeño locutorio, donde sus clientes pueden llamar a cualquier parte del país y del mundo, es así que desea invertir más en sus negocios y de esa manera poder apoyar a sus hermanos y terminar su carrera y así ser un profesional respetable. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Conopa” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además agradece la oportunidad que le brinda, razón por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  Norbil, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de sombreros para surtir su mercadería.
texts.en: Norbil, 22, is a young entrepreneur.  He lives with his mother, Emilia, and his father, Leoncio, and three younger siblings.  They live in their own house in the city of Huancayo.  Like all young people, he has goals and is focused on them.  He always helped his father in the business of selling traditional hats from the area.  When he began his Civil Engineering studies at a well-known university he set out on his own with the experience he had gained and started selling Bolivian felt hats.  But he sold them in different places in Perú such as Huancavelica and Huanuco, and in Bolivia, where he travels constantly.  Business is going well for him and two months ago he opened a small telephone services outlet where customers can call any part of the country or world.  He wants to invest in even more businesses so he can help his siblings and finish his education and become a respectable professional.  He belongs to the communal bank "Conopa" and is requesting his first loan through MFP, where he is counting on support to carry out his plans.  His is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.  Norbil plans to use the loan to buy hats to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To buy hats to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Star B2 Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Star B2 Group in Western Kenya!  Silas leads this group as a facilitator. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  Like the majority of people in this part of Kenya, the members of Start B2 Group are farmers who rely on maize for annual food security and income.

Silas takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices offered by the firm and also in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Silas had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Silas was only able to harvest 14 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Silas and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Silas will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Star B2 group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Silas is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 30-year-old married man who has been blessed with two children. For a living, Noel has been engaged in the agricultural business for eight years. He particularly grows rice crops on his farm land. Noel works hard to support the needs of his family.

Noel and his wife do some of the farming activities to minimize their expenses in hiring laborers. However the budget they saved for the next preparation of his rice field is not enough. For this reason, Noel is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy supplies to improve the farm land and growth of rice crops, such as fertilizer and medicines. 

He hopes that through providing complete medicines and fertilizer to his crops, he will gain a plentiful harvest. Noel also prays that he can support the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizer and medicines for his crops.

loans.name: Mwarabu

texts.en:
Mwarabu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a food stall, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. In addition she also operates a boutique, which serves as another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish another boutique business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes and bundles of rice, beans, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and bundles of rice, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mery Carolina

texts.es: Nuestra socia MERY; La socia continua con su pequeño negocio de multi servicios como librería, café Internet y venta de cosméticos. La socia ha ampliado aún un poco mas su local en casa para brindar estos servicios y le esta yendo muy bien, ella desea implementar su tienda multiservicios para dar mejor atención y los clientes encuentren lo que desean. La socia invertira su credito en la compra de mercadería surtida como aretes, pulseras, collares, perfumes, utiles escolares, entre otros. La socia desea a futuro cercano ampliar su negocio o alquilar otra tienda grande para tener una sucursal.
texts.en:
Our member Mery is continuing with her small multi-service business, which consists of a bookstore, Internet café, and the sale of cosmetics. She has expanded her home-based shop a bit more, in order to provide these services, and it's going very well. 

She wishes to set up her store to provide better service, and ensure that customers find what they want. The member will use her loan to buy a variety of merchandise, such as earrings, bracelets, necklaces, perfumes, school supplies, and other things. 

In the near future, she wishes to expand her business, or rent another large store to have as a branch.

loans.use: To buy a variety of merchandise such as earrings, bracelets, necklaces, perfumes, school supplies, and other goods.

loans.name: Maira

texts.es:
Maira de 28 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora, que tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende mercancías variadas y también ofrece servicios de llamadas y de internet, en un punto comercial ubicado en el barrio donde habita, cuyas características hacen de éste, un lugar con un gran potencial de clientes, pues está rodeado de viviendas donde habitan familias, zonas bancarias, centros comerciales, centros educativos y recreativo y en general  espacios lúdicos amplios, donde se integran las comparsas del carnaval en las diferentes épocas y en eventos especiales de la ciudad.
 Su idea de negocio empezó cuando estudiaba y un amigo le prestaba un plan de minutos a celulares, para que obtuviera ingresos y lograra pagar sus pasajes de transportes para ir al centro de educación donde estudiaba. Allí fue logrando poco a poco experiencia y posteriormente agregó a este negocio trabajos por computador, producto también de que Maira,  le hacia los trabajos a sus compañeros de estudios en un quipo de su hermana y ellos le pagaban por esto.  Cuando fue adquiriendo mas pericia compró su propio equipo y con una amiga emprendió un negocio en otro municipio del Atlántico, donde duraron 3 años; como ella simultáneamente trabajaba en una empresa y hacia turnos, no pudo continuar con este negocio y lo abandonó, hasta que dos años después, dejó de ser empleada continuó con su negocio y en el lleva dos años hasta hoy y ha incluido mercancías variadas y juguetería, pues también participa vendiendo  en la feria del juguete, apoyada por su madre y su hermana. Con su negocio Maira se ha sentido satisfecha y su deseo de crecer como emprendedora es inmenso, por eso se ha acercado a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para apoyarse con un capital de trabajo mediante su primer credikiva, con el que comprará juguetería  que venderá y se dará el gusto de ver a los niños muy alegres en la época en la cual les pone regalos el niño Dios. Esta es la razón de su financiamiento y con él tendrá éxito, no solo por su experiencia, sino también porque su inversión está basada   en artículos, que le han solicitado sus clientes a quienes quiere complacer para conservarlos siempre fieles.
texts.en:
Maira is 28 years old and is an entrepreneur. She owns a business selling varied merchandise and also offers telephone and Internet services. She is located in a commercial part of the neighborhood where she lives, and whose qualities make it a great place in regards to potential customers because it is surrounded by homes where people live, there are banks, shopping centers, schools and recreational areas and open spaces and sports fields used also for carnival participants at different times and special events of the city.

Her idea of a business began when she began her studies and a friend loaned her some cell phone minutes from his plan with which she procured income and was able to pay for her transport fares to go to the educational center where she studied.

There she was getting experience little by little and later she added the business of equipment, another venture Maira has. She did some work with her schoolmates on a machine her sister had and they were paid for this. As she gained more experience she bought her own equipment and with a friend she opened a business in another town on the Atlantic, which lasted three years. At the same time she worked in a business on shifts, but she could not continue in this work and quit. Two years later, because of her continuous employment in her work and in the two years until today and having included a variety of goods and toys, she also sells at the toy marketplace, helped by her mother and her sister.

Maira has been feeling satisfied with this business and her desire to grow as a entrepreneur is immense and this is why she has put herself under the wing of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to have working capital through her first Kiva loan which she would use to buy and to sell toys for the pleasure of seeing the very happy children at the time in which presents of the baby Jesus are given. This is the reason for her loan and with it she will succeed, not only because of her experience, but also because her investment is based on items that her customers have been asking for and who she wants to satisfy to keep them always faithful.

loans.use: to buy toys

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en: Bibi is a 42-year-old married woman. She has two children, 9 and 21 years old. She describes herself as honest, responsible, committed, and quiet. She operates rental houses and provides services related to them. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable environment. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the furnishing of the houses. Bibi's business goal is to construct more rental houses within five years.

loans.use: To pay for the furnishing of her rental houses.

loans.name: Azezeh

texts.en:
Azezeh is a 21 year old single woman from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 400 JD pay for children,boys and woman clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors.In the future she would like to open a shop and she hopes to improve her living standard.
Since Azezeh is under a 30 year old,her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Monica; she is in her late thirties and is from Moriba town Bo. She is married with 5 children. She started her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income.

Monica runs a cookery business; she sells cooked food. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business throughout the week from 4:30AM-11:00AM. Her business is the only source of income she has. She say that her business is doing well and customers are coming every day.

Monica has requested a loan in order to purchase more fish, rice, palm oil, and cooking seasoning to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and change her living conditions. In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning to expand her business

loans.name: Sinai Grp Bunda Group

texts.en:
Nyambuli is a mother of two sons and two daughters who are at school. She is in her late thirties, married, and has a shop selling home products. Nyambuli has been in this business for four years now and is able to realize a fair profit each month. She works from 7:00 a.m to 9:00 p.m daily.

Nyambuli is requesting her first loan though Tujijenge Tanzania as a member of of Sinai Grp Bunda Group. The group loan will be apportioned among its five members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Nyambuli will invest her loan to replenish her shop with new products to resell. She would like to build a business house.

loans.use: to replenish her shop with new products to resell.

loans.name: Abla Elise

texts.en:
Madam Abla Elise A., is 52 years old. Her main activity is cereal and yam trading. She is married and in charge of six (06) children and contributes at least 75 % of household expenses as the meager pension of her husband which is paid with months of delay is very insufficient to cover the needs of the family. Very dynamic, she substitutes with that trade, the selling of cooked yams which she sells in the market of Adidogomé. Though, she is illiterate, she has a rigorous sense of management. Her first credits were paid promptly paid back and without any incident; this makes her a woman deserving of trust. So, the credit of $ 850 she requested will allow her to travel to the production areas and make important storage of maize, beans, yam, etc. Granting her financial support is contributing to increasing the volume and profitability of the activities thereby improving her living condition and that of her family.

Madame A. Elise Abla, est âgée de 52 ans. Elle fait du commerce céréales et l’igname, son activité principale. Mariée et mère de famille, elle a 06 enfants à sa charge et contribue à au moins 75% des besoins du foyer car la maigre pension de retraie du mari qui se paie d’ailleurs avec des mois de retard, est très insuffisante pour couvrir les besoins de la famille. Très dynamique, elle substitue à ce commerce, la vente de l’igname frite qu’elle vend dans le marché d’Adidogomé. Bien qu’elle soit analphabète, elle a un sens rigoureux de la gestion de ses activités. Ses premiers crédits obtenus et remboursés promptement et sans incident font d’elle une femme de confiance pour tout concours financier. Ainsi, le crédit de $850 sollicité lui permettra de se rendre dans les zones de production pour faire un stock important de maïs, niébé, igame, etc. Lui accordé des facilités financières, c’est contribuer à accroître le volume et la rentabilité des activités en vue d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: to travel to the production areas and make important storage of maize, beans, yam, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: Tujginoy

texts.en:
The members of this group work in a local farm. Their salary is too small ($10 per month). They use their salary for firewood to heat their house in winter. To support their families, they have their own livestock and rent a piece of land on the farm. There they grow cotton and sell it to the government at a very low price.

All these ladies have families and children. For example, Tujginoy is 44 and has 4 children. One of the main dreams of any Countryman is establishing their own family, having a big wedding and kids. Tujginoy’s two children are married and the main source of income is her business. Their request is for purchasing hogs, to feed them and then to sell.

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita is 51 years old, married, and has 6 children. Jovita currently has merchandise which she sells to the neighbors around her community. With the loan, she hopes to open a grocery store and buy more merchandise (sugar, salt, oil, pastas, etc.). Jovita belongs to the group "Mujeres Trabajando 4." She and María Eugenia Martínez Aparicio are also street vendors, they buy and sell coffee. Jovita would like to invest the loan in buying something that can help her carry her products; this way, the products would be in better shape by the time she reaches her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

JOVITA TIENE 51 AÑOS , CASADA , TIENEN 6 HIJOS . TIENE EN LA ACTUALIDAD UNA CANTIDAD DE MERCADERIA QUE VENDE A SUS VECINOS DE LA COMUNIDAD . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COLOCAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES ES POR ESO QUE COMPRARA MERCADERIA (AZUCAR , SAL , ACEITE, PASTAS , ETC ) .PERTENECE AL GRUPO MUJERES TRABAJANDO 4 JUNTO CON DOÑA MARIA EUGENIA MARTINEZ APARICIO COMPRA Y VENTA DE CAFÉ EN FORMA AMBULANTE , ELLA ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIR COMPRANDO UN IMPLEMENTO PARA TRANSPORTAR MEJOR SUS PRODUCTOS Y ASI LLEGAR CON ELLOS EN MEJOR ESTADO AL LUGAR DE VENTA .

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Grandesio

texts.en:
N. Grandensio is a very hard working lady aged 55. She is a mother of two working boys, and also supports four other young dependants. All four attend, school- one is in Grade 5 while the other three are in secondary school.

N. sells matoke (a plantain banana dish popular in Uganda) and charcoal at Seguku, a small township along the Kampala – Entebbe road. She has been in this business for over 20 years and this has enabled her to educate her two boys and build a commercial building which houses her business.

Her first loan was for $110 and her second, third and fourth loans were for $280. N. uses part of her loans to support her business and part to finishing up the house.

In a good day she earns about $110 selling charcoal and matoke. She provides the kids with scholastic materials, food as well as clothes. She is happy to be helping these children and says it creates a smile on her face because the future is bright for them.

loans.use: She would like to buy 20 bags of cement, three lorry-loads of sand and one metal door to finish construction of her commercial house which will later give her rental income.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Aged 37, Mr. Kossi S. was born in Zafi. Married and the father of nine children, he is also responsible for three other people. Having abandoned school at a very young age, he learned to be joiner. He does not have the means to open a workshop but carries out his trade in a small hardware store that his wife manages. Often faced with stock shortages, he is asking for a loan of $400 to buy hardware supplies (iron, nails, sheet-metal…) in order to increase his purchasing power and help his wife with her work, so that she can help out from time to time. This would allow him to increase his income and send his children to school.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 37 ans, Monsieur S. Kossi est né à Zafi. Marié et père de neuf (09) enfants, il a à sa charge trois (03) autres personnes. Abandonné très tôt les bancs, il apprend la menuiserie. Manquant de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier, il essaie d’exercer son métier et a une petite boutique de quincaillerie que sa femme gère. Souvent confronté à la rupture de stock, il sollicite un crédit de $400 pour augmenter son pouvoir d’achat en faisant le stock des produits de la quincaillerie (fer, clou, tôles…) et aider sa femme à faire quelque chose pour pouvoir l’aider de temps à autre. Cette réalisation lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et assurer la scolarisation des enfants.

loans.use: To stock up on hardware supplies

loans.name: Dildora

texts.en: Dildora M. is married and she lives with her family in Spitamen. She has worked in a bazaar since 2003, and in these five years in clothing sales, she has showed she is very capable of making this a good business. Her quick mind and well-developed business skills has helped her be a success. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to expand her business, which will raise her family's income.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Nadia's Group

texts.en:
I am Nadia Gulam A., from Multan, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. I am a mother of two daughters, both of whom attend a local school. My husband has a fridge and air conditioner repair store. Now, he needs to buy few spare parts for his business and therefore requires a loan.

My group members are: Khalida N., who needs a loan to buy cloth for her stitching business; Saeeda A., who plans to invest in their grocery store; Naziran N., who requires a loan for her son to start up a dry fruits stall; Zarina B., who needs a loan for their fruits business.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for the electronics repair business

loans.name: Namunina A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Robina N.. She is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,100,000 to expand her business. Robina is 38 years old and she is a widow. She has 2 children who are 18 and 20. Each week Robina makes approximately UGX 20,000 in profits. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to start a poultry business.

Robina is joined in her small group by Margret N., Suzan Namiro, Marret Nabbagala, and Gladys N.. Margret N. is currently in the restaurant business. She is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy a refridgerator and furniture. Suzan Namiro is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to re-invest in the stone quary business. Marret Nabbagala is currently in the business of stone quarrying as well and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to add to her stone business. Gladys N. is currently in the restaurant business and is requesting a loan of UGX 300,000 to purchase more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To expand the businesses

loans.name: Rowith

texts.en:
Rowith has a successful business making bed and sofa covers. She runs her business from a room in her house in the neighborhood of Parta Alta in the city of Tarapoto, San Martin. She started the business six years ago after taking a sewing class at a local institute. Her business has grown rapidly. She only uses the highest quality fabrics and materials. She now has many loyal customers and often needs to hire help. Her clients do all the advertising for her.

Rowith is active, organized, and charismatic. She is 44 years old, happily married, and has 4 children. She runs a female volleyball team and is the president of her community bank. She has gained a lot of confidence in the past few years and now has plans to start other businesses. She has just entered another class to learn how to make different types of jewelry and decorations for parties. Her children share her passion for life and are all involved in the community and school.

The president of the community bank Las Orquidias, Rowith is requesting a loan of S/. 3,000 to repay over 6 months. With the loan she would like to buy fabrics, elastic, and buttons.

loans.use: She would like to buy fabrics, elastic and buttons

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.es:
Cayetano R. Díaz is from the Ycua Pai neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is 59 years old with 2 children who are now grown and living independently. His wife, Rogelia Toledo, is 58 years old. She assures us that the happiest man in the world is living by her side.

Cayetano owns a convenience store where he now has a well developed clientele made up largely of people from the neighborhood who come to his store looking for convenience items. He and his wife are beloved in the community and thanks to their good client service the local people prefer to buy what they need in Cayetano's store.

One of his largest projects is the expansion of the room where he sells his products. The expansion would allow him to stock his store with a wider variety of merchandise for sale, including books, which are difficult to find in the neighborhood and would sell well with the large number of students living there. Cayetano and Rogelia are very hardworking people and much loved in the neighborhood.

Cayetano already has a small amount of money saved and he hopes to fulfill his dream of adding books to the store next year. At the moment, he is requesting a loan with which to stock more merchandise, such as sugar, meat, dairy products, baked goods, canned goods, sweets, cleaning products, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Cayetano R. Díaz es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio Ycua Pai, es casado, con 59 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y viven independientemente, su esposa se llama Rogelia Toledo tiene 58 años de edad y asegura que la vida al lado de ella lo hace el hombre más feliz del mundo.

Cayetano posee una despensa en su domicilio particular, donde ya cuenta con una clientela formada especialmente por vecinos del barrio que todos los días acuden a su despensa en busca de artículos de primera necesidad. Son personas muy queridas en el barrio y gracias a su buena atención la gente prefiere comprar en su negocio.

Uno de sus proyectos mas grandes es la de ampliar su salón comercial y así poder surtir de más variedad de artículos para la venta como los de librería, ya que en la zona hace mucha falta, por la cantidad de estudiantes que hay. Son personas muy trabajadoras, y muy queridas en su barrio.

Cayetano ya tiene un pequeño dinero ahorrado y espera cumplir su sueño para el próximo año, en esta ocasión, solicita un crédito para surtir de más mercaderías para su despensa tales como: azúcar, carne, lácteos, panificados, productos enlatados, gaseosas, golosinas, productos de limpieza, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as meat, dairy products, baked good, canned goods, soft drinks, sweets, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Zulfiya V. lives in Dushanbe. She is 31 years old and has a university education. Zulfiya is an economist by profession and works in the Statistics bureau. She will use the loan to remodel her apartment. Without the loan she will not be able to do the remodel. The remodel will improve the living conditions for Zulfiya and her two children. She will pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Вахобова Зульфия живет в городе Душанбе. Возраст 31год. Образование высшее. По специальности экономист. Работает экономистом в Статистическом управлении. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы сделать ремонт квартиры. Для этого она хочет получить кредит , так как без дополнительных денег сделать ремонт она не сможет.Сделав ремонт она улучшит условия жизни себе и своим двум детям. Получив кредит она сможет погасить его в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Remodel apartment

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en: Jalil K. is 53 years old, married and he and his wife raised three children. All of their children are married except one who lives at home. Jalil sells clothing and shoes for women in the local central market which is called “Panjshanbe”. Once a week Jalil travels to the neighboring city Istaravshan to purchase new goods to sell. His younger son (who is pictured in the photo) helps Jalil with the business. Jalil and his son are very polite and open people by nature, and this helps them in their business. For 10 years he has managed to have great clientele. Jalil‘s business is stable and brings the main income, allowing his family to improve their living conditions and make their plans for the future. This year is very important for Jalil as he is going to arrange the marriage of his elder son. For this reason he wants to increase the range of his goods. With this purpose he requests $600 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. The loan will be spent on new summer clothing and shoes for women. Jalil would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in time. Jalil is counting on your help. With your help he can arrange the marriage of his dear eldest son.

loans.use: Jalil would like to purchase of the new clothing and shoes for women in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Comite Esperanza Y Alegría Group

texts.es:
This committee, called “Esperanza y Alegría” (Hope and Joy), was formed when Adelaida R., who had previously been a member of another committee, contacted her neighbors and friends in the Barrio Fátima de Presidente Franco.

The committee is made up of 20 women who are almost all from the same area. Their businesses are: clothing sales, food sales, and cosmetics sales. They also work in house cleaning and have a fixed weekly or monthly income in addition to their extra businesses, which allows them to have a larger income to help out with the family expenses.

The women request loans of 500.00 to 1,100,000.00 Guaranies (Paraguayan monetary unit), each.

The loans are a very important method of investment for their businesses, since in this way they are able to expand and increase their sales. The loan that they are requesting will be used to buy: clothing, items for the home such as jars, trays, and rugs, ingredients necessary for making their foods, costume jewelry, fabrics, threads, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Para la formación del presente comité llamado “Esperanza y Alegría” fue la señora Adelaida R. ex integrantes de otro comité, quien contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en el Barrio Fátima de Presidente Franco.

El comité esta constituido por 20 señoras casi todas de la misma zona las señoras tienen actividades como venta de ropas, comestible, cosméticos y también realizan trabajo como limpiadora de casas y cuentan con un ingreso fijo semanal o mensual además de sus actividades extras, esto le permite tener un mayor ingreso para ayudar con los gastos de la familia.

Las señoras retiran un crédito cada una de entre 500.000 y 1.100.000 guaraníes cada una.

Los créditos son una forma muy importante de inversión en sus negocios, ya que así logran expandir más el negocio incrementando sus ventas. El crédito que solicitan será para comprar ropas, artículo para el hogar como jarras, bandejas, alfombras, además ingredientes necesarios para elaborar sus comidas, bijouterie, telas, hilos, etc.

loans.use: To buy clothing, items for the home such as jars, trays, and rugs,  ingredients necessary for making their foods, costume jewelry, fabrics, threads, etc.

loans.name: Sreyvy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyvy V. lives in Svay Chhuor Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Cheang Pong, are grocers (pictured here). In their business, they face some problems because some customers buy on credit. For this reason, Mrs. Sreyvy V. does not have enough money to purchase more groceries and increase her inventory.

She is asking for a loan so she can purchase more groceries. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions. Mrs. Sreyvy V. is 23 and has a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es:
Hermenegildo is 53 years old, living with his wife and three minor children. He has grown vegetables for more than 40 years, which he fertilizes and waters every morning. His small plots are close to his home, which helps him to care for them patiently. This work takes all day, but because it is close to his home it is not too difficult to care for them. This pleases him because he has more time to spend with his family and his children. The hard part is transporting the products into the cities, because of the scarcity of buses that get to his community. Hermenegildo gets most of his enthusiasm and will to keep going from his family.

He will invest the money in the purchase of seeds and plants, in order to increase his production and therefore his income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Hermenegildo tiene 53 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos menores. Desde hace más de 40 años se dedica al cultivo de verduras, a las cuales cuida y riega todas las mañanas y cuyas chacras están en las cercanías de su hogar, esto le ayuda a abonarlas con mucha paciencia.Esta actividad le toma todo el día, pero como está cerca de su hogar no es tan difícil el atenderlas, lo cual le agrada, porque pasa más tiempo con su familia y sus hijos. Lo difícil es trasportar estos productos a las ciudades, por los escasos carros que llegan a su comunidad. Hermenegildo tiene en su familia la mejor dosis de entusiasmo y esfuerzo para seguir creciendo como familia. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de semillas y plantas, para poder incrementar sus productos y de la misma forma sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and plants in order to increase his agricultural production

loans.name: Dora Elia

texts.es:
DORA ELIA G. S. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home.

LA SEÑORA DORA ELIA ES UNA PERSONA DE RAICES INTEGRAS, CON DESEOS DE SUPERACION, ELLA PERCIBE UN INGRESO MENSUAL MEDIANTE SU PENSION Y A PESAR DE QUE ES UNA PERSONA GRANDE DE EDAD SIGUE TRABAJANDO PARA UNA FAMILIA CUIDANDO A UNAS PERSONAS ADULTAS ENFERMAS, ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA CONSTRUIR UNA BARDA  Y PONER UNA CERCA EN SU CASA YA QUE CON ESTO SENTIRA MAS SEGURIDAD PARA ELLA YA QUE VIVE SOLA.
texts.en:
DORA ELIA G. S. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit. Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families' incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. Dora Elia is a person of integrity with a great desire to get ahead. She receives monthly income from her pension and, despite the fact that she is now of advanced age, she continues working for a family by taking care of some adults who are sick. She is seeking this loan to continue construction on a wall, and also to add a gate in her house since with this she will feel more secure as she lives alone.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall and adding a fence for more security.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
Ana Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Cachuy. Ana Luisa es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 21 y 14 años, el último de sus hijos todavía está en el colegio y dos de sus hijos trabajan. Ana Luisa tiene su negocio desde hace 3 años en la venta de cosméticos de Ebel, Esika y también tiene un carro que lo hace trabajar en el servicio de taxi. Ana Luisa logrado construir el segundo piso de la casa de sus suegros , quienes le dieron esa parte de la casa.

Ana Luisa necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en su carro porque necesita mantenimiento, le va a cambiar las cremalleras. Desde que recibe los préstamos ha mejorado , se ha hecho de un capital para su negocio. Sueña con comprar más carros y formar una empresa.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa is an associate of the Communal Bank "Señor de Chacuy".  Ana Luisa is married with 3 children aged 22, 21 and 14 years. The youngest is still in school and the others work. Ana Luisa has been selling Ebel and Esika cosmetics for 3 years and also owns a car which she uses to provide taxi service.

Ana Luisa managed to build a second floor on her in laws' home and they gave her that part of the house.

Ana Luisa needs a loan of 800 soles ($1 US = 3 Soles, approx.), which she will invest in the maintenance of her car. Since receiving previous loans, her business has improved and she has business capital. Her dream is to buy more cars and form a company.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the maintenance of her car.

loans.name: Bolaji

texts.en: Bolaji is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. Bolaji sells foodstuffs like yams, elubo (yam flour), garri (cassava flour), and melon in her shop. She lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. Bolaji works in her shop from Monday to Sunday. She has been in this business for a long time. Bolaji is asking for a loan of N100, 000 ($850) to increase the inventory she has on hand. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her shop

loans.name: Edarlina

texts.en:
“Competition is a spice in business. And in life, always bear in mind that you can’t be good and determined in your chosen field if you have no one to compete with.” This is the life philosophy of Edarlina G. from Old San Mariano, Isabela, a village situated in the lowland near the Pinacanauan River and frequently covered with water when successive rains occur. 

Edarlina, 49, is married to Vicente G. Jr. and they are blessed with three children: Filimon – 30 years old, married and working as a teacher; Eugine – 29 years old, a college graduate engaged in farming, and Rachelle – 19 years old, a senior nursing student.  

Edarlina operates a village store generating an average weekly income of over $20 which is used to support her family and the needed school allowance of her youngest child. Her needs for additional capital for the store and the maintenance of their farming business are the reasons she is now applying for a loan. 

Her faith in God and determination to succeed has motivated her to persevere and to develop the family’s other business - raising hogs.  The combined incomes of the two enterprises will give them the chance to have a better life and support their child's education.

loans.use: Additional store capital and maintenance of their farming business

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

loans.name: B.d.e.c Home Ecomonics Group

texts.en:
These ladies are staff members of the B.D.E.C. Home Economics Primary school in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. B.D.E.C Home Economics Primary school was founded by Mrs. Rodger K. S. to assist the children of Makeni and its environs, teaching "the art of managing the home and thyself". The school is staffed with twelve teachers, all of whom are female.

They teach pupils who are already in classes five and six from all schools in Makeni and beyond. Each school in town will bring their pupils to B.D.E.C Home Economics on a fixed day of the week for lessons. Among the subjects they teach are: home management; child care; Family and Life Education (F.L.E.); agriculture; clothing and textiles; food and nutrition, and so on.

The school is proud that pupils writing the subjects they teach always come with good grades on the National Primary School Exams (N.P.S.E). Since the school caters for pupils from all primary schools in Makeni and beyond, space has become their great challenge – they only have one building of about six classrooms. To add to their problems, the only toilet they had has been stolen. They are now looking to the government to buy them another, a process that might take donkey’s years.

This is the first loan B.D.EC Home Economics is borrowing from SMT (through Kiva). With this loan, they will be able to do something meaningful. Gradually, they will repay it out of their meager monthly salaries. Teachers are among the lowest paid workers in Sierra Leone, and with such small salaries, they could not do or buy anything big. With a loan, some of them can buy pieces of furniture; some will pay either their children’s school fees or pay for themselves to pursue further studies; others will use their share of the loan to either start building a house or to complete the building process; and others will use theirs in business to supplement their monthly salaries.

Alen F. (middle) is the head teacher of this school. Alen was born in Kamakwe, which is about fifty-five miles from Makeni. She is forty-eight years of age, married with three children. Alen will use her share of the loan to pay her children’s school fees. Once this is done, it will be a great relief to her she told me, for she will not have to scratch her head again over where to get the funds to pay for them.

loans.use: Pay children's school fees and other expenses

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Greetings from Betty U. in Rwezamenyo Sector, Nyarugenge District, Kigali (capital of Rwanda)! Betty is married, 29 years old, mother of 1 child and raising 1 orphan.

She started her business one year ago. She has a fashion shop near Rubangura taxi stop where she makes 45,000 Rwf as monthly profit.

This entrepreneur wants to get a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will help her to expand her business. This loan will be repaid in eight months on a monthly basis. Her present goal is to send all her siblings to school.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Savoeun H., 62, is widowed and has a child who works as a cook in a hospital. She lives in Chreak village in Kampong Cham province and makes a living cultivating rice on a plot of land that she owns. Mrs. Savoeun H. currently needs a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel, in order to make the rice field more productive.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una mujer soltera que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, a sus 46 años siente que todavía tiene las fuerzas necesarias para seguir trabajando, vive en la casa que ella misma consiguió con mucho sacrificio. Tiene un pequeño puesto en un mercado importante de la ciudad de Puno, donde vende pescado a todas las personas que concurren a realizar sus compras diarias, ella es muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa, los cuales compran el pescado que vende con mucha tranquilidad, ya que saben que Francisca es una vendedora muy confiable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de puesto, ya que eso hace más amenas las largas jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 20 años en este negocio y anhela tener un frigorífico donde pueda vender su pescado, sin preocuparse de que se pueda malograr, lo que más le disgusta es que se le pegue el olor del pescado en la ropa, aun así ella está dispuesta a trabajar duro, con tal de mejorar su vida. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. El dinero que solicita será invertido en el arreglo y la mejora de su puesto de venta, para así atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisca is a single woman who has always fought for a better life. At age 46, she still feels she has the necessary strength to continue working. She lives in a home that she obtained herself through lots of sacrifice.

She has a little stand in an important market in the city of Puno, where she sells fish to everyone who passes her by while making their daily purchases. She is very happy and always serves her clients with a smile. They always buy her fish with an easy mind because they know that Francisca is a trustworthy seller.

The thing that she likes most about her job is conversing with her neighbors in the stalls next to her since that makes the long workdays more enjoyable. She brings 20 years experience to this business and longs to have a refrigerator so she can sell her fish and not worry about them spoiling. The thing that she likes least is that the smell of fish gets in her clothes, but she is still willing to work hard with the goal of improving her life.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is willing to pay it on time since she does not want to cause problems for the members of the community bank where she participates actively. The money that she is requesting will be invested in fixing and improving her sales stand, so that she may serve her clients better.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix and improve her sales stand.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Single with five children, Elizabeth makes her living by petty trading and farming. This loan of $225 will be her second from GHAPE (a field partner of Kiva) and will be used to purchase rice, salt, kerosene, groundnut (peanut) and vegetable oil, Maggi (a popular seasoning in Cameroon) and labor for her farm.  

With her hard work and her ability to maintain her savings with interest, Elizabeth is confident her business will continue to succeed.  With this loan, Elizabeth believes that her business will help her community, because she is providing employment and more food to choose from.  

As her business profits from the loan, Elizabeth will be able to pay her hospital bills, buy food and clothes for her family and pigs for her farm, and most importantly, pay for her children's school fees.  Out of her five children, four of them are under the age of fifteen.  The ability to pay for these costs helps Elizabeth and her family, especially since they have faced some of life's challenges, such as the deaths of loved ones and the typical hardship of being a single mother.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account, and most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Rice, Salt, Kerosene, Peanut and Vegetable Oil, Seasoning and Farm Labor

loans.name: Luavalu

texts.en: Luavalu I., 31, is married with five children.  She has many years of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells to the villagers and public, two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 tala (~$115 US).  SPBD loans are Luavalu’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks

loans.use: To purchase kava bowls, fine mats, tapa cloth, earrings and other Samoan handicrafts

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.fr:
L’Association Victoire est  crée en 2008 et regroupe trois femmes dynamiques du quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elles mènent des activités génératrices de revenus différentes mais ont mis en commun leur force financière. La première vend des produits pharmaceutiques, la seconde fait la restauration et la troisième vend des produits cosmétiques.  Leur objectif premier est travailler pour dégager un minimum de revenu afin de contribuer modestement aux dépenses de leur famille.
A la création de l’association, ses femmes avaient pris un crédit pour débuter leur activité et avaient bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit que les femmes de l’association Victoire sollicitent leur permettra de s’approvisionner avec deux cartons de produits pharmaceutiques, trois sacs de maïs et quatre cartons de produits cosmétiques.
Ainsi avec le revenu de ces ventes, elles pourront aider leur mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
