texts.en:
Association Victoire was created in 2008 and brings together three dynamic women of the Hédzranawoé district in Lomé. They do different work to earn an income but have pooled their financial might. The first woman sells pharmaceuticals, the second one is in the restaurant business, and the third sells cosmetics. Their first objective is to work to earn a minimal income, so as to help modestly with family expenses. When the association was created, the women had taken out a loan to start working, and it was repaid. This second loan the association members are requesting will enable them to stock up with two boxes of pharmaceuticals, three sacks of corn, and four boxes of cosmetics. Thus, with the revenues from these sales, the women will be able to help their husbands to meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, corn, and pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Marbelly Dayana

texts.es: La Señora Marbelly M. tiene 29 años de edad, su casa de habitación situada en el barrio Villa Nueva en la capital de Managua, en donde vive con su acompañante de vida e hija de tres años de edad. Trabajar con esmero y crecer como persona son base importante para superarse en la vida y razones de mejora las condiciones de su vivienda. Doña Marbelly se desempeña como secretaria en una empresa privada pero también aprovecho las oportunidades y coloco su venta de cosmético, ropas y otros productos. Iniciando por sus mismas compañeras de trabajo, ahora tiene mas clientes ya que ha sido recomendara con otras personas por su buena atención y la calidad de su producto. Aumentar sus inventarios y sus ganancias con nuevas mercaderías. Gracias al préstamo que solicito en Afodenic lograra comprar cosméticos, perfumerías y artículos del hogar. Lo cual espera crecer en ventas y captar mas clientes.

loans.use: Comprar cosmetico, y ropa

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
ROSA F. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES VALIENTES” vive en el Distrito de Calleria, tiene 61 años, 6 hijos mayores y su esposo es obrero.

Ella  tiene una bodega y el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que invirtió en la compra de algunos abarrotes para surtir su pequeño puesto y desde hace 4 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos su negocio ha ido creciendoo cada vez más y por eso ha sido necesario subir el monto de sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para surtir su tienda y de esta manera dará mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da y con la ayuda que da a las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Rosa F. S. belongs to the "Mujers Valientes" communal bank and lives in the District of Calleria. She is 61 years old, has 6 adult children and her husband works as a laborer. She has a store and the first that she received from the Manuela Ramos organization was 300 Nuevos Soles, which was invested in the purchase of groceries to stock her small store. In the 4 years that she has been working the Manuela Ramos organization her business has grown larger and larger and for this reason she finds it necessary to increase the amount of her loans. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in the purchase of more products to stock her store to be able to provide a better service to her customers. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and for the help it provides to the women of the region.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to stock her store

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy N., 29, and her husband, Mr. Leanseng Hun, 30, were married in 2000 and have just one young son. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Channy has been selling vegetables for three months. She buys them from farmers in her village for resale in the Phnom Penh market. Mr. Leanseng Hun has been driving a motor taxi for two years. He drives in Phnom Penh as well. The motorbike is old and doesn’t work properly; therefore Channy is applying for her first loan of $600 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one for her husband to continue his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora U. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 55 years old. Teodora is separated and has two adult children. To make a living, Teodora owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling bread and cosmetic products in the local community. Teodora has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Teodora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teodora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Teodora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Teodora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell at her general store

loans.name: Julie-Ann

texts.en:
Julie-Ann A. is from the village of Sto Niño, Tukuran, Zambonga Del Sur. She is 28 years old. Julie -Ann is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Julie-Ann owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, selling fish. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish in the local community. Julie-Ann has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Julie-Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie-Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Julie-Ann is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Julie-Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: This is Erlinda A., a 47-year-old fruit vendor from Silang, Cavite. Her husband, Virgilio, 54, is a farmer and a part-time driver. They have six children, three of whom are already earning a living and helping their other siblings with their school expenses (as such is the custom in the Philippines). Erlinda has a fruit stand along the National Highway. She buys fruit from farmers and traders and sells them to locals and foreign tourists who frequent their place. She earns a net income of P20,000 a month. She uses her profits for the education of her children and for the daily basic needs of her family. Erlinda has been in the business for two years. She started it just when she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She is now on her 8th loan. Erlinda needs a loan of P15,000 as additional capital to expand her business. She dreams of buying their own passenger jeepney (a small bus) for her husband. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a member of Mgodi North borrower group  in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is 24 year old woman, she is married.

Teresia has owned a salon business for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a  monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian  shillings.


This is Teresia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Commodities for  her business.


With the  additional  profit she gains from the use of this loan, Teresia  hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for salon

loans.name: Jak

texts.en:
Jak A. is 39 years old and married to a peasant. She has two school-aged children. Jak is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: La señora Natividad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y es madre de 01  hijo, que aun depende de ella.Natividad, es una mujer perseverante, eficiente y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de pasamanerías, ubicado en el Mercado Nº 01, en un puesto muy bien acondicionado. En la actualidad, le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. Su espíritu luchador, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará  arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de pasamanería y mercadería de ropas.Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.

loans.use: Comprará pasamaderia, abarrotes y mercaderias de ropas.

loans.name: La Providencia Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama La Providencia porque asi se llama la comunidad en donde viven.  Las UDEs son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunir semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.  La Providencia se encuentra en el estado de Veracruz.  El grupo está conformado por  15 integrantes.  

El representante del grupo se llama Luis Marcial C. H..  Luis Marcial es soltero, tiene 27 años, vive con su padre que es tambien es integrante del grupo y estudió hasta la Universidad.  Él se dedica a la venta de ropa deportiva como los tenis, pantalones y shorts y necesita el préstamo para comprar mas ropa y otras cosas deportivas.  El tiene un local fisico en el centro de su comunidad y por eso sus clientes son toda la gente que pasa por ahi. El decidio iniciar este negocio porque acaba de regresar de los Estados Unidos (Riverside, California) y un amigo le segurio este negocio. Su amigo no tenia el dinero para poder comenzar este negocio. Luis Marcial desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, ya que quiere en un futuro un local mas amplio o incluso en otra comunidad. Como presidente espera que todos los negocios de sus compañeros tengan exito.

Lucia V. C. es parte del comité de este grupo, La Providencia.  Ella tiene 30 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, y tiene 1 hijo.  Ella se dedica a la venta de jeans (levis), camisas, blusas y ropa en general para toda la familia y necesita el préstamo para comprar mas mercancia y comprar sandalias.  Sus clientes son sus vecinos, ella los visita casa por casa. Desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio y poder comprar muebles para su hogar propio.

Los otros 13 integrantes se llaman son:
JESUS C. G.-Equipo de sonido para su negocio de musica.
MERCEDES B. L.-Venta de refrescos.
ROSENDA L. B.-Venta de cosmeticos.
JOVITA H. L.-Venta de dulces.
SUSANA O. O.-Venta de velas aromaticas.
PILAR T. M.-Venta de calzado.
MARCOS L. C.-Venta de pollo.
MARIA ESTELA D. T.- Venta de calzado.
TERESA O. O.-Venta de ropa.
FRANCISCA A. R.- Venta de calzado.
ELENA C. M.- Venta de pollo.
VICTOR F. C.- Venta de ropa.
ROSALBA M. M.-Venta de dulces.
texts.en:
This Development Cooperative is called La Providencia because that is the name of the community in which they live. Development Cooperatives are groups of more than ten people who have a bank account and have to meet weekly or biweekly to make their payments. They have a representative and a governing committee. La Providencia is located in the state of Veracruz. The group is comprised of 15 members. Luis Marcial C. H. is the group’s representative. Luis Marcial is 27 and single. He lives with his father, who is also a member of the group. He has a high school education. He sells sports clothes like tennis shoes, pants, and shorts. He needs a loan to buy more clothes and other sporting goods. He has a fixed location in the center of his community. Therefore, his customers are all of the people that pass by that location. He decided to start this business when he had just returned from the United States (Riverside, California). A friend suggested this business. His friend did not have the money to be able to start this business. Luis Marcial wants this loan to expand his business. In the future, he would like a larger location or even one in another community. As the president, he hopes that all of the other businesses of his colleagues are successful. Lucia V. C. is part of the governing committee of this group, La Providencia. She is 30, has a middle school education, and has one child. She sells jeans (Levi’s), shirts, blouses, and general clothes for the whole family. She needs a loan to buy more merchandise and to buy sandals. Her customers are her neighbors. She visits them by going door to door. She wants this loan to expand her business and to be able to buy furniture for her own home. The other 13 member are: JESUS C. G.-Sound equipment for his music business MERCEDES B. L.-Sells refreshments ROSENDA L. B.-Sells cosmetics JOVITA H. L.-Sells sweets SUSANA O. O.-Sells scented candles PILAR T. M.-Sells footwear MARCOS L. C.-Sells chicken MARIA ESTELA D. T.- Sells footwear TERESA O. O.-Sells clothes FRANCISCA A. R.- Sells footwear ELENA C. M.- Sells chicken VICTOR F. C.- Sells clothes ROSALBA M. M.-Sells sweets

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: Sieng P. currently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She usually saves up many sets of baskets before selling. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weaves baskets too. Sieng P. is taking out her loan to buy a small neighboring plot of land in a good location for her to cultivate crops to raise income.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of land to cultivate crops.

loans.name: Bartolo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Bartolo José Hernández A., labora como encargado del mantenimiento y limpieza en el mercado Roberto Huembé Managua, el tiene a su cargo seis  hijos de los cuales cuatros se encuentran en edad escolar,  es soltero, ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante tres años, en ese lapso ha invertido   en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los  Créditos otorgados que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para el reforzamiento de las paredes de la vivienda en que habita, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Bartolo José Hernández A. is employed by the maintenance department of the Roberto Huembé Managua market. He is a single father and has six children, four of whom are school-age. He has had loans with Ceprodel for three years and he has used the financing to make home improvements; he has proven to be an excellent client. The financing requested will be used to buy building materials to reenforce the walls of his dwelling so that his children will have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut P., 45, is married and lives with four children in the Takeo province. She sells vegetables at the local market to earn approximately US$2 of profit every day while her husband grows watermelon. On average, he earns about US$1 a day. Four of the children are students. Khut P. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike so that she can transport vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Victoria es casada, tiene 38 años, Victoria vende comida de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su sobrina. Además viaja a las ferias de donde compra animales menores.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gallinas y cuy.
El sueño de Victoria es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Banco Comunal Fraternidad. Victoria is married and is 38 years old. Victoria sells food as she walks through the Magdalena market, an activity she carries out every day with the help of her niece. In addition, she travels to village markets where she buys small animals. Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of hens and guinea pigs. Victoria's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana H. is currently in the business of selling various types of foodstuffs in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs and crates of sodas to sell. Diana is 19 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. 

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs and crates of sodas to sell

loans.name: Alice Nabwire

texts.en:
Alice Nabwire O. is a 46-year-old woman who runs a fish business in the Malanga market, Busia district. She is married and the mother of five children. She started her fish business in 1996 as a source of income generation and a source for school fees for the children, she says. Her fish is bought twice a week from Port Victoria, about 80 kilometres from Malanga. 

She would like a loan of 20,000 KES which she says will go toward increasing her stock base. Her future plan is to venture into rental houses.

loans.use: Expand fish stock base.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia H. is from the village of Santa Ines, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Rosalia is married and has 7 school-aged children.

To make a living Rosalia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. Rosalia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Rosalia joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosalia is requesting her 6th loan from HSPFI, for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Marie Thérése

texts.en: Marie Thérése N. is 42 years old and lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and the mother of four children. In the 12 years she has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP she has always paid back her loans in time. Her activity consists of raising animals which she sells at the grand market of nearby Bambey. With this loan, she will purchase new cattle and sheep to raise. The earnings from her activity allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and sheeps

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta S. is 42 and married with 4 children (ages 12 - 25).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Eseta has 1 year of experience in this business.  Eseta needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

In 2010, Eseta joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Eseta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Eseta S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.65 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo G. is from the village of Brgy.Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Neuva Vizcaya. He is 39 years old. Eduardo is single. Eduardo owns & operates a tricycle transportation service. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Eduardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair his vehicle in order to offer better service. He is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a new motorcycle unit. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eduardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle unit

loans.name: Roland

texts.es: Roland es soltero, vive con su hija de 8 años en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su madre, hermana y sobrina. Hace más de 11 años instaló una tienda en un pequeño espacio dentro de su casa, en donde ofrece productos necesarios para el consumo humano. Desde entonces su actividad empieza desde muy temprano, atendiendo a sus clientes y cada 2 semanas se va a comprar su mercadería de acuerdo la cantidad de productos que necesita. Por otro lado, Roland ejerce la profesión de docente, por lo que su madre y su hermana, lo ayudan con la atención de su tienda, mientras que el trabaja en el colegio. Tiene en mente continuar trabajando de esta manera y abastecer de más productos su tienda. Este es su crédito número 22 con MFP, por lo que tiene muchos años de experiencia siendo parte de su grupo comunal, además es muy responsable con sus pagos, y sabe que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos básicos.
texts.en:
Roland is single, and he lives with his eight year old daughter in his own house. They live with his mother, sister, and niece. Over 11 years ago he set up a store in a small space in his house. He sells basic needs products for human consumption. He starts work very early waiting on his customers. Every two weeks he goes to the market to buy the quantity of products that he needs. Roland is also a teacher. His mother and sister help him take care of the store while he works at the school. He plans to continue working this way and to stock his store with more products. This is his 22nd loan with MFP. He has many years of experience being part of his communal bank. Also, he is very responsible with his payments. He knows that this loan will be very useful to the progress of his business. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy basic products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products to supply his store

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las hormiguitas está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, decididas y trabajadoras una de ellas es  Dayanira Esther A. L. quien vende fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida fritas y sopas de res, mondongo, de albóndigas, de queso y de pescado.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Blanca Rosa A.  R. quien vende ropa y cosméticos, Blanca Félix M. O. quien es propietaria de una pulpería y María Aurelia García tiene una pequeña venta. Ellas el préstamo lo invertirán para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Las Hormiguitas" (Little Ants) group is made up of four hard-working, dedicated women. One of them is Dayanira Esther A. L. who sells fritanga [a popular eatery serving fried snacks, beef soup, mondongo (tripe and vegetable soup), meat ball soup, corn chowder, fish stew]. Her fellow group members are: Blanca Rosa A. R. who sells clothing and cosmetics, Blanca Félix M. O. who owns a grocery store and María Aurelia García who has a small store. They will use the funds to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For basic grains, cheese, spices, vegetables, meats, etc.

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Women's Group, Mityana

texts.en:
In business, striking a first impression chord with your prospective or existing customers is one sure way of ensuring not only short-term but also long-term success. This is exactly the philosophy that 41-year-old K. Edward has used for the last five years to establish a niche for his business selling produce in Nalukolongo, Mityana.

This affably welcoming married father of three now reckons his long-term success is on the horizon, given the short-term hurdles he has overcome and the reciprocal relationship he has with his clients. This common cause he shares with his clients has enabled his business to make strides. This is manifested in the 280,000 shillings he makes monthly.

All of Edward’s three children and two dependents are in school. With this loan, Edward wants to buy more produce like maize, groundnuts (peanuts) and beans.

loans.use: To purchase more crops like maize, beans, cassava and millet to sell

loans.name: Nicacio

texts.es: El Sr. 	Nicasio M. Pérez, es albañil  y esta solicitando este préstamo por que requiere hacer el enjarre de su vivienda,  y necesita comprar el material necesario ya que el no cuenta con la solvencia económica por que no ah tenido mucho trabajo últimamente, el Sr. Nicacio de antemano agradece la ayuda que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Nicasio M. P. is a mason and is requesting this loan because he needs to plaster his home, and needs to buy the necessary material. He does not have the economic resources because he has not had much work lately. He thanks you in advance for the help that you can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plaster his home

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants, elle est aussi tutrice de 07 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des tiers. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOULATA depuis le 01é décembre 2009, elle n’a qu’une année d’existence dans le Banc Villageois et y a fait des performances remarquables en matières mobilisation d’épargnes. Elle est vendeuse de chaussures, de vêtements et de parfums. Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises (vêtements, parfums et chaussures) Elle a comme objectif soutenir ses enfants dan leurs études tout en augmentant son épargne.
texts.en:
Mariama D. is a 40-year-old woman, married, and the mother of six children. She is also the guardian of seven other children, who are entrusted to her by third parties. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SINTHIANG HOULATA since December 1, 2009. She has been with the Banc Villageois for only a year and has a remarkable record there with regard to her savings rate. Mariama is a seller of shoes, clothing, and perfumes. With her new loan, she is going to boost the level of supplies of merchandise (clothing, perfumes, and shoes). Her goal is to support her children in school while increasing her savings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and reselling shoes, clothing, and perfurmes

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita A. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: hog raising and a pedicab business. She lives in Purok 1, Barangay Albiga, Siaton, Negros Oriental. Teresita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her hog raising and pedicab businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 9,000 a month. Teresita is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can add to her working capital and sustainably operate and expand her businesses. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Teresita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva and become a part of our team.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Blanquita

texts.en:
Blanquita B. is from the village of Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 53 years old and married with one adult child. Blanquita owns a fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for 28 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Blanquita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase an engine and fishing materials. Blanquita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Blanquita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
       
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and as working capital.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita S. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old, is single, and has two adult children. Pacita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Pacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ngô

texts.en:
T.  Ngô Thị (20206030028) is a 33 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. T.  owns and operates a business raising livestock for sale. T.  has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from it.

In 2009, T.  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T.  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to invest in expanding the business. T. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by T. from SEDA. T.  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T.  Ngô Thị (20206030028) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T.  Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  T.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T.  kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, T.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T.  đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T.  dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. cooks red-red (rice and beans) at Elmina for sale. She has received junior high education. She is divorced and has two children and is responsible for the wellbeing of her family.

Ama’s loan will be used to buy bags of rice and beans and other ingredients to prepare for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save in order to cook other foods to bring variety into her sales.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and beans and other ingredients to prepare for sale

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan José R. es un transportista que habita en el Municipio del Viejo.
El va a utilizar el credito para comprarle  llantas al bus ya que el tiene un contrato con el Ingenio Monte Rosa y necesita brindarle un buen servicio a los trabajadores del Ingenio.
El Sr. R. ha tenido un total de 19 créditos con CEPRODEL,  los cuales todos los cancelado en tiempo y forma, y manifiesta sentirse muy agradecido con la Institución por todo el apoyo que se le ha brindado y espera seguir trabajando con la Institución por mas tiempo.
texts.en:
Juan José R. is a bus driver and lives in the municipality of El Viejo.

He will use the loan to purchase bus tires because he has a contract with Ingenio Monte Rosa and he needs to provide good service to the workers at Ingenio.

Mr. R. has had a total of 19 loans with CEPRODEL, which he has paid correctly and on time. He says that he is very appreciative of CEPRODEL for all of the support that they have provided to him and he hopes to continue working with them in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bus tires.

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos is sixty-seven years old.  She lives with her husband in the district of Tambogrande, a rural area which has a high level of agriculture.  They manage a stable home and are happily married.

Santos raises sheep in the back yard of their home.  Her husband manages two agricultural plots, one which the family owns and plants in lime and mango, and another which is owned by a friend who is unable to take care of the property and therefore pays him to care for it.

Santos is requesting the loan in order to purchase additional feed for her animals.  She hopes to be able to realize a good price due to the bulk price and be able to promote their growth.  This business is a significant portion of the familial income and a good method of stabilizing their income throughout the no-harvest months.

loans.use: Purchase additional feed for her sheep

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph wants a loan to purchase soft drinks, beer, waragi (a local brew) and general merchandise for selling at a profit. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a semi-permanent house where he lives with his wife and seven children. He dreams of educating his children, building a permanent house and adding wholesale items to his retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, beer, local brew and general merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina E. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Mahayahay, Brgy. Daan Lungsod, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: Pig Fattening and Fishing businesses. Her husband Arnel E., who is 39 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have 4 children who are 8 to 17 years old with two of them already working while the other two are currently going to school.

 Cristina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cristina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,800, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Cristina E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.   

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on  a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel S. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 34 years old. Ethel is married and has six children. Her eldest child is 17 years old and the youngest is only 4. To make a living, Ethel owns and operates a restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. 

Ethel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ethel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ethel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase rice, meat, vegetables and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, meat, vegetables and other supplies

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen V. is 30 years old, married and has two children. He lives in Ijevan. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children while Karen and his parents are engaged in selling fruits and vegetables, which they have done since 2001.

Karen buys fruits and vegetables from Yerevan and other Armenian villages and also from Georgia. He sells them in the Ijevan market by himself and distributes them to other stalls in the market as well. In this way he supports his family.

Karen is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy tomatoes, cucumbers, oranges, mandarins and grapefruits, which he will sell during the New Year’s holidays.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for the upcoming holidays

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: The man shown in the picture is Mr. Suong A., 42, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches around 10 kg of fish per day and sells it in bulk to his customers, who are retail sellers in the market. His wife’s name is Naiy; she is 40 and works with him in the fishing business. This couple is blessed with four children, three of whom are single, and the other one of whom is married and also earning a living as a fisherman. Mr. Suong A. will use his loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.

loans.name: Dmytro

texts.en:
Dmytro, who is single, lives and works in Ivano-Frankivsk. For the past 2 years, he has owned a store called ‘Auto Skhid’ (Auto East), selling spare car parts, in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. There are basically no competitors in this neighborhood, which promotes the growth and expansion of Dmytro’s business. His monthly income amounts to 8,000 UAH.

Dmytro’s vehicle parts sales business is his main source of income. Dmytro is requesting a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase additional spare parts for vehicles manufactured in Korea and China. One of his big dreams is to accumulate enough savings to be able to buy his own housing in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for Korean and Chinese vehicles

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil, bags of rice, liquor, milk, sardines, candy, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana M. is a married woman who lives in Daan Bantayan, Cebu. Her husband, Mario, who is 45 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have three children who are between 18 and 24 years old. 

Susana earns her living by operating a general store
. 
Susana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Susana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 6,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, with which she intends to buy stocks of goods for the store to sell so that she can continue to save up for future improvements to her house and for the education of her children. 

Susana is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make snacks and delicacies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more local food for resale

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. is married to an electrician and they have two children. She has completed her junior high education. For the past six years, Abena has been a fishmonger and she makes a living selling fish in Abrafo, a village near Abura. 

In order to move her business to the next stage, Abena needs to build cold storage to preserve her fish longer. As a first step toward that goal, she needs to boost her sales. Abena is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of fish to sell. She will use the profits from her loan to save for her cold storage.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of fish to sell

loans.name: Nkaiwatei

texts.en: Nkaiwatei S. K. is 23 years old, single, and supports his parents. He has been a farmer for the past four years with a monthly income of  5,000 KES.   He repaid his previous loan in good time. He is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs. With the profits generated he plans to expand farming and venture into the livestock business.  Nkaiwatei dreams to earn more money. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Armando De Jesus

texts.es:
Armando, reside en San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, es agricultor, siembra maíz y vende leña, vive con su madre y su hermano, Armando trabaja como vigilante de una agencia de cable de televisión en Santa Rosa de Lima.
Él va a iniciar la siembra de maíz, para lo que solicita un préstamo y poder obtener los fertilizantes necesarios para llevar a cabo la siembra.
Su objetivo es trabajar, ahorrar y tener una mejor solvencia económica para algún día comprar su propia casa.
texts.en: Armando lives with his mother and his brother in San Carlos, department of Morazán.  He is a farmer who plants corn.  He also sells firewood.  Armando works as a security guard for a cable television agency in Santa Rosa de Lima.  He is going to begin planting corn and is requesting a loan to buy the fertilizer needed for planting.  His goal is to work and save in order to have better financial standing to one day purchase his own home.

loans.use: buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Lampeshua Ole

texts.en: Lampeshua Ole M. is 46 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. For the last eight years, he has made a living by growing wheat and by raising sheep and goats. He learned about KADET LTD through our staff, has successfully repaid his first loan and is applying for a second loan, for KES. 50,000, to prepare his land for planting and to buy sheep and goats to raise and later sell for a profit. He plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to educate his children. His long-term goal is to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to prepare his land for planting and buy sheep and goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Gulbarchyn's Group

texts.en:
Gulbarchyn is the leader of this group. She is 34 and is married to a farmer. Together they bring up three daughters and two sons. The daughters are at school while the sons are of preschool age (under seven). To earn money to meet the family budget, Gulbarchyn opened a kiosk near the house and started to sell convenience goods. She started with the initial investment of 30 000 soms and now her monthly profit is 10 000 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to increase product turnover. With the loan Gulbarchyn wants to purchase one pack of sugar, three packs of macaroni, ketchup, soda and other goods. In the future she plans to start building a nice grocery store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as sugar, macaroni and soda

loans.name: Dushyigikirane Cb Group

texts.en: Jeanne, standing fourth from the right, is the president of Dushyigikirane CB — a Kinyarwanda word that means "let's support each other." Jeanne is 28 years old and has three children between four months and seven years old. Her two eldest children are in school. Jeanne sells goats and has done this business for four years and it is doing well. The majority of the other group members have small shops where they sell items that are commonly used at home such as soap, tea leaves, etc. Jeanne is requesting a loan to buy more goats for sale from which she expects to make profits. With the profits, together with her savings, she plans to build her own family house

loans.use: To purchase goats.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun (pictured here) sells kitchenware and household tools. She buys them from Takhmao market, approximately five kilometers from her house and sells them in her village. In addition, she is also a rice farmer. 

Aun is asking for a loan of $700. She will use a part of the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm, and also buy more kitchenware and household tools for resale.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Alberto José

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Alberto José    se desempeña como técnico en perforación de pozo labora desde hace veinte año es una persona  casado tiene a su cargo cinco persona, honesta, responsable, con buenos valores y principios  morales. 

A esta oficina de ceprodel se presento  a solicitar crédito que será utilizado en reparación del techo de su vivienda que está en mala condiciones, comprar materiales de construcción de materiales como cinz, perlines y  pago de mano de obra  y agradece a ceprodel la oportunidad que le abrindado con este desembolso.
texts.en:
Alberto José is from the city of Managua.  He works as a Well Drilling Technician.  He’s been working for twenty years.  He’s married and has five dependents.  He is honest, responsible with good values and moral principles.

He came by this Ceprodel office to request a loan that will be used to repair the roof on his house which is in poor condition.  He will buy building materials and supplies like:  zinc metal sheeting, purlines and will pay labor costs.  He thanks Ceprodel for the opportunity this disbursement has provided him.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is 38 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 
Almira has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase blouses, pants, slippers, body lotion etc. to sell to customers. Almira has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, slippers, body lotion etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elodie Christianne

texts.fr:
Femme mariée de 39ans et mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varient entre 11 à 15ans. elle débute son activité de vente de sous vêtement(jupon et slip) en 1995 avec un capital de 100.000frs, elle s'approvisionne dans les boutiques de la place et parfois chez les commercants qui viennent de l'Afrique de l'Ouest . ses  ventes journaliere sont de 15000 à 20000fr.
Avec ce prêt elle va acheter ses sous vêtements tel que des maillot de bain, des sous vêtements pour dames, jeunes filles et hommes et des jupons.

Sa strategie est de chercher les produits a la mode et faire  des prix abordables. son souhait est d'accroître dans son activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de mieux sa famille.
texts.en:
A married mother of 3 children whose ages range from 11 to 15, this woman began her business selling undergarments (petticoats and women's underwear) in 1995 with 100,000 Fr worth of capital. She gets her supplies at local stores and sometimes from the merchants who come from West Africa. Her daily sales range from 15,000 to 20,000 Fr.
With this loan, she is going to buy undergarments such as swimsuits, underwear for ladies, young women, and men, and petticoats.

Her strategy is to find fashionable products and sell them at affordable prices. Her hope is to expand her business in order to better provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy undergarments.

loans.name: Ramiro Epifanio

texts.es:
Ramiro de 45 años cuenta con mucho orgullo que quien le heredó su profesión fué su padre. Negocio que ha solventado sus necesidades. Dice que no hace mucho esfuerzo para conseguir clientes ya que ellos mismos se encargan de referir su buen trabajo y así tienen mas ingresos y reconocimiento.
Como todo negocio si no tiene la materia prima para producir se le dificulta el trabajo. Su trabajo requiere máquinas especiales las cuales espera poder comprar en el futuro con un préstamo.
texts.en: Ramiro is 45 years old and is very proud of the profession that was passed on to him by his father.  His business enables him to meet his needs.  He says that it does not take much effort to obtain customers because he gets referrals as a result of doing a good job.  This helps him gain more income and recognition.  Like all businesses, Ramiro does not have materials to be productive, which makes his job difficult.  His work requires special machines, which he hopes to buy in the future with a loan.

loans.use: to buy wood, lacquer, paint, and glue.

loans.name: Joel De Jesus

texts.es: Joel  de 45 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 14 años; allí desde el año 2009 tiene un negocio llamado “Tienda el paisa”, donde vende Ranchos, víveres, licores, refrescos y artículos de la canasta familiar, principalmente de contado, aunque maneja créditos con sus clientes más fieles. Cuando inició en su negocio vendía solamente verduras, con un capital que su hermana le prestó. Así fue como le cedieron la casa en la cual vive y con el trabajo de su capital, logro adecuar el expendio de verduras y poco a poco ir agregando otros productos dirigidos al consumo de las familias que viven en su barrio y alrededor. Su meta más adelante es estabilizar su negocio, hasta lograr convertirlo en una unidad de venta de mayor tamaño, con productos diversificados, obedeciendo principalmente a lo que sus clientes necesiten. Su credikiva, al cual está aplicando, es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él  comprará víveres, verduras y artículos de la canasta familiar en mayor volumen, con el fin de tener su negocio bien surtido y comprar con descuentos por lograr adquirir los artículos de contado. Su mayor desafío es no tener el capital suficiente para lograr responder rápidamente a la clientela, con los productos que más compran y justamente con su credikiva logrará hacerlo.
texts.en:
Joel is 45 years old and lives to the south of the city with his wife and three children, who range in age from 6 to 14. Since 2009, he has owned a business called “Tienda El Paisa” where he sells snacks, food, liquor, soft drinks, and products used for preparing family meals. He conducts mainly cash sales, but he extends credit to his most loyal customers. When he started his business, Joel only sold vegetables using capital that he borrowed from his sister. Using his home as his business location, Joel allocated his operating capital toward the sale of vegetables. He gradually added other products that are consumed by families who live in his neighborhood and the surrounding areas. His goal for the future is to stabilize his business and convert it into a larger store that offers a diversity of products that his customers need.

Joel is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy food products, vegetables, and household goods in large volumes so that he can have a well-stocked business. By purchasing these goods with cash, he will be able to receive discounts. His greatest challenge is not having enough capital to respond quickly to his customers by acquiring the products that they purchase the most. He will be able to accomplish this using his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy food products, vegetables, and household goods in large volumes.

loans.name: Jeni Arely

texts.es: Jeni Arely de treinta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, su negocio es muy conocido en la localidad pues siempre tiene lo que los clientes necesitan, productos de muy buena calidad a excelentes precios, además del servicio inigualable de Jeni, que siempre recibe a las personas con un saludo cordial y una sonrisa en el rostro, es muy vigorosa y positiva; para ella el secreto de nuestro éxito se encuentra en trazarse con claridad la agenda de nuestro diario vivir y encarar de la mejor manera los cambios que se presentan, por eso ella vive intensamente cada día, con la esperanza de alcanzar un futuro mejor, es así como le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, granos básicos, huevos, embutidos, pan, bebidas entre otros. Jeni Arely tiene la confianza que así logrará darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Jeni Arely is 33, and lives with her life companion and their children.  She has a store where she sells basic household necessities.  

Her business is very well known in the area, as she always has what her customers need; good quality products at excellent prices.  Besides, Jeni provides unbeatable service, always welcoming people with a friendly greeting and a smile on her face. 

She is very energetic and positive.  For her, the secret of success lies in clearly setting out what we plan to accomplish in our daily lives, and facing the changes that come up as best we can. This is why she lives each day with intensity, with the hope of achieving a better future.  

That is how she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy candy, basic grains, eggs, cold cuts, bread, drinks, and other things. Jeni Arely is confident that in this way she will succeed in giving her family a fulfilling life.

loans.use: To buy candy, basic grains, eggs, cold cuts, bread, and drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel tiene 45 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de panadería. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio cuando un hermano le ayudo para que comprara un horno industrial fue con el paso del tiempo que Reyna aumento la producción y fue así que decide capacitar a personas para que trabajaran en su panadería. El crédito es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, queso, leche, piña, batidoras entre otros.
texts.en: Reyna Isabel is 45. She runs a bakery. She has had this business for three years. Her brother helped her to buy an industrial oven, and as time went on Reyna's production increased and she decided to train people to work in her bakery. This loan is for the purchase of flour, eggs, butter, cheese, milk, pineapple, beaters, and other items.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese, milk, pineapple, and beaters, among other items.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a single woman with two children. One of her children attends school while the other is all grown up. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a livestock purchasing and selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are local customers. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding the business to a point of selling cattle in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more goats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access business loans.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for sale

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a hardworking business man, age 24. He is married and blessed with one child. He runs an electronic shop to make a living. He also operates a motorbike transport business to earn extra money. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy bulbs, and radio and television spare parts for resale.

loans.use: To buy bulbs, and radio and television spare parts.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 50 years old and lives in Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor. She is separated from her husband and has one child. Cecilia sells finished food products like sausage to earn a living. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to  purchase finished food products like sausage for her business. Cecilia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months. Cecilia hopes to improve her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase finished food products like sausage for her business.

loans.name: Frank

texts.es: Frank, de 19 años es un joven trabajador. Vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito del tambo; en compañía de sus padres y hermanos a los que quiere mucho.  A base de esfuerzo y entusiasmo este ejemplar joven, comenzó a estudiar una carrera profesional en la universidad del estado. Sus días se centran en diferentes actividades, una de ellas es el trabajo como “taxista”, con un auto que adquirió gracias a su trabajo. Cuenta que se siente algo cansado, púes tiene que compartir su tiempo con sus estudios,  tareas de la universidad y su trabajo. Pero ese esfuerzo es recompensado, pues será dentro de algunos años todo un ingeniero, “que se formó solo”, como él, orgulloso comenta. Ahora desea reparar por completo su auto y así trabajar sin preocupación. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “rompiendo fronteras” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde esta contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Frank, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en arreglar su auto para poder trabajar sin preocupaciones.
texts.en:
Frank, 19, is a young worker.  He lives in his own house located in Tambo District with his parents and siblings that he loves very much.  Based on effort and enthusiasm this exemplary young man started to learn a professional career at the state university.  His days are centered on various activities.  One of them is working as a “taxi driver” with a car he acquired thanks to his work.  He relates that he feels a bit tired because he also has to share his time with his studies, school work and his job.  But the effort is rewarded because he’ll become every bit of an engineer in a few years and, as he himself proudly comments: “I did it on my own.” 

He’d like to completely service his car to continue working worry-free.  He belongs to the “Rompiendo Fronteras” communal bank and this is his first MFP loan.  He’s happy because he’ll have financial support and will feel surer about advancing with his work.  He promises to make his installment payments.  He likes being part of his association because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  If Frank were to get your support, he will use the money to service his car to be able to work without any worries.

loans.use: to send his car to the mechanic.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Ana Milena, de 46 años es la propietaria de una tienda, donde vende al detalle, ranchos, víveres, carnes y productos de la canasta familiar. Su negocio nació hace 6 años en  el municipio de Puerto Colombia, muy cerca al mar, cuando se dio cuenta, de la poca competencia de este tipo de actividad y la gran necesidad de los habitantes de esta población, por lograr obtener en pequeñas cantidades, los productos que diariamente consumían las familias porteñas (Originario de Puerto). Su meta es lograr incrementar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un autoservicio. 
Ana Milena goza de una clientela satisfecha, que cada día crece, por eso su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente y debe comprar en pequeñas cantidades con mucha frecuencia. La ubicación de su tienda hace de este lugar un sitio favorito por lo agradable de su vista, pues se encuentra en un altillo donde se puede observar el paisaje marino y en especial el viejo puerto, un sitio turístico muy visitado por habitantes de la ciudad e Barranquilla y de los municipios del departamento del Atlántico. En la actualidad Ana está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará ranchos víveres, bebidas, refrescos en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos.
texts.en:
Ana Milena, 46, owns a store where she sells snacks, foodstuffs, meat and basic staples at retail.  Her business was born six years ago in the town of Puerto Colombia very near the ocean when she noticed the little competition that existed in this type of business and the great need the inhabitants of this town had of being able to buy small quantities of the products the residents of this port consume daily.  Her goal is to enlarge the business until converting it into a self-service market.

Ana Milena enjoys having a satisfied clientele that grows daily.  Because of that, her working capital turns out to be insufficient and she has to buy small amounts frequently.  Her store’s location makes it a favorite because of its pleasant view since it’s located on a small hill where the marine view, especially of the old port which is a very popular tourist destination for residents from the city of Barranquilla and other cities in Atlántico Department, can be admired.

Ana is asking for her first Kiva loan that she’ll use to buy snacks, soft-drinks and beverages in larger amounts so that she can qualify for discounts.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Amelia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She also buys and sells green and yellow bananas.  She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas.

Amelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Amelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and bananas.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children, only one of whom goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

Allen has a food stall. She has been in this business for 6 years. She sells her products on retail basis at the market, working six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas, tomatoes, onions, and cassava.

Allen's major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked food stall and also to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, onions, tomatoes, and cassava.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Simeón de 33 años y sus 03 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es poderle brindar un buen futuro a sus hijos. Reyna junto a su esposo, llegaron a abrir una tienda de repuestos para carros ya que vieron que era algo rentable para poder solventar en los gastos de su hogar; Los que mayormente acuden a su negocio son los transportistas que a veces necesitan repuestos para sus carros, las personas que los conocen sin dudar van a la tienda de repuestos de Reyna ya que pueden encontrar lo que necesiten. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que puede estar con su familia sin poder descuidarse. Lleva 04 años en esta actividad y considera que lo mas difícil es cuando llega a faltarle algunos repuestos que constantemente llevan. Mas adelante piensa comprar más repuesto de carro para no poder quedar mal con sus clientes que acuden constantemente. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará repuestos para carro como: limpia parabrisas, focos, espejos, entre otros.
texts.en: Reyna is 30 years old and a very hardworking woman. She lives in rented accomodation with her husband Simeón, 33 years old, and their 3 children,. What she most wants is to give her children a good future. Reyna, with her husband, opened a car parts store as they saw that it was a profitable business that would cover their household costs. Her main customers are haulers who at times need spare parts for their trucks. The people who know her, without doubt, go to Reyna's spare parts store as they can find everything they need there. What she likes the best about the work is that she can be with the family without neglecting the business. She has been in the business for 4 years and believes that the most difficult thing is when she runs out of spare parts they normally stock. In the future she plans on buying more car spare parts so as not to look bad with her regular customers. This will be her 5th loan with MFP. She feels that the loan will help her a lot in growing her business. She is well-loved by the other members of her communal bank as she is very supportive of the others. With the 3,000 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy spare parts such as windscreen wipers, lights, mirrors and other items.

loans.use: to buy windscreen wipers, lights, mirrors and other car accessories.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Margarita compró muchos productos como cosméticos, útiles escolares, y una vitrina muy grande.Ella está muy satisfecha y en la actualidad planea acceder a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará articulos de fantasia, bolsos para damas y productos que vinieron con descuento en sus guias especializadas, su inversión será exitosa por que comprará de contado y obtendrá descuentos y porque está justificada en los pedidos que  le han hecho sus clientes. "Se les agradece la confianza en mi negocio que cada dia crece mas y mas." este fue el mensaje con el que se despidió de su asesor cuando la fue a visitar.
texts.en: Margarita used her last Kiva loan to buy cosmetics, school supplies and a large display case.  The investment paid off and she's now applying for a new loan that she will use to buy merchandise--novelties, purses and other discounted products--that she will resell.  She expects to make a good profit from the investment because she can get discounts for the merchandise by paying cash and she already has orders for her products from some of her customers.  "I'm grateful for your confidence in my business", she told the loan officer who visited her, "and it's growing by the day".

loans.use: to buy merchandise that she will resell.

loans.name: Elman Armando

texts.es:
