El señor Elman Armando es casado, tiene 20 años de experiencia, cursó sus estudios de 5 perito contador, se dedica a la construcción de vivienda, lleva 3 año de experiencia ene este trabajo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, ya que quiere apertura este negocios de venta de ropa, compra de playeras, suéteres, sudaderos, blusas, etc. Espera tener un negocio estable y funcional.
texts.en:
Elman Armando is married and has 20 years of experience.  He completed his studies as an accountant.  He works in home construction, and has 3 years of experience at this job.  He counts on the support of his wife, who takes care of the domestic tasks.

He is requesting a loan that he will use for purchasing clothes, since he wants to open a clothing sales business.  He will buy T-shirts, sweaters, sweatshirts, blouses, etc.  He hopes to have a stable and functional business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for merchandise.

loans.name: Adiouma's Group

texts.fr: le groupe a était crée le 01/12/2008, les membres habitent le même quartier et leur activité principal est le commerce. Aissatou est née le 06/03/1964, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfant dont 3 garçons et 4 filles, l’aîné a 30 ans et le cadet 12 ans. elle fait du commerce de fruits et de cacahouète qu'elle expose devant chez elle; elle coud aussi des tissu quelle vend prêt a porter. Avec ses bénéfice elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la maison. elle est situé a l’extrême droite de la photo debout.
texts.en: This group was created on December 1, 2008. The members live in the same district, and their main work involves commerce. Aissatou was born on March 6, 1964. She is married and the mother of seven children (3 boys and 4 girls). The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 12. Aissatou does commerce in fruit and peanuts, which she displays in front of her home; she also sews and sells ready-to-wear clothing. With the profits, she helps out her husband in covering household expenses. Aissatou is the one standing at the far right in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase sheer fabrics and thread to make clothing

loans.name: Reminda

texts.en:
Reminda is 42 years old and lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two children.  Reminda has run a sari-sari store for five years. 

She requested a loan to buy two piglets and two sacks of feed for another source of income. Reminda has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Reminda hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and two sacks of feed

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Tekuis

texts.en:
Tekuis owns a cabinet business in Guayaquil, and she manages the sales and collections while her husband works the machinery. They started the shop with wood bought on credit. Tekuis’ husband is talented at what he does, and he produces some of the nicest tables, shelves, and desks, given the materials he has been working with. His vision is to grow the business and create jobs for other skilled workers. Together Tekuis and her husband would like to take out a loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to buy different types of wood. Ms. T. is a 36 year-old mother of three whose goal it is to build a new house made of cement, instead of wood.  

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Together Tekuis and her husband would like to take out a loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to buy different types of wood

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Akossiwa S. is a very active widow with eight people to provide for in her home: five children and three grandsons. After losing her husband, she quickly took up making pots—a skill she learned from her mother—to feed her family. With this she earns a small income, but her products are very popular, and if she were able to produce them in higher quantities, they could be sold in other places throughout the region.

She is requesting a loan of $850 to buy new tools that will help her produce more pots and satisfy demand. The sales will help her meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Akossiwa est une veuve très active. Précocement laissée par son mari, elle s’est vite recyclée en fabrication de pots qu’elle a héritée de sa mère pour pouvoir nourrir ses orphelins. Aujourd’hui, elle a en charges huit (8) personnes : cinq (5) enfants et trois (3) petits fils. Son activité lui procure un minimum de revenu avec lequel elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Mais ses produits artisanaux sont très bien appréciés et s’ils sont produits en grande quantité, Madame S. pourra les écouler rapidement dans d’autres marchés de la région.

Elle sollicite alors crédit de $850 pour se procurer de nouveaux outils de fabrication des pots afin de réussir à produire en quantité suffisante. Les revenus tirés de cette vente l’aideront à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for pottery

loans.name: Delfino

texts.en:
Delfino is a married man with two children, ages 10 and 7. He decided to start his own business due to the fact that he needed a better income. He initially partnered with a friend, but later went on his own and it has been six years since he owns his business. His wife helps him in the business as well as five other people which work with him. He sells rotisserie chicken, something very common in Mexico and other parts of the world and is enjoyed by many.

Delfino is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,100 for working capital, which he will utilize for maintaining and repairing the motorcycles that he uses to make deliveries, since many people order for delivery. Of course, he's eager to offer his clients the service that they are looking for. He pledges to repay the loan within 6 to 12 months and looks forward to your support in helping him grow his business. He thanks you in advance.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer

Delfino es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 10 años y otro de 7 años, él decidió poner su propio negocio a raíz de que necesitaba mayores ingresos, inicialmente se asocio con un amigo y posteriormente se independizo y ahora tiene su propio negocio desde ya 6 años, su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio y tiene 5 personas más que colaboran con Delfino. Su negocio es el de la venta de pollos asados, algo muy típico en México y muchas partes del mundo que tiene mucha gente que gusta de esta comida.

Delfino está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,100 para capital de trabajo, el cual lo utilizará en el mantenimiento y reparación de las motocicletas que tiene para el reparto a domicilio, ya que muchas personas prefieren ese servicio y el tiene que otorgarles el servicio que sus clientes desean, ofrece pagar este préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses y espera tu apoyo para poder crecer en su negocio, te lo agradece anticipadamente.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Javier sells cleaning supplies and general household items which he sells on the road to areas near his neighborhod. He started selling those products with a loan he got from his brother in law. Currently he sells not just in cash, but he gives his clients time to pay in full, so his clients have increased because of the options of payment he offers.

Loan Use

Javier needs the credit to buy more merchandise because he needs to increase his clients and range of work. Also he knows that with more merchandise his profits will increase and he will have a prosperous business.

Personal Information

Javier is 35 years old and has 3 children who are in school, his house is made of cement and his wife also helps him selling some products at home.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Sr. Javier tiene a la venta artículos de aseo y para el hogar en general que vende de forma ambulante en los sectores próximos a su vecindario. El comenzó a vender dichos productos por la necesidad de trabajar con unos con un préstamo que le hizo a un cuñado. Actualmente no solo vende al contado los artículos sino que se ha ideado una forma de crédito de tal manera que sus clientes han aumentado por la facilidad de pago que el les presta

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería pues necesita ampliar su campo de trabajo e incrementar su cartera de clientes. Además el esta convencido que con mas mercadería sus ganancias van a mejorar y así tener un negocio prospero

Información Personal

Javier tiene 35 años de edad y tres hijos quienes estudia y además su casa es de cemento y cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposa que que le ayuda en casa vendiendo tambien los productos

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Afi Adjobi

texts.fr:
Born on March 31, 1944 in Atakpamé, Togo, Widow Afi Adjobi R. sells lengths of African print cloth in Lomé. She is the sole breadwinner for 6 people. After the death of her husband, she began this business with her small savings. The business income does not allow her to cover all the needs of her family because she lacks business capital. She always has to have new and different cloth for sale so that her customers can find what they want. In order to grow her business, she is asking for a loan of US$ 600.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 31 mars 1944 à Atakpamé, Veuve R. Afi Adjobi revendeuse de pagne à Lomé a à sa charge six (06) personnes. Après la mort de son mari, elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce avec sa petite économie. Ce commerce ne lui permet pas à couvrir tous les besoins de sa famille car son commerce nécessite plus de moyens. Il faut chaque fois avoir de nouveautés de pagnes pour permettre aux clients de mieux faire leur choix. Afin d’agrandir la taille de son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $600.

loans.use:
Sale of lengths of African print cloth

Vente de pagne

loans.name: Turbat

texts.en: Turbat has sold clothes for 15 years. He is 33 years old, lives in the Salyan region, in the Yenikand village.  This single man needs a loan of $1200 to buy clothes for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Muthu

texts.en:
Mrs. Muthu S. is a shopkeeper in Chetrapati, Kathmandu. She opened her grocery shop 3 years ago. Her husband's name is Ram S.. He works in a private office. Mrs. S. has two children. Her daughter and son are studying in grade 3 and 4 respectively.

Mrs. S. opened her grocery shop to uplift the standard of their living. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop. Before she opened her grocery shop, her husband was the only earner in the family. At that time, the condition of family was so poor that they could hardly live hand-to-mouth problem. Now her family condition is improving.

Now Mrs. S. is requesting her first loan of Rs10000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Asubisye

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Asubisye C. is 35 years old and she is married with three children, aged 10, 13 and 16 years old. In 1995 Asubisye established a clothing shop and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Guisella

texts.es:
Guisella is a daily chef of the culinary arts. Her prime motive is to improve her economic situation, and provide her dear children with a higher quality of life -- her children inspire her to work hard and improve every day. Her small resaurant has received much attention from customers and many even wait in line to get a table in order to sample the delicious stews of this devoted mother. To satisfy customer demand, Guisella is asking for a loan to renovate her establishment and offer a larger variety of dishes. Your important contribution could help her achieve this dream.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El arte culinario que desempeña Guisella, día a día es con el propósito de mejorar la situación económica de su querido hogar y otorgarles mayor comodidad a sus queridos pequeños que la acompañan y se han convertido en la mejor excusa para su esfuerzo y progreso diario.El pequeño restaurante tarde a tarde y ahora también por las noches se abarrota de una inmensa cantidad de comensales quienes incluso esperan una mesa por largos minutos para degustar los deliciosos potajes de esta abnegada madre de familia.Para satisfacer esta inmensidad de solicitudes Guisella, solicita un préstamo a fin de mejorar su establecimiento y ofrecer mayor variedad de platillos.Tu importante ayuda podrá procurar el cumplimiento de este sueño.

loans.use: To renovate her small restaurant and buy a large amount of ingredients to satisfy client demand.

loans.name: Ursula Milagros

texts.es:
Mr. Ursula Milagros López Ramírez is a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Señora de la Paz". She lives in the region of San Martín, in the San Martín province, Tarapoto district. Her business is located on Jr. Huayna Cápac #328 and she provides telephone booth services and also sells beauty products. She started with the sale of beauty products, and thanks to her efforts and dedication, she was able to make her business succeed. Today, she also provides a telephone booth service, which she receives much support for from her husband. With a loan of $375 USD, which will be paid in 6 months, she will enhance her telephone booth business with equipment such as: fixed telephones, timers, and booths to service the community out of her own house. Mrs. Ursula is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and works tiredlessly to see results and to feel productive in live. She has much potential in the future and is thinking about expanding her telephone booth business without abandoning the sale of beauty products on the side.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ursula Milagros López Ramírez es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, su negocio está ubicado en Jr: Huayna Cápac Nº 328 y se dedica a brindar servicio en un Locutorio y también vende productos de belleza.. Ella se inicio con la venta de productos de belleza, y gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación pudo sacar su negocio adelante ahora cuenta con un servicio de locutorio es su esposo quien la apoyo. Con crédito de S/. 1,000.00, el cual será devuelto en 6 meses, implementara el negocio del locutorio con equipos como: teléfonos fijos, controladores de tiempo, y cabinas, del mismo que esta al servicio de la comunidad y esta ubicada en su misma casa. La señora Ursula tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo, trabaja incansablemente para poder ver los resultados y sentirse útil en la vida con muchas perspectivas en el futuro y más adelante esta pensando ampliar su locutorio sin dejar de lado la venta de productos de belleza.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy equipment for her business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, age 50, is a single parent of 7 children. She makes a living by selling clothing and works from 8am to 4pm daily. Each month, her sales bring her a profit of about $85.

Asha hopes for a loan to buy more clothing to sel. She is a member of the Karim loan group, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amivi A. was born December 26, 1959 in Benin. She is a mother of three children and is married to Mr. Sewonou Badjissi, a retired police officer. Her business consists of selling charcoal and firewood. Her primary customers are bread makers and households. This first loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase a supply of charcoal and firewood.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Amivi est née le 26 décembre 1959 au Bénin. Elle est mère de 3 enfants et s’est mariée à Monsieur BADJISSI Sewonou qui est un policier en retraite. Elle a pour activité principale la vente du charbon de bois et du bois de chauffe. Ses principaux clients sont les fabricants de pains et les ménages. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire le stock de bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois de chauffe.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Natividad De María Group

texts.es:
The “Natividad de Maria” Group is comprised of a group of neighbors in the San Miguel neighborhood of Guarambaré. This group has demonstrated solidarity and reliability. It is one of the most punctual groups to make repayments. It is at capacity in terms of membership and all members attend the group’s meetings.

All members of the group are working mothers and are united by having this in common. The photograph above shows 18 of the 20 members. Each member has her own activities and some have full time jobs outside of this work in which case they perform this work during their free time to augment their household incomes. This group is well organized and members get along well together. The membership has demonstrated great unity on several occasions when individual members had health issues or family problems which prevented them from making a payment and the other members joined together to help out.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

El Comitè “Natividad de Maria” se formó a partir de la unión de varias vecinas del barrio San Miguel de la ciudad de Guarambaré. Este comité demuestra confianza y la solidaridad. Es uno de los comités que más puntualidad en pagos a demostrado y así como también todas acuden a las reuniones que se realizan para capacitación.

Todas las integrantes del comité son madres y trabajadoras, por lo que las une ambas cosas. En la fotografía tomada, se encuentran 18 de las 20 integrantes del comité. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, aunque algunas tienen trabajos formales, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos. El comité lleva una organización bien establecida y las relaciones fluyen normalmente entre todas sus miembros.

Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad en varias ocasiones en que algunas de las integrantes tuvieron problemas de salud y familiares imposibilitándolas de cumplir con algún pago, pero entre todas ayudaron y colaboraron para ayudar.

loans.use: Purchase of a variety of merchandise including meat, milk, cheese, eggs, fruit, vegetables, clothing, cosmetics, salt, wheat, oil, soft drinks, sweets, fabric, yarn etc. for individual businesses

loans.name: Wanu

texts.en:
Wanu is 32 years old. She is married, and has 3 children, ages 7, 12, and 13. Wanu began her own business in 2004, and sells a variety of products, including charcoal and firewood. She works everyday from 6am to 8pm, and earns a monthly profit of around $44.

In the past, Wanu has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Wanu now hopes for a loan to purchase more items and continue to expand her customer base.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Tawoprr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Tawoprr. They have received three loans from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have helped these people tremendously. However, they still need more loans to keep their businesses growing.

These entrepreneurs are Marie K., Ya Iye S., and Adama B.. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,400,000.00. Marie is the leader of this group. She is 35 years old. She sells food items at the Magburaka town Market and has been in this business for 21 years now.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Ogla

texts.es:
La señora Ogla S. es una dama digna de imitar por ser muy trabajadora ya que se ha destacado en su actividad agrícola dedicándose a esta desde muy jovencita en el municipio de Somotillo de Chinandega.

Como toda actividad en desarrollo necesita de inversión, la actividad Agrícola de la señora Ogla necesita de inversión en la siembra y es por este motivo que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual poder comprar insumos para la siembra y así lograr una buena cosecha para continuar con el sustento de su hogar compuesta por ella y su amada familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ogla S. is a hard-working woman worthy of being emulated. She has excelled at agricultural work and has dedicated herself to this since she was a very young girl in the town of Somotillo in Chinandega.

Like any growing business in need of investment, Olga's agricultural business needs investment for the planting season; therefore she has sought the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy farming supplies and thus ensure a good harvest to support her household, which consists of herself and her beloved family.


Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=39748&_tpos=3&_tpg=1

Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos Juntos en quechua. Carmen es separada, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos que estudian, Carmen se dedica a la elaboración de chocolates ayacuchanos, los cuales prepara en su casa con la ayuda de sus hijos, los chocolates se elaboran con cacao, maní, canela, azúcar y son utilizados para preparar postres, desayunos, en los últimos meses compro una maquina de moler con lo que esta produciendo en mayor cantidad, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor a las tiendas del distrito.

Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cacao, azúcar. Los sueños de Carmen son salir adelante, progresar con su negocio y adquirir un carro para facilitar el trabajo de repartir sus productos.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=39748&_tpos=3&_tpg=1

Carmen is a member of the community bank "Llapanchik", it means Everyone Together in the Quechua language.

Carmen is separated and she is 34 years old and she is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are attending school. Carmen's occupation is making chocolates. She makes them at home with the help of her children. They are made from cocoa, cinnamon, and sugar and they can be enjoyed as dessert or at breakfast. In the last many months she has purchased a grinding maching and it is permitting her to make her product in greater quantity. She sells her product to stores in the area as wholesale.

Carmen requires a loan amounting to 1000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of cocoa and sugar. Carmen's dreams are to pull through and see her business grow. She also dreams of purchasing a car to help her in the distribution of her chocolates.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carmen requires a loan in the amount of 1000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of cocoa and sugar.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells kerosene and rechargeable phone cards, and makes phone calls for people in her shop. Esther works from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. and has owned this business for 8 years. Esther lives in Jakunde, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO Microfinance client. Esther is requesting a loan amount of N140, 000 ($1200 USD) to purchase more kerosene and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene and rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Sophia S. from Mwanza. She is single with four children between the ages of 7 and 20. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan. Sophia S. has been running a café business since 2007. Her business is a café, or mama lishe, which is a local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consisting of a rough wooden table and some long wooden benches. The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), and plantains (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Sophia S. currently earns about 300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500 USD in order to buy rice, beans, meat and vegetables. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Sophia thanks you for your support! About the field partner: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and payback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, meat and vegetables to stock her cafe.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria  Isabel M. Ramírez es una señora viuda la cual se mantiene de la pensión que le dieron por su esposo y ayuda de su hermana que es soltera. Ella recurre a nosotros al verse en la necesidad de que sus muebles se  están deteriorando con la humedad que provoca la casa. Aunque no llueva se le gotea es por eso que desea impermeabilizar  y pagar mano de obra. El costo de esto es de $10,000 pesos
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Isabel M. Ramírez is a widow who supports herself from her late husband’s death pension and with help from her sister, who is single. She turns to us because her furniture is getting damaged with the moisture in the house. Even if it does not rain, water leaks in the house, which is why she would like to waterproof it and pay for the labor. All of this would cost $10,000 Mexican pesos.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof her home

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa K. is 55 years old. She is widowed and has six children to cater for. Two of her children are girls and four are boys. Almost all of her children are currently out of school and are living independently. She lives with her daughters in a family house in Koforidua, a business/farming town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are engaged in trading and farming activities. Adwoa deals in cooking utensils. She says she procures her goods from big shops in Kumasi. She sells in a small shop in the local market and also hawks to houses in her community. Adwoa has been in business for over five years. She desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying utensils in bulk to be able to trek to nearby markets to do business. She aspires to sponsor some of her grandchildren to the university level of education.

loans.use: To buy utensils for resale

loans.name: Karimdjon

texts.ru: Каримджон Окилов 1972 года рождения имеет 2 детей. Жена домохозяйка,но помогает в бизнесе мужа, ухаживает за скотом, кормит. А Каримждон в свое время  вызывает ветеринара (делают уколы)выводит скот на рынок, покупает когда необходимо еще скот. В настоящее время скот на рынке дешевый и до середины марта можно прикупить скот и продать дороже  позднее.  Сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. Планирует сотрудничать  и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
Karimdjon O. was born in 1972 and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker, but helps with the business by feeding and caring for the livestock. In the meantime, Karimdjan takes care of calling a veterinarian for shots, takes the livestock to a market and buys additional livestock when necessary. Currently, livestock market prices are low and will stay there until about middle of March; then livestock can be sold for more. Karimdjan has been working with MicroInvest since 2007 and plans to continue the partnership.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Heiy

texts.en:
Heiy C., 29, sells desserts in the local market of the Kampong Cham province. She typically makes $5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman. On average, he makes $8 a day. This couple has one young child.

Mrs. Heiy C. would like to take out a loan to purchase construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Mahmadusuf

texts.ru: Мусофиров Махмадюсуф проживает в Варзобском районе. Живет в одном из отдаленных кишлаков. А Варзоб является  горной местностью и основная часть населения занимается животноводством. Так и наш клиент занимается животноводством уже 10 лет. Покупает домашний скот для откормки , а затем продает. Для этого он и обратился к нам. Он хочет получить кредит и увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот. Но кроме этого бизнеса он работает строителем по найму.махмадюсуфу приходится много работать , так как он один обеспечивает большую семью. Он женат и имеет троих детей.
texts.en:
Mahmadusuf M. lives in the Varzob district, in one of the distant villages. Varzob is a mountainous locale where the majority of the population is involved in animal husbandry. Our client has been involved in animal husbandry for 10 years. He buys livestock to raise and then to sell. He reached out to us for this business. Mahmadusuf wants to obtain this loan to increase his livestock headcount. This will help him to increase turnover. Besides this business, Mahmadusuf also works as a construction worker for hire. He has to work a lot because he is the sole provider for his big family. He is married and has three children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Majed Khan Group

texts.en:
Majed Khan is the group leader of the Majed Khan group. There are four members in this group, and they all live in 15th district. Each of them are requesting a loan for their separate businesses. The total amount of the group loan is 20000 Afghani for the term of 10 months.

Majed Khan wants a loan for his tailoring business, so he can buy a new machine for his shop. M. Karam needs a loan to buy materials for his fresh fruit shop, and Bibi Zakara and Bibi Mazaery would like to borrow money for their quilt-making business. They all want to expand and improve their businesses. They are all happy about the loan process and want to tell you how pleased they are about the support the loans provide entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Expand and inprove their businesses

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is a hardworking businesswoman. She is forty years old and married with four children, two of whom are working and two who are still in school. She operates a beauty salon in her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase necessary supplies such as combs for styling, hair chemicals for relaxing, braids for plaiting, hair treatments and weaves for hair weaving. Margaret's dream is to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Mumina

texts.ru: Мумина работает официанткой в одной из местных столовых города Исфары. У нее среднее образование и поэтому высокооплачиваемой работы не нашла. В этой столовой ей разрешили поставить маленький столик для продажи разных мелких товаров. Здесь торгует ее младшая дочь. Товары мелкие но приносят хорошую прибыль так как много клиентов. Мумине 49 лет, замужем и у нее 5 детей. Она подала заявку на КИВА и планирует увеличить запасы товара для своего маленького бизнеса.
texts.en:
Mumina works as a waitress in one of the local cafeterias in the city of Isfara. She has a high school education and because of this could not find a high paying job. In the cafeteria they allowed her to place a small table to sell different small products. Her younger daughter sells here. The products are small, but bring a good profit because there are a lot of customers. Mumina is 49 years old; she is married and has 5 children. She applied on KIVA and plans to increase the quantity of products for her small business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sueli

texts.en: Ni Nengah Sueli (DNR.M-0699) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has one adult child. Ni Nengah Sueli owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns 750,000 - 1,000,000 IDR a month. In 2007, Ni Nengah Sueli joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Ni Nengah Sueli is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Nengah Sueli - (DNR.M-0699) merupakan 45 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Nengah Sueli memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pangan. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuat & menjual makanan. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual beraneka ragam produk makanan di tengah masyarakat setempat. Ni Nengah Sueli sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Nengah Sueli menghasilkan sekitar 750,000 - 1,000,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2007, Ni Nengah Sueli bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Nengah Sueli meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli inventaris & modal kerja tambahan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Nengah Sueli berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jannat Khan Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Jannat baji married K. M. at the age of 20. They have lived in Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 18 years. Jannat baji is a very active lady. She gets up early in the morning and prepares breakfast for her family and then cleans the whole house. Her husband runs a dairy business. He gets milk from the buffalo that he has in his house. He sells the milk in the milk shops and earns income. Jannat baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to increase her husband’s dairy business.

Jannat baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy timbers to sell. Najma baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Jannat baji is seated in the center of the group.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely F.'s dream is to have a good life for herself and her children. She has a business cooking and selling food in her eatery. She is a 44 year old mother of one child. All she wants to do is develop her business even more to provide her child with a brighter future. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase spices, beverages, vegetables and meat for her eatery business. The loan will really help her sustain the livelihood that she has had since 2000.

Now, she actively participates in CEVI cluster meetings held weekly in their village. She avails herself of CEVI credit services, and receives training and insurance coverage from them as well.

loans.use: To purchase spices, beverages, vegetables and meat for her eatery business.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta O. lives in the town of Gata Diot, Clarin, Mismis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Roberta raises chickens. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from her work

In 2008, Roberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a new loan of $175 to invest in expanding her small company. This loan will be the fourth taken out by Roberta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina P. D. A. 44 años resiD. en Santa Tecla junto a sus cuatro hijos mayores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a trabajar. Ernestina posee una venta D. tortillas en su propia casa desD. hace 12 años, así mismo venD. hielo y frijoles. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar maíz y frijoles al por mayor, así mismo comprar varios cilindro D. gas propano. Ernestina desea mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, ya que a pesar que todos sus hijos trabajan, ella debe esforzarse por  obtener el dinero necesario para todos sus gastos personales, así mismo desea seguir con su negocio el cual le permitió brindarles una vida digna a sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Ernestina P. D. A. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Santa Tecla with her four grown children who all work. Ernestina has been selling tortillas from home for 12 years. She also sells ice and beans. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase corn and beans wholesale, and she also wishes to purchase tanks of propane. Ernestina would like to improve her business because despite the fact that her children work, she needs to make an effort to earn the money she needs for her personal expenses. She would like to continue running her business, which allowed her to proviD. a decent living for her four children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn and propane tanks

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Rozimery

texts.en:
Rozimery is a member of the Amani borrower group in Kinayanambo, Iringa. she is 24 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 6 and 2 years old.

Rozimery has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 2 years, she works 12 hours a  day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Rozimery`s  first loan from  BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rozimery hopes  to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Loemheang Peurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loemheang P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members in Ampil village in Kandal province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Loemheang P. is a farmer who owns a small field on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Saing Piseth, is a fisherman and he also charges batteries to earn an income.

In this business, her husband now faces a small problem because his generator is old so he needs to use a lot of fuel to run it. Thus, he wants to ask for a loan to buy a new generator to replace the old one. His wife decided to obtain the loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Loemheang P. is 34 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a new generator to replace the old one

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María C. D. P. D. 52 años D. edad resiD. en San Martin municipio del departamento D. San Salvador con sus tres hijos. Ana es una persona trabajadora a pesar que cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos quienes dos D. ellos trabajan, ella nunca deja a un lado su negocio y su independencia económica, son ya diez años los cuales Ana ha dedicado a su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su casa, las ventas que Ana realiza son diarias, distribuye variedad D. artículos como ropa y zapatos en su mayoría, el motivo del crédito que solicita es para comprar nueva mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 52 years old and lives in the municipality of San Martin in San Salvador with her three children. Ana is a hard worker, and also counts on the support of two of her children who also work. She never neglects her work and her financial independence, and for more than 10 years now she has run a business from her home selling shoes and clothing. She will use this loan to purchase new merchandise to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is 44 years old and happily married to Felix C., who is 50 years old. Her husband works as a screen printer. Although he works hard to support the family, they never end up with enough money to meet their daily expenses and other expenses, like educational expenses. So Evelyn thought of a way to help her husband, and this was the start of her frozen foods business. They are blessed with three children: Kevin Ray, 17 years old; Kenneth Jim, 14 years old, and Karl Brian, 12 years old. All of their children are now in school so educational expenses are high. 

Evelyn got her capital for starting a business from a loan she received from Kiva's field partner, Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), when she became a member. Now she has been in her business for four years, and her business continues to grow, because she makes good use of every loan she receives from ASHI. She will be using her seventh loan to buy different frozen foods to sell so that her business will continue to improve.

Just like every parent dreams for their children, Evelyn also dreams of her children finishing their studies until college. That is why she and her husband are working hard to prepare for their future. She knows that with the financial support she is confident ASHI will give them, her dreams for her children will be possible.

loans.use: To finance selling of frozen foods

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
“Try your best until you succeed!” says Mrs. Janet L. of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is the loving housewife of Mr. Marcelino L., and they are blessed with two children, Joemar L. and Gay L.. Through their patience and sacrifices, they finished a vocational course and applied it in their own business.

Her husband cultivates their farm lot. During planting season he plants a variety of vegetables and rice. Janet is engaged in buying and selling vegetables in their village. She aims to acquire more vegetables to be sold at Solano Public Market, but she does not have enough capital.

Therefore, she wants to borrow 15,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to strengthen her capital in acquiring the said vegetables. She hopes that with this financial assistance, she can improve her small business to earn a living and save for their future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy paint and pay labor costs to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Linda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Linda owns and operates a business in the retail sector--a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Linda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Linda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Linda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Jaime Rodolfo

texts.es:
Jaime es un padre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo de 3 años de edad en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo en el sector La Compuerta, un anexo del distrito de Cayaltí. Todos los días viaja hacia ese lugar para ofrecer su mercadería a sus clientes. Su negocio goza de mucha acogida porque es el único de su tipo por la zona.

Jaime da todo de sí para sacar su negocio adelante ya que es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta su familia. Debido a la demanda por su producto, se encuentra planeando ampliar su negocio con la compra de más carne de pollo , pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utlizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir haciendo crecer su negocio para sacar adelante a su hijo y a su familia, el es una persona bastante conocida y estimada en la zona donde trabaja, sus clientes lo consideran un padre de familia trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 41 year old family man who lives with his wife and 3 year old son in the Oyotún District of Chiclayo Province, which is located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. For 10 years, he has made his living selling chicken meat in La Compuerta Sector, an annex of Cayaltí District. He travels to this area every day to sell his merchandise to his customers. His business is well-received because it is the only one of its kind in the area. Jaime gives his whole self to make his business successful, since it is the only source of income his family has. Because of the demand for his product, he is planning to expand his business by purchasing more chicken meat. He does not, however, have sufficient capital to carry out his plan, which is why he finds himself, for the first time, requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to use the loan to achieve his objective of expanding his business. His greatest wish is to continue growing his business in order to improve his son's and family's situation. He is a well-known and valued person in the area where he works; his customers consider him a hard working and responsible family man.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Robespierre

texts.es: Robespierre habitante del casco urbano del municipio el Coral, tiene un año de laborar como responsable de Recursos Humanos de la Alcaldia del Coral, es un profesional que ama su familia y ha luchado para salir adelante ya son una familia muy unida, es un profesional que tiene muchos deseos de superacion personal, esta solicitando su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su casa de habitación  construyendo un porche con verjas, así poder tener más seguridad en su vivienda y vivir en mejores condiciones,    se considera como una persona honesta y responsable con capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Robespierre is from the urban hood of the Coral municipality. He has worked for a year as the person in charge of Human Resources at Alcaldia del Coral. He is a professional who loves his family and strives to progress forward as they are a very united family. He is a professional who has a great desire to overcome personal obstacles. He is seeking his first loan from the institution AFODENIC to invest in the improvement of his house, constructing a porch with wrought-iron gates - giving him more security in his house and live in better conditions. He is considered an honest person and responsible for the repayment capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a porch

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Jose es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Jose vende artefactos pequeños, edredones, ollas de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes, también viaja a otras provincias a comercializar sus productos.
Jose necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas y cubrecamas.
Los sueños de Jose son vender por mayor y brindar un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is a member of the community bank "Los Sauces." He is 35 years old and is married with two children. He sells small items, comforters, and pots, made-to-order for his clients. He also travels to other provinces to sell his products.

Jose seeks this loan of 2000 Soles to invest in the purchase of pots and bedspreads. Jose dreams of selling his items wholesale and securing a better future for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pots and bedspreads

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch P. is a 34 year old married woman who lives in Prey Mien village, Takeo province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Sophal Chhim, is a palm juice collector. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

The couple has four children, two of whom support their parents working and two others are students in the public school.

Although they try to work hard with two business activities, they still earn little income to support the family's living. Thus they want to start a new chicken business. In order to do this Mrs. Touch P. decided to ask for a loan to buy chickens to resell and the rest of the loan she will use to buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding.

With this loan, income will increase and the living situation will improve too.

loans.use: To buy chickens to resell and to buy piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en:
Zulfiyya H. is 25 years old and has sold cleaning items in a small shop for the last four years. She started her business with the 100$ starting capital. Over time she expanded her business and now she has a grocery store where she sells her goods.

Weekly Zulfiyya travels to the neighboring town for purchasing new goods. Currently she is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN for purchasing more items to expand her business.

Zulfiyya sincerely thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with the loan repayment.

loans.use: purchase more items to increase profit

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James G., from the village of Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 38 years old and married. To make a living, James owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Engaged in his business for over a year, he earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, James joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to be used as additional capital for his business, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for his business

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira K. is 37 years old and lives in Sevan with her mother and two children. Naira worked as a cook for four years and after that she worked as a shop assistant for three years.

Naira now manages a clothes and shoes business in Sevan fair. She has been engaged in that business for two years and her mother helps her in that engagement. Naira uses the income from her business for her family’s expenses.

Naira asks for a 500,000 AMD loan to buy the spring season’s clothes and shoes for her shop.

loans.use: To buy the spring season's clothes and shoes for her shop

loans.name: Basilides

texts.es:
El señor Basilides R. tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Felipa Orrego, y viven en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio Arroyo Pora distrito de Cambyreta.

El señor Basilides y su esposa son propietarios de un Copetín que poseen en el centro de la ciudad de Encarnacion, especificamente en la zona de la Terminal.
 Ellos realizan comidas y viandas, venden también pollo al espiedo y tienen muchos clientes ya que son conocidos en la zona, y mas aun porque se encuentran en un lugar estratégico por estar a metros de la terminal de ómnibus.
 Se dedican a esta actividad desde hace mas de 5 años, han ido creciendo poco a poco, y mediante este trabajo ellos han mantenido su hogar, su familia, educar a sus hijos y solventar los gastos de la vida diaria. 

Ellos han solicitado este crédito para concretar la compra de un vehículo, que les resulta sumamente necesario debido a que traen los insumos de la ciudad de Posadas (Argentina).
texts.en:
Mr. Basilides R. is 44 years old, married to Mrs. Felipa Orrego. They live in their own house located in the Barrio Arroyo Pora, district of Cambyreta.

Mr. Basilides and his wife own a snack food stand in the center of Encarnación, in the area of the Terminal.

They prepare meals and food as well as grilled chicken, and have many customers as they are popular in the area and even more as they are located in the strategic place, meters from the bus terminal.

They have been doing this for more than 5 years, they have grown little by little, and due to their work they have maintained their home, their family, they have taught their children and taken care of daily expenses.

They have requested this loan to set the purchase of a vehicle which is extremely neccesary as they bring raw material from the town of Posadas (Argtentina).

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ¨Purchase a vehicle

loans.name: Emelda Salomon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Emelda S. (on the left in photo), a 42-year old married resident of Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Emelda S.’s Group.

Emelda is married to Rodrigo S., a jabal-jabal driver, and they are blessed with five children, all now adults. To help her husband in supporting their family, Esmelda opened a little sari-sari store four years ago, now earning an average monthly income of not less than P5,000.00. Emelda joined the cooperative in 2006, and as an active center officer and member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program reaching out to the rural poor, she is requesting a new loan, her eighth, of P12,000.00 to purchase housing materials for house repair. Future income will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, and she is hoping that someday her business will become larger.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of housing materials for house repairs

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Mindanao

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel D. is from the village of Gosi, Tuguegarao City. He is 30 years old and married, with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Arnel owns and operates a motorcycle transport business.  Arnel has been engaged in his business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Arnel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. Arnel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used for the repair and maintenance of his vehicle. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Arnel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To  repair and maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Las Novatas ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Novatas es un banco de 7 mujeres luchadoras quienes buscan con el trabajo diario obtener un futuro para sus familias, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad fue declarada como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad el 1 de Diciembre de 1999, por su belleza arquitectónica, los 4 ríos que bañan la ciudad, su gente es lo que le hace especial a esta ciudad ya que son muy cordiales y amables.

La Sra. Rosa Silvana L. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo realizando los préstamos,  su mamá la invito a ser parte de estas mujeres luchadoras, los préstamos le han beneficiado en la cría de  pollos los que cría a medias con su mamá. También trabaja en la tapicería que es de la familia, labora de lunes a viernes.
 
La Sra. Silvana estudia a distancia y  cursa el sexto año, tiene  veinte años de edad, vive en unión libre y se encuentra contenta ya que tiene cinco meses de embarazo de su primer hijo, vive en casa de sus padres, a quienes ayuda económicamente ya que sus padres no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando. Su nuevo préstamo que realiza en la Fundación Espoir, lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para venderlos y sacar  recursos para su familia. Desea seguir estudiando en la universidad y algún día lograr ser una profesional en medicina ya que este ha sido su sueño desde que era una niña.

 Es el primer crédito de la señora Laura M.,  fue invitada por su hermana que también es socia de nuestra fundación, vive en la de la ciudad de Cuenca por el sector de los 3 Puentes, por el momento se dedica a la cría de cuyes,  los mismos que  los vende en su  casa.  Anteriormente se dedicaba a la costura de jeans pero lastimosamente ya no pudo seguir trabajando por el estrés.

La Sra. Laura tiene 52 años de edad,  es viuda hace 21 años, su esposo murió con cáncer, tiene 6 hijos,  4 de sus hijos ya son casados y viven independientemente, una hija  emigró a otro país, de la cual no recibe ninguna ayuda, y su último hijo trabaja y todo lo que gana es para solventar sus propios gastos.

 Nuestra socia tiene casa propia  gracias a su sacrificio y trabajo. El crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón para poder criar más cuyes, su meta es de seguir luchando para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Novatas consists of seven hard-working women who seek with their daily work to obtain a future for their families. They live in the city of Cuenca. This city was declared a World Heritage Site on the December 1, 1999, for its architectural beauty and the four rivers that flow through the city. Its people are what make it special because they are polite and kind. Sra. Rosa Silvana L. lives in the city of Cuenca. She is in her fourth loan cycle. Her mother invited her to be part of this group of hard-working women. The loans have benefited her in the raising of chickens, which she raises as an equal partner with her mother. She also works in her family's weaving shop, where she works from Monday to Friday. Sra. Silvana studies through distance learning and is in her sixth year. She is 20 years old and lives in with her common law husband. She is happy because she is in her fifth month of pregnancy with her first child. She lives in the house of her parents, whom she helps economically since her parents do not have their own home and are renting one. She will invest her new loan from Fundación Espoir in the purchase of chickens to sell to obtain income for her family. She wants to continue studying at the university and some day to be a medical professional, since that has been her dream since she was a girl. This is the first loan for Señora Laura M.. She was invited by her sister, who is also a member of this foundation. She lives in the city of Cuenca, in the Three Bridges district. At this time she is raising guinea pigs, which she sells from her house. In the past, she sewed jeans, but unfortunately she could not continue working because of the stress. Sra. Laura is 52 years old. She has been a widow for 21 years. Her husband died of cancer. She has 6 children. Four of them are married and live independently. One daughter emigrated to another country, but she does not receive any help from her. Her last son works, and everything he earns goes to pay his own expenses. This bank member has her own house thanks to her sacrifice and work. Her loan will be invested in the construction of a cage so that she can raise more guinea pigs. Her goal is to continue working to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, construction materials

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
A 49-year-old widow with seven children, all attending school, Sarah E. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of soya beans and beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of soya beans and beans to sell

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda D. is from the village of Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 38 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Rhoda owns and operates a construction supplies business. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Now, Rhoda has joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan is her first from PMPC. Rhoda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to buy more construction supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is from the village of Loquilos. She is 58 years old. Mary is separated and has an adult child. To make a living, Mary operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Mary has been engaged in her business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2009, Mary joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Mary is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store. This will be the second loan taken out by Mary from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari (general) store

loans.name: Grecita

texts.en:
Grecita F. is from the village of Libon, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Grecita is married and has four adult children. Grecita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Grecita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Grecita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Grecita is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Grecita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding store inventory; working capital

loans.name: Đồng Nhân 1 - Nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02) Group

texts.en:
L. Trần Thị (20206020015) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Nhân 1 - Nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02).

L. is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Hoàng Thị C. (0) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.



L. Trần Thị  (20206020015) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Nhân 1 - Nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Hoàng Thị C. (0) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Harold Luis

texts.es: Harold Luis B., es un tendero muy joven que tiene una tienda desde que, procedente de la ciudad de Montería, zona ganadera de Colombia, llegó al municipio de Soledad cargado de muchos sueños y no encontró un trabajó. Fue   así como aprendió como ayudante de la tienda de un amigo y tomó esa experiencia para luego emprender su propio negocio en esa misma actividad. Su microempresa funciona desde hace 10 años, pero desde hace 1 año lo compró con sus ahorros, este es el segundo crédito que tiene con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a su credikiva porque planea comprar ranchos víveres y refrescos en mayor volumen preparándose desde ya, para las fiestas que vienen a final de año. Con su negocio vinculado a esta organización  ha ampliado los conocimientos de administración con cursos de capacitación, legalizó su negocio y ya tiene registro mercantil mediante el programa de formalización y legalización empresarial. Su principal sueño es llegar a ahorrar para comprar la vivienda donde funciona porque en la actualidad está en condiciones de arrendamiento, así como seguir estudiando porque aspira a ser un contador juramentado y desde ya se prepara asumir con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo un crédito educativo para ese fin.
texts.en:
Harold Luis B. is a young businessman who owns his own store. He is a native of Monteria, an agricultural area of Colombia. He moved to the town of Soledad with high hopes, but he couldn't find a job. He worked as an assistant at a friend's store and used the experience he gained there to start his own business. He has operated the business for 10 years now, but only bought it outright 1 year ago. This is Harold's second Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo loan, a loan that he will use to buy larger volumes of the meats and cold drinks that his customers will want for year-end parties. Harold has been able to use his connection with the bank to learn new business skills and legalize his business. His greatest hope is to save enough money to buy the building where he operates the business because, for now, he's only renting space. He also wants to continue his accounting studies and he is planning to take out another Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo loan to pay for it.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.
