loans.name: Sonia Carolina

texts.es: Sonia Carolina L. P. de 34 años de edad, es madre de dos pequeños de 10 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Sonia es madre soltera por lo que trabaja mucho para poder solventar todos los gastos y necesidades del hogar y de sus hijos. Ella posee un comedor el cual es ubicado en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad, mismo municipio en el cual reside junto a sus hijos. Sonia trabaja de lunes a sábado junto a su madre, elaborando desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales posteriormente vende con diferentes empleados de la zona. Ella cuenta con una gran ventaja ya que su negocio se encuentra frente a una escuela, así mismo a su alrededor se encuentran varios talleres cuyos empleados son clientes de Sonia. Con el deseo de salir adelante, Sonia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todos los elementos necesarios para elaborar mayor cantidad de comida, ya que de esta forma ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia Carolina L. P., 34, is a single mother of two young ones who are 10 and 8 years of age and in school.  She works hard to meet all her household expenses and her children’s needs.

She has an eatery located in Colón, La Libertad department, the same municipality where she resides with her children.  Sonia works alongside her mother from Monday through Saturday making breakfasts and lunches that she then sells to people who work in the area.  She has a big advantage because her business is located in front of a school and there are also several workshops in the area whose employees are Sonia’s customers.

Wishing to continue making progress, Sonia is asking for a loan to buy all the necessary supplies to make larger amounts of food so that her income will improve and she can provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for food preparation.

loans.name: Battur

texts.en:
Battur B. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Currently they live together with Battur’s parents in his parents' two-bedroom apartment. Battur’s younger brother lives there with his wife too. 

Since 2008 Battur has been running a retail clothes business. He rents a place in Altai Center and sells a variety of wool and cashmere hats, scarfs and gloves. Mongolia is famous for its cashmere and wool products and they are in big demand, especially during the wintertime. Battur adopted this business from his mother, who used to work as a salesperson of wool products in a state department store. Normally, he buys his products from the factory’s wholesale points. 

Next year, Battur is planning to buy a one-room studio apartment for his family. Therefore he is trying to save some money by increasing his business profit. He is one of our reliable customers. This will be his second loan, and he wants to use it to increase his working capital and buy more products before the winter season.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and buy more products before the winter season

loans.name: Ángela Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ángela del Carmen L. V., tiene la edad de 40 años habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino, es casada y su esposo es albañil, y apoya a los gastos que incurre la familia mensualmente, ellos tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad que trabajan y sobreviven de manera independiente y un adolecente que se dedica a los estudios y depende económicamente de sus padres, la señora Ángela es domestica, ellos son una familia muy humilde y que sus ingresos le han impedido el realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda que favorezcan el habitar en mejores condiciones a su familia, es para esto que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que mejoren las comodidades diarias de sus hijos con la instalación de una malla que brinde seguridad a todos los integrantes de su familia, y a futuro heredarles un hogar digno donde puedan convivir con los suyos.
texts.en: Mrs. Ángela del Carmen L. V. is 40 years old. She lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer. She helps out with the family's monthly expenses. She has 3 children. Two of them are grown and they work and survive independently. The other is a teenager who is in school and depends on his parents financially. Ángela is a domestic worker. They are a very humble family and their income has impeded their making improvements on their home to make their living conditions better.  That is why she is asking for a loan to buy construction materials to improve the daily comfort of her children by installing a fence that will offer security to all of the family members. In the future, they will inherit a home fit to live in with their own families.

loans.use: To buy an iron fence

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar P. is a widow who earns her living by operating three business ventures: meat vending, frozen foods sales, and a general store business. She lives in Brgy. Poblacion, Oslob, Cebu.

Pilar joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired toward something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Pilar has been working hard and incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eleventh cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future and support the family's daily needs. 

Pilar P. is truly a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. "Dungganon is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through this alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities they could not have imagined. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her meat vending, frozen foods sales, and general store business operations

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru: Раимкулова Машхура проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 26 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Она хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Mashkhura R. lives in Shahrituz.  She is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She has a high school education. She has been farming for more than five years.  She rents the plot of land where she sows wheat and grows vegetables.  She is taking a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She wants to sow the seeds and to reap a good harvest.

loans.use: buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis M. is 24 years old and has been working as a farmer for the past four years. He sells products such as milk, maize, beans, and vegetables to the local market and various retailers.

This will be Denis' first loan with Juhudi Kilimo. With the anticipated profits, he hopes to further expand his business. In five years, he hopes to have acquired another dairy cow to double his milk production and profits.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som N. is a married woman who currently lives in the province of Siem Reap. To earn of living, she sells sugar cane juice in front of her house and receiving an income from her business in average $2 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who works as chief of building construction. They have five children, all of whom are single, and staying with them under a roof. Som N.’s husband has a few labors to help him for serving his building service. He always gets a lot of order from his customer to build and repair their house. Recently, Som N.’s husband received an order from his client to build a house, but he lacks some construction material for construction yet. So that Som N. would like to request some fund from Kiva for her husband to buy brick, cement, and other construction supplies.

loans.use: To buy brick, cement, and other construction supplies.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham, de 35 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Dina (33)  y sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Los campos de cultivo han sido en la vida de Abraham, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde sembró café y plátano, los cuales una vez cosechados llevara a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad de su familia, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, pues eso afecta mucho su productividad. Para más adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos.Es el segundo  préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado.Abraham tiene planeado invertir  los seiscientos soles solicitados, en la compra de abono e insecticidas que necesita para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Abraham is 35 years old.  He is a very simple and hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife, 33 year-old Dina, and his three young children, for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Farming has been a necessary activity in Abraham's life in order for him to survive.  His parents taught him to work on the farm when he was very young.  He decided to continue in his family's line of work and now he has his own crops.  He grows coffee and bananas which, once harvested, he takes to sell at market in the town of Pichanaki.

What Abraham most likes about his work is sowing his crops since he knows that his family's well-being depends on this activity.  He has been in this business for 15 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be protecting his crops from sharp changes in the weather since this can really affect his productivity.  In the future, Abraham would like to continue working hard and improve his crops.

This is Abraham's second loan from MFP and he knows that the loan money will be very useful to him in carrying out his business.  He is a very responsible member of his community bank which means that he is also a well-respected member.  Abraham plans to invest the 600 Peruvian soles he is requesting in buying manure and insecticides which he needs to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides to improve his crops

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Dioni, préfecture de Konobougou ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de tissus, de céréales et d’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de tissus, de céréales et de l’arachide.                                                                    SIRANDOU T. compte acheter des tissus au niveau du marché de Konobougou pour en faire des draps, qu’elle vend à ses clients du village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses liées à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires de ses enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Benkadi are all married and they have an average age of 33. They each have 3 children and they all live in traditional extended families in the village of Dioni, located in the Konobougou prefecture of the Segou region (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family and they sell fabrics, cereal grains, and peanuts. 

The women of the Benkadi group are on their first group loan and it will be used to purchase fabrics, cereal grains and peanuts. Sirandou T. plans on purchasing new fabrics at the Konobougou market to make sheets. She sells to clients in her village in cash and credit. Her clientele is made up of women and men. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 10 000 FCFA which will be used to make the loan  payments; a portion will be used to cover health care related expenses, to purchase food and pay  for school fees; and the remaining portion will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 48 year old widow who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  buying and selling spices and cosmetics products businesses. She lives in Narra, Palawan.

Lorna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lorna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Lorna is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of spices and cosmetics products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Lamrana. She is married and has 1 child. Lamrana established her clothing business in 2005. She began her business when she got business capital from her husband, who actually advised her to go into such a business. She opens her business 6 days a week and 10 hours a day.

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,800,000 SLL. Lamrana requires a loan in order to buy more bales of used clothing for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es:
José de 38 años, un hombre trabajador  que desde muy joven aprendió por medio de su padre lo que es de mecánica.

El trabaja diariamente se dedica en su taller reparando motocicletas. Lo que le afecta en su trabajo es la delincuencia ya que es muy frecuente en su sector. Está casado y su esposa es comerciante tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años. Con el préstamo él quiere para mejorar su negocio es en la compra de repuestos, llantas, etc. En un futuro quiere abrir otro taller para ayudar a su familia en lo que más necesite.
texts.en:
Jose is a hard-working 38 year old who from an early age learned from his father what he knows about being a mechanic.

He works daily in a dedicated fashion in his shop repairing motorcycles.  What affects him adversely in his work is the delinquency which is very frequent in his sector.  Jose is married and his wife is a merchant.  They have 2 children, aged 8 and 4.

With the loan he wishes to improve his business by buying spare parts, tires, etc.  In the future he wants to open another shop to help his family obtain what they need.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE REPLACEMENT PARTS, TIRES, AND VARIOUS OTHER SUPPLIES

loans.name: Hyacinthe

texts.en:
Hyacinthe is 30 years old and married with three children between one and 3 years old. Hyacinthe sells charcoal and her business is well-organized. She employs two people to help her and she works from 8 am until 9 pm every day. She has one year's experience.

Hyacinthe has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal for sale. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business, satisfy her customers, and save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ma Angelina

texts.es: Angelina es una persona muy trabajadora y creativa ella se dedica a elaborar y a la venta de artesanías de ocoshal, esta se elabora con la hoja seca  que se desprende del árbol de ocote y que es recolectada del piso por las personas que se dedican a elaborar este tipo de reciclado hecho  específicamente con la hoja muerta como principal materia prima. Doña Angelina esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de material para realizarlas como hilo, agujas bolsa para empacarlas etc. Ella tiene con este negocio 14 años y hace fruteros, floreros, canastas, recuerdos para bodas, servilleteros, aretes y muchas cosas mas, ellas sale a venderlas a la cuidad de Morelia y en los santuarios de la mariposa monarca, y dice que abecés tiene pedido para bodas, quince años, bautizos etc. Ella esta muy contenta con lo que hace. Dice que a ella le enseñaron hacer sus artesanías unas personas del Estado de México que les ofrecieron darles un curso de cómo realizar ese tipo de artesanías para aprovechar la materia prima que cae de los árboles. Doña Angelina esta agradecida con este crédito ya que asi podra comprar lo que le hace falta para seguir haciendo las artesanías en ocoshal.
texts.en:
Angelina is a very hard-working and creative person.  She makes and sells  handicrafts made from “ocochal” (small pine leaves).  She makes the crafts with the dry leaves that come off of the “ocote” (type of pine) tree.  The leaves are gathered from the ground by people who make this type of recyclable item, specifically with the dead leaf as the primary material.

Angelina is asking for a loan to buy material for making her handicrafts.  She will buy things like thread, needles, and bags for packing the handicrafts, etc.  

She has had this business for 14 years.  She makes things like fruit baskets, flower vases, baskets, wedding souvenirs, napkin rings, earrings, and many other things.  She goes to the city of Moerlia and the Monarch butterfly sanctuaries to sell them.

Sometimes she has orders for weddings, celebrations of 15th birthdays, and baptisms, etc.  She is very happy with what she does.  She says that people from the state of Mexico taught her how do make her handicrafts.  They offered to teach a course on how to make this type of handicraft by taking advantage of the raw material that falls from the trees.

Angelina is grateful for this loan.  This way she will be able to buy what she needs in order to keep making her handicrafts from ocochal.

loans.use: to make handicrafts from "ocoshal" (small pine leaves).

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Stephen N. is 53 years old and the father of six children. His wife is a housewife. Two of his daughters, Eunice (13years old) and Suzan (15 years old), are in school.

Stephen has been running his dairy business for 21 years. This will be his fourth loan from KADET LTD, and he intends to use it to buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk production and buy more cattle feed.

Stephen hopes to educate his children and improve his business.

loans.use: to educate his children and improve his dairy business.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 26 years old and single. He operates Neema Bookshop so as to earn a living. He also offers computer services such as printing and photocopy. He runs the business with one employee. He also runs a mobile phone money-transfer business so as to supplement his income.  

He was able to start the business after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya. He is requesting 20,000 KES to buy printing machines, a digital camera and text books.

loans.use: To buy printing machines, a digital camera and text books.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Née en 1977 au Bénin, Antoinette est mariée à un certain Germain. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leurs charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Antoinette n’a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer les besoins de sa famille, Antoinette vend depuis près de dix ans divers produits (savons, lait en poudre, etc.) à son domicile au Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Antoinette prépare de l'"Akassa" (une pâte faite à base de la farine du maïs) accompagné de poissons frits qu'elle vend à son domicile. Pour améliorer ses prestations et se faire plus de revenus, Antoinette sollicite pour une troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Antoinette was born in Benin in 1977 and is married to Germain. They have three children, who all attend school and are in their care. The parents share the various household expenses. Antoinette attended only elementary school.

In order to provide for the family, Antoinette has been selling various products, like soap and milk powder, from her home in Benin for nearly ten years. Next to this activity, she makes akassa (a kind of pastry prepared from corn starch) and sells it with fried fish at her home. In order to improve her service and make more profit she came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for the third time for financial assistance. Antoinette has repaid her previous two loans on schedule.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and fried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 38 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,fideos,galletas y golosinas, ella atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y también la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de cuyes, ella vende en forma independiente, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y para comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de fruta, negocio de venta de artesanías, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de leña, negocio de tienda de abarrotes.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Tres Marías” (Three Marys) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

The member is 38 years old and has four children.  She is a grocer selling basic need items like rice, sugar, noodles, cookies and snacks.  She is open from 6am until 10pm.  She also raises guinea pigs that she sells independently.  She is able to raise her children through these businesses.  She wants to expand the grocery store and the guinea pig business.  She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs and basic need items like rice, sugar and milk.

The other group members sell fruit, crafts, vegetables, firewood and groceries.  The member is grateful to all those who share her dream and commits to make her installment payments according to the established payment plan.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and basic need items like rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Cristy has a retail shop that sells green bananas. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy green & yellow bananas for sale.
Cristy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Cristy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green & yellow bananas for sale

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.es: El cliente Aniceto el es mecánico dedicado a la compra y venta de motores, el realiza la compra de motores a medio uso para poder repararlos y venderlos como semi nuevos en buen funcionamiento, este trabajo lo realiza en su taller de mecánica, el cliente es bastante sacrificado y empeñoso en el mismo ya que con el ingreso que obtiene realizando este trabajo puede dar de alimentar a su familia y cubrir todos los gastos de servicio durante el mes, el crédito que solicita el cliente es para poder aumentar su capital y mantener variedad de motores para la disponibilidad de sus clientes, es una persona muy amable preocupado por su familia, trabajador, agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Aniceto is a mechanic who buys and sells engines.  He buys pre-used engines in order to repair them and then sell them as semi-new engines in good working order.  He carries out this work in his workshop.  Aniceto is quite self-sacrificing and determined in his work since he uses the income that he makes to feed his family and cover his monthly bills.  

Aniceto is requesting this loan so that he can increase his capital and have a variety of engines available to sell to his customers.  He is a very kind, hard-working person who looks after his family.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy a range of car engines

loans.name: Truc

texts.en:
Truc, age 27, operates an Internet shop with her husband. They have been engaged in this business, located in front of their house in Ho Chi Minh City, since 2008. The business is able to generate sufficient income to cover all their family's expenses, as well as to cover the study fees for the IT courses that they are currently enrolled in. They have one daughter. 

Truc would like to request a loan to improve her business by buying more computers and appliances, and to make repairs to her shop so as to attract more customers. She is confident that these additions will help her to run her business smoothly, earn a higher income, and save money for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy more computers and appliances for her Internet shop, and to make repairs to her shop so as to attract more customers

loans.name: Hilda Katerine

texts.es:
La Sra. Hilda Katerine pertenece al Banco Comunal “Noche de Luna II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Vive con su pareja, tiene 23 años y no tiene hijos. Desde muy pequeña tuvo afición por los negocios así que por iniciativa propia y junto a su convivente decidió dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, verduras y otros productos de consumo diario en su propia casa.
Actualmente se encuentra muy animada en su negocio y està satisfecha por haber incrementado sus productos de primera necesidad, tiene muy buena clientela por sus vecinos, familiares, clientes fijos y transeúntes. El nuevo préstamo de PEN 1,500.00 quiere invertir en paquetes de fideos, leche en cajas, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, aceites en litros, conservas de pescado en variedad de marcas, paquetes de gaseosas, jugos, cajas de galletas, cajas de golosinas, verduras, frutas, jabas con huevos y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Hilda Katerine es una mujer ambiciosa y se siente muy animada a continuar mejorar su negocio asi que contar con una familia. Agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres de desarrollarse en el medio en que desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Hilda Katerine belongs to the “Noche de Luna II” (Moonlit Night II) communal bank in Tarapoto District, San Martín Province and Department. She lives with her partner. She is 23 years old and has no children. From a very young age she had a liking for business, so she decided to sell groceries, vegetables and other products for daily use in the home. She made the decision on her own initiative and together with her partner.

She is currently very excited about the business, and she is satisfied because she has increased the amount of staple goods that she has. Hilda Katerine has a very good customer base made up of her neighbors, relatives, steady customers and passers-by. She wants to invest this new loan of 1,500 nuevos soles in packets of noddles, boxed milk, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, oil in one-liter containers, several brands of canned fish, soft drinks, juice, boxes of cookies, boxes of sweets, vegetables, fruits, containers of eggs and personal hygiene products so she can continue providing better service to her customers. 

Hilda Katerine is an ambitious woman, and she is very driven to continue improving her business and to start a family. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women to develop the businesses they operate.

loans.use: to buy milk, sacks of rice, canned foods and other products for her store.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres  qui composent le groupe SABALI   sont tous des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à  SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame MAIMOUNA fait le commerce d’huile de palme et de pagnes dans ce groupe de femmes de  SABALI, elle  est debout au milieu.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50 litres d’huile de palme et  5 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Sikasso.
 Elle vend au  grand marché de Sikasso  et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant, en détail et rarement à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group SABALI are all married women who average 30 years of age and four children each. They live mostly in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

This is their third loan cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. Previous loans were repaid in full.

Mrs. Maimouna, one of the group members, sells palm oil and pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She appears standing at the center of the photo.
She plans to use her loan to purchase 50 liters of palm oil and 5 pieces of wax pagnes at the Grand Market of Sikasso. She conducts her sales at retail at that same market and among family members, usually for cash and rarely on credit, to a client base consisting mainly of women.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which she will use to pay the loan and interest and contribute to family expenses. Any remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and pagnes for resale

loans.name: Cherlie

texts.en:
Cherlie is married with five children. Cherlie is 37 years old and lives in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte.

Cherlie sells seafood like crabs and fish to earn a living and has had this business for nine years. All their basics needs are supplied by the profit she earn by selling crabs to her community.

She earns PHP 8000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more crabs and fish to sell.

Cherlie has been a member of GDMPC for one year. Cherlie hopes that in the future her business will improve and expand to sustain their daily life, as well as the education of her children.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs and fish to sell.

loans.name: Kumria

texts.en:
Kumria is a 26-year-old woman who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She obtained a secretarial diploma after high school. She is single and lives with her parent and two sisters who are all totally dependent on the income of Kumria's business to cover their living expenses.

Kumria started her business, which is selling stationery and beauty supplies as well as antiques and gifts, three years ago exactly after her high school. The idea of the business came to her as a result of the difficult living conditions she and her family faced and the ambition of overcoming such a difficult life. Kumria sold some pieces of gold that were available to her family and borrowed from her relatives in order to make up capital when she began her business.

Kumria took a loan of 80,000 Yemeni Rials from Al-Amal Bank in order to purchase more stationery supplies for the new school year as well as to purchase other beauty materials in order to meet the demand of her clients in her neighborhood.

In the future, Kumria plans to expand her business by opening a new independent business in beauty supplies. She is also saving for her sister, who is studying in a private university.

loans.use: to purchase stationery and beauty supplies

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman and has 2 children currently enrolled in school. Jackline owns a salon that she operates out of her home for the past 3 years. Before opening her salon, Jackline supported the family as a housewife. Her primary customers are neighbors and passerby. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her largest monthly expense is food. 

Jackline will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase beauty products for the salon. Jackline aspires to modernize her salon in the future. She joined Yehu because of their efficient loan products.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for the salon.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a 28 year-old married woman. She has 2 children between 2 years and 8 years. She describes herself as aggressive, determined, and focused. She operates a salon business where she provides hair and beauty services to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a shopping center and her primary customers are ladies since she specializes in doing ladies' hair. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate salon equipment. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of cosmetics to meet customer demands, especially as we approach the festive season. Her business goal is to grow her business into a beauty college within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
la sra. Luisa tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera pero tiene 2 hijos, mismos que le ayudan en su cultivo de cafe. Luisa tiene muchos años de experiencia en el manejo del cafe, esta es la fuente de ingreso para el sustento de su familia.
Doña Luisa utilizara el credito para la compra de un Sistema Solar, en su comunidad no cuentan con el servicio de energía Eléctrica, y al tenerlo, sus condiciones de vida mejoraran, su mayor anhelo es comprase un T.V para mirar las programaciones durante la noche.
texts.en: Luisa, 47, is single but has two children that help her grow coffee.  Luisa has many years’ experience with coffee crops; this is her family’s source of income.  Luisa will use the loan to buy a solar generator because her community does not have electricity and having it her living conditions will improve.  Her greatest wish is to buy herself a television set to watch programs at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar generator.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, tiene 56 años, es madre D. 5 hijos, venD. gelatina, jugos, cancha y chupetes, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 17 años, los primeros préstamos que recibió D. Finca lo invertió en su negocio el cual le da buena rentabilidad y con las buenas ganancias que obtuvo y sus ahorros pudo construir su casa y alimentar bien a sus hijos, ya que anteriormente el dinero que ganaba no le abastecía en lo suficiente para mantener bien a su familia, le gusta las capacitaciones porque le enseña a ser puntual también les enseña como evitar las enfermedades y educar bien a sus hijos, con el préstamo que solicita viajará a lima para comprar ropa variada y venderlas por campaña naviD.ña. Su meta es construir el segundo piso D. su casa.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the Prosperidad communal bank.  She is 56 years old, and she has five children.  She sells gelatin, juice, popcorn and lollipops.  She has been a member of FINCA for 17 years.

She invested the first loans that she received in her business, which gives good profits.  With the good earnings that she got and with her savings she was able to build her house and feed her children well.  The money that she earned previously did not proviD. sufficiently to support her family well.

She likes the trainings because they teach her to be punctual, how to avoid illnesses, and how to educate her children well.

With the requested loan she will travel to Lima to buy various clothes.  She will sell the clothes for the Christmas season.

Her goal is to build a second floor to her house.

loans.use: to buy various clothes.

loans.name: Tavau

texts.en:
Tavau is a married mother with 10 children. She is 50 years old.

Tavau owns and operates a business venture, selling breadfruit products in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Tavau needs a loan of 1,500 Somoa Tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST or US $188 per week) to supplement her family's income.

Tavau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tavau's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Komilhucha

texts.ru: Комилхуча кредитор организции с 2007 года. Он торгует на рынке продуктами питания. Имеет троих детей, жена работает медсестрой в больнице. Сам Комилхуча очень энергичный мужчина, который успевает все и в семье и в бизнесе. Он закупает товар у оптовых фирм и хочет увеличить следующий закуп кондитерских изделий. Комилхуча очень ответственный и пунктуальный мужчина, которому доверяет организация.
texts.en: Komilhucha has been working with the field partner since 2007. He sells groceries at a market. He has 3 children and his wife works as a nurse in a hospital. Komilhucha is a very energetic man who manages to do everything, at home and in his business. He buys the products wholesale and wants to increase the volume of his next confections order. Komilhucha is a very responsible and punctual man who is trusted by the field partner.

loans.use: to purchase of chocolade and other confections

loans.name: Essio Alberto

texts.es:
Essio es un hombre de 34 años y vive en Isla Trinitaria, un sector peri-urbano de Guayaquil. Allá tiene un taller de aluminio y vidrio roca firme, que fundó una vez que había ahorrado suficiente dinero para parar de trabajar desde su propia casa. 

Essio trabaja solo y sin ningun problema. Ni siquiera la alta delincuencia de su area le afecta, como pretende.

Está casado con su esposa que trabaja como quehaces domestica. Juntos tienen un niño que nació hace un año. 

Para su futuro, Essio está soñando con la expansión de su negocio, y está dispuesto a trabajar duro para hacer ello una realidad.
texts.en:
Essio is 34 years old and lives in Isla Trinitaria, a peri-urban area of Guayaquil.  There he has an aluminum and glass workshop, that he started when he had saved enough money to work from his own home.

Essio works alone and without any problems.  Even the high crime rates in his area do not affect him, as he expected.

He is married and his wife does housework.  Together they have a child who was born a year ago.

In the future, Essio dreams of expanding his business and he is ready to work hard to make it a reality.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum materials.

loans.name: Ivonne Lucia

texts.es:
Ivonne Lucia es natural de Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente. Ivonne es madre de un niño de 9 años, el cual está cursando el cuarto año de educación primaria; su platillo preferido es el “Arroz con Pollo”, este platillo se caracteriza por llevar un aderezo a base de especias como el culantro en el cual se va a cocinar el pollo dándole un sabor agradable.

Ivonne disfruta de su tiempo libre de la lectura y escuchar música, debido a que no tenía los medios económicos suficientes solo ha cursado estudios secundarios y le hubiera gustado de sobremanera ser profesora de educación inicial. Ivonne actualmente se dedica a la siembra de algodón en la parcela que ella tiene, su pareja trabaja en una mototaxi, en la cual transporta pasajeros por el barrio donde ella vive, el trabaja alrededor de cuatro horas diarias y con esta labor apoya mucho con los gastos del hogar, en un día puede ganar aproximadamente S/. 70 , en un día muy bueno puede ganar aproximadamente S/.90 y con ello obtener ingresos adicionales para los gastos adicionales del hogar, ya que actualmente no hay mucha produccion agricola y no hay muchos ingresos por esta actividad,  ella cree que su pareja tiene acogida ya que hay mucha necesidad de los pobladores por movilizarse, la persona que animo a su pareja a incursionar en esta actividad fue su papa dándole la iniciativa de que compre un mototaxi.

Ivonne agradece a los a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado podrán brindarle un mantenimiento general a la herramienta de trabajo de su pareja y con ello tendrán más clientes y mejoraran los ingresos para el hogar dando una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, y permitirle comprar otra mototaxi, para así en algunos meses poder cumplir su sueño “Tener una empresa de exportación de algodón”.
texts.en:
Ivonne Lucia is from Ica, Perú.  Ica is located in the Sechura desert approximately four hours south of Lima, the country's capitol, and it is hailed by Peruvians as "La Tierra del Sol" which means "The Land of the Sun."  It is known in Perú for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.7 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most of all, for being the source of the traditional drink of Perú, Pisco.  In this warm and arid climate, you find Ivonne's house and business.  She is the mother of a 9 year old, who is in fourth grade in school; her favorite dish is chicken and rice, which is characterized by a dressing consisting of spices like cilantro in which the chicken is cooked, giving it a nice flavor.  

Ivonne enjoys her free time reading and listening to music.  Due to the fact that she did not have enough economic resources, she was only able to finish high school though she would have loved to be a kindergarten teacher.  Ivonne currently makes a living growing cotton on her lot of land, and her husband works on his motorcycle taxi, with which he transports passengers through the neighborhood where they live.  He works approximately four hours a day and with this work he helps a lot with the household costs.  He can earn about 70 soles (or about 26 dollars) per day, and on a good day he can earn about 90 soles (about 33 dollars), and with these extra earnings he can help with additional household costs.  Since there is not much agricultural production at present nor much earning for that work, Ivonne believes that her husband is well-received and that there is a great necessity for people to get from here to there.  The person who encouraged her husband to get into this work was his father, who motivated him to purchase a motorcycle taxi.  

Ivonne is grateful to those who loan through Kiva because with this support being given, they will be able to provide general maintenance for her husband's motorcycle and have more customers.  This will improve the earnings for the household, providing a better quality of life for her family and allowing them to purchase another motorcycle taxi which will make it possible to achieve their dream within several months: to have a cotton exportation business.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Srita Sonia es madre soltera vive en la casa de su familia en la ciudad de Caacupé, trabajó casi 10 años en una peluquería y a la vez estudiaba , hace 1 año que se independizó abriendo su propia peluquería en la ciudad de Caacupé , donde ya cuenta con clientela formada.
Comenta que su negocio es muy concurrido pues ella siempre atiende con simpatía y buena onda a todos los clientes y clientas. Una de sus metas es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de sus trabajo y a la vez poder dar fuentes de trabajo a otras personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra tintes, esmaltes para uñas, tijeras, peines y demás insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su negocio y de esa forma poder brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother living in her family’s house in the city of Caacupé.  He worked for almost ten years in a beauty salon while going to school.  A year ago she became independent and opened her own beauty salon in the city of Caacupé where she has a well-established clientele.

She comments that her business is very well-attended because she treats customers pleasantly and she is charming with both male and female customers.  One of her goals is to continue growing to continue helping her family through her work while at the same time being able to provide employment for other people.

She’s asking for the loan to buy hair color, nail polish, scissors, combs and other supplies needed to stock the business and provide good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ross Mistica Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores que se dedican cada uno a sus actividades uno de ellos es Luis Alberto quien tiene ocho años de vender prendas de oro, es casado y tiene cinco años de estar trabajando con la institución, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de oro como anillos de graduación, pulseras, brazaletes, cadenas para hombre, cadenas para damas etc. Yovana vende fritanga los fines de semana y Catalina tiene una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three enterprising members who each have their own sectors of work. One of the members is Luis Alberto, who has eight years of experience in selling gold jewelry. He is married and has been working with this institution for five years. He will invest this loan into buying gold jewelry such as graduation rings, bracelets, armbands, and men's and women's chains. Yovana sells fried food on the weekends and Catalina has a small grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy gold jewelry such as graduation rings, bracelets, armbands, and men's and women's chains.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 23 years old and deals in firewood and charcoal trade. She is a mother of three children whose spouse provides them with additional income. She has been in this business for the last two years, doing well.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase stock of charcoal and firewood

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business and educate her children.

She hopes to have a successful business and a happy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana D. is 33 years old. She is married and has a boy. She has graduated marketing and she has worked as a marketing specialist in the Forest Economy Directorate in Blagoevgrad.

A year ago she was discharged from work and started her own business. She is a sales representative of a Perfumery Catalogue Trade Company.

Svetlana needs $ 2 000 loan to equip the office she rented for her business

loans.use: To equip her office

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Komlan K. was born in 1965 in Dévémé. He is married, the father of six, and takes care of two younger brothers. Making charcoal is now his principal business activity, which has earned him the name «Papa Akato». His wife helps him sell charcoal at markets. His revenues are put towards buying trees to produce charcoal and towards covering household expenses. Presently, he is requesting a loan of $650 to buy more trees because of a strong demand for charcoal. This business, when it is financed, will allow him to completely improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1959 à Dévémé, Monsieur K. Komlan est marié et père de six (06) enfants. Il a à sa charge deux petits frères. La production du charbon reste son activité principale. Ce qui lui fait porter le nom de « Papa AKATO ». Sa femme l’aide à vendre le charbon dans les marchés. Ses revenus son destinés à acheter d’autres arbres pour produire de charbons et à subvenir aux charges du ménage. Monsieur K. Komlan sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter des arbres et produire plus de charbon face à la forte demande. Cette activité, une fois financée pourra lui permettre d’arriver à une amélioration parfaite des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy wood for the production of charcoal

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 44-year-old single mother of two children: a daughter who is 23 and a son who is 20. They are natives of the state of Yucatán. Faced with the need to provide her children with sustenance and education, Lourdes began selling clothing eight years ago. She would go to neighboring small towns on weekends to sell her goods. The business has done very well and her products are in high demand. She would now like to continue to grow.

At this time, Lourdes needs a loan of $475 to acquire the merchandise necessary for meeting the demands of her customers. It hasn’t been easy for Lourdes being the only source of income in her home, but the family has worked together to overcome every obstacle and move forward. Now you can be part of the growth of this business by helping her.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lourdes tiene 44 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijos, y una mujer de 23 años y un varón de 20, ellos son originarios del estado de Yucatán. Ante la necesidad de darle sustento y educación a sus hijos, Lourdes inició con la venta de ropa hace ocho años, aprovechando su cercanía con pequeños poblados iba a vender los fines de semana y le fue muy bien en su negocio, sus productos tuvieron mucha aceptación de sus clientes y ahora quiere continuar creciendo.

En estos momentos Lourdes necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. No ha sido fácil para Lourdes ser el único sostén de su hogar, pero con la unión de la familia han podido superar todos los obstáculos y salir adelante, ahora tu puedes ser parte del crecimiento de este negocio, decídete a ayudarla.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara and her husband raise dairy cows, the same who produce milk marketed to Pil Andina (Milk Industrial Plant). This is their principal source of income, maintaining their 3 children. Genara lives in the community of Laja-Ninachiri (an hour and a half from the city of La Paz).

She asks for a loan to purchase a cow to increase the production of milk. This is Genara's first loan with Impro, and their evaluation qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Genara y su esposo se dedican a la criaza de sus vacas lecheras de mediana raza, las mismas que producen leche para comercializarla a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); esta es su principal fuente de ingreso familiar con que mantiene a sus 3 hijos quienes todavía dependen de ella. Genara vive en la Comunidad de Laja - Ninachiri (A una hora y media de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Mrs. Faith O. is a married woman with a child and she is 28 years old. She sells fresh meat in the open-air market in her community. Faith has been with LAPO for the past 4 years as a member of a union. She hails from a semi-urban sector of Edo State, Nigeria.

Faith has been in this business since 1999. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 400 for business growth and to buy more meat for resale.

loans.use: To buy more meat for sale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 35-year-old business woman in the Vituka area. For 4 years, she has had a shop and sells soft drinks and processed water wholesale. She also sells children's clothing.

Amina requests a loan of $S950 to purchase more supplies to sell to increase her business.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: A. Bola is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children and she lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a stylist and also sells hair cream and relaxer. She has 14 years experience in this business. She needs a loan to buy more hair cream, relaxer, and weaving product to sell.

loans.use: To buy more hair cream and relaxer to sell

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
"I am Shamim A. from Faisalabad, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I am married and the mother of three: two boys and one girl. Currently, both of my sons attend school whereas my daughter is not of school-going age yet. I wish my kids to complete their studies and hence polish their futures.

My husband has a paint business and we also supply various bakery items to different bakeries in the city. Now, we require a loan to expand our bakery items business.

My group members are: Shahnaz R. and Zakia O.. Both of them need loans for their blanket businesses."

loans.use: Expand her bakery wholesale supply business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with two kids. He lives in Vinogradovo with his family. Alexander sells watches, batteries, hair dryers, drills, calculators, flashlights and other small items at the local market. His vending kiosk is located in the central part of the market which gives it a favorable location for trade. Alexander has been in this business for 8 years. Currently, he has about $3000 in inventory. His available turnover capital is about $2000 and his monthly profit is about $500.

Alexander’s natural cheerfulness and optimism have helped his enterprise grow and flourish. Today he is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more inventory. He is hoping to increase his sales and earn extra income. Alexander is planning to invest generated revenue into the further expansion of his business. He is hopeful that with hard work, determination, and financial assistance his business will continue to be successful and provide himself and his family with stable, long term income.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es:
Ever since she was very young Fidela has been connected with work in the business sector. Before marrying and relocating to the city of Huancayo, she sold wholesale goods in her native city of Huaraz. As a result of the quality of her products and services she was very well known; nonetheless she had to leave this occupation in order to start her family with the love of her life in another city. Since relocating, things have not been well for her, but her strength and desire for progress has always overcome the difficulties. Because of the economic crisis going on in their household her husband decided to go to another city to work, and comes for short periods to visit them. For this reason she decided to get herself back into business, but this time selling beauty products and clothing. The aspiration to increase her sales area and to offer more and better quality goods leads her to ask for a loan to start up this project. Your important support will contribute to the dreams of this self-sacrificing family mother.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

DesD. muy joven Fidela ha estado vinculada a la labor comercial, antes D. contraer matrimonio y radicar en la ciudad D. Huancayo, ofertaba productos en gran mercado D. su natal Huaraz, por la calidad D. sus productos y la calidad D. su servicio era muy conocida, sin embargo tuvo que abandonar esta ocupación para conformar su familia con el gran amor D. su vida en otra ciudad.DesD. que se instalo las cosas no han sido buenas para ella pero siempre su esfuerzo y ganas D. progreso han podido más que las dificultades, su esposo a raíz D. la crisis económica que se vivía en su hogar decidió marcharse a otra ciudad para trabajar en ella y viene por pequeños periodos a visitarlos, por esta razón fue que ella decidió reincorporarse a la actividad comercial pero esta vez vendiendo productos D. belleza y prendas D. vestir.El deseo D. incrementar su radio D. acción y ofrecer mayor cantidad y mejor calidad D. artículos la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para poner en marcha este proyecto.Tu importante ayuda contribuirá con los sueños D. esta abnegada madre D. familia.

loans.use: Increased capital in order to offer more and better quality of goods.

loans.name: Alegria De Villa Flores Group

texts.en:
Maria is a 22 year-old lady working hard to improve the lives of her two young children. She and her husband have had a hard time making ends meet in their community of Pantoja, an impoverished area on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She is excited about taking out this loan because she believes it could be the extra bit of help she needs to begin to really change things.

Maria runs a small business selling a variety of vegetables and fruits to her community members; she is taking this loan out because she wants to begin providing a better variety and higher quality of produce. Through the business-training classes she was required to take before requesting her loan, she learned about how to market products effectively, and how quality really does make a big difference in overall sales—she is very anxious to apply these new skills to her business.

She dreams of being able to grow her business in steps, first renting her own small store, and eventually having enough money to buy her own store. By taking these measure, she hopes to proviD. the means to send her two children to college so they can become educated and professional members of society. For herself, she dreams of growing intellectually, and to be not just a good business woman, but a great one.

If she has a few moments of free time, Maria loves to read, keep her house clean, and participate in a women’s club in her community that works together to keep their children and youth educated about HIV/AIDS and other issues that pose health issues to them.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Maria herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of fresh fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Festa

texts.en: Festa Amulike is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 30 years old, married, and has one nine year old child.  In 2008, Festa  established her own tailoring business with the help of Selfina, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements.  Festa now requires a loan of $175 in order to buy more cloth for her boutique.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for the boutique.

loans.name: Fortuna

texts.es:
Mrs Fortunata is a partner of Communal Bank Señor D. los Milagros, she lives downtown Imicate, of the district and province of Yunguyo. 20 years ago, she took 3 arrobas (unit of weight of 32 lbs) of manna to the city of Tacna with the idea of inviting her godfather and relatives, when she got there she ended up selling two arrobas of manna in minutes. She decided then with her husband to buy a grain roasting machine to start up a business. They were the first ones roasting manna. They started with a first loan of $100 that she used to buy 10 arrobas of corn two years ago. With new loan of $525 that will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy 20 arrobas of corn. Her production of manna first quality will be delivered directly to the merchants who take it the city of Tacna. She sells the manna second quality at the weekly fairs in Yunguyo on Sundays. She and her husband feel very happy that their children also work in the same business assuring this way their family income. Fortunata is 55 years old, she only studied until 5th year of elementary school, she is married and a mother of 9 children 4 boys and 5 girls, a son is still with her and he is in school; her vision is to support her business and to have her last son finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal del Señor D. los Milagros, domiciliada en el Centro Poblado D. Imicate, del distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo. Hace 20 años llevaron tres arrobas D. maná a la ciudad D. Tacna con el objetivo D. invitar a su padrino y familiares y resulto vendiendo al llegar a la ciudad dos arrobas D. maná en minutos, desD. entonces han decidido con su esposo comprar la maquina tostadora para emprender el negocio. Fueron los primeros en dedicarse al tostado D. maná, iniciando con un primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con ella compro 10 arrobas D. maíz hace dos años, Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses comprará 20 arrobas D. maíz primera. Su producción D. maná primera lo entrega directamente a los comerciantes que llevan a la ciudad D. Tacna, y maná segunda los venD. en las ferias semanales los días domingos en Yunguyo; ella y su esposo se sienten felices por lo que sus hijos también se dedican a este mismo negocio asegurando D. esa manera sus ingresos familiares. Fortunata tiene 55 años D. edad, estudió hasta segundo D. primaria, es casada y tiene 9 hijos 4 varones y 5 mujeres, esta a su lado un hijo varón estudiando en el Colegio; su visión es mantener su negocio y hacer estudiar a su último hijo.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba D. is 31 years old. She is separated from her husband, and she has an adorable daughter. She started her business to keep herself busy and active when she found herself sad and depressed due to her separation, and in order to have an independent income source.

More specifically, two years ago, Nasiba began selling underclothes for women and girls. Because she has always liked sales, business went well soon after she started her operation, and she has continued selling underclothes since then. At the present time, Nasiba is living with her parents. Her ultimate dream is to own her house, study a major or career, improve her business, and provide her daughter with schooling.

Today she is requesting a loan of $500, which she will repay over 12 months, in order to purchase more underclothes and to thereby have a greater variety of clothing. In turn, she hopes to earn more money. With your help, this will be possible. Please support this dedicated mother to make her dream become a reality.

loans.use: To diversify her product line by purchasing additional new underclothes to sell for women and girls

loans.name: Hosana Group

texts.en:
Silvia has owned her own fish-selling business in Arusha for six years. She is single and has no children. She works daily from 8:00am to 10:00pm and generates a monthly profit of approximately $350. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fish for her business and increase her profit.

Silvia will share this loan with her group member, Anna C., who owns her own shop in which she sells groceries.

loans.use: To buy more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of live chickens to re-sell

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married, and she is a food seller. Every day, she works at her business and earns a small profit from her sales.

Khadija is requesting a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia empezó su negocio con 2 pacas de ropas y luego lo fue incrementando. Estas pacas se las regalo su hija y ahora con dinero de ella compra mas pero quiere seguir invirtiendo en el negocio con el cual ya tiene 8 años. Lo inicio para salir adelante con sus hijos, ya que necesitaba dinero para apoyarlos con sus estudios.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $225 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y vender ropa en colonias cercanas del sector, pero los mercados le piden una estructura por eso no ha podido vender en ellos y con este crédito va a comprarla.
texts.en:
Emilia started her business with two packages of clothing in bulk, and grew bit by bit. She started the business so that her children could get ahead in life, since she needed the money to pay for their schooling. Her daughter gave her those first packages of clothes as a gift, and now Emilia buys bulk clothing with her own money. She would like to invest more in the business, which is now eight years old. She needs a loan of US$225 to buy merchandise and to sell clothing in regional markets. These markets require her to have a physical structure from which to sell her clothes, so she will use this loan to buy a small stand. Emilia will repay this loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and a stand

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells groceries in her shop. She has been in this business for a long time. Comfort has a good relationship with her customers and this has attracted more customers to her store. Comfort is 50 years old and married with five children. Comfort is requesting a loan of N50,000 ($425 USD) to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions, and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Aisha K., a 28-year-old woman from Mwanza. She is single and has two children, who are 5 and 8 years old, respectively.

Aisha has been running a tailoring business since 2006. Indeed, she purchases vitambaa (materials), vitenge (traditional Tanzanian clothes with wax prints), and kanga (printed cotton fabrics, often with borders along all four sides) and makes them into clothing, primarily for women. She works at her business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week, though she is assisted by one employee. By doing so, Aisha is able to earn approximately $295 per month from her business operations. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $425 in order to buy additional vitambaas, vitenges, and kangas. In the future, she plans to add even more clothes to her inventory. Aisha thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. As such, one of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional materials, clothes, and fabrics

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a member of the Suni (“Strength” in Quechua) Village Bank. Aurea is 43 years old and married with three children. Aurea travels to different regional fairs every day during potato harvesting season to buy potatoes and grains. She also gives farmers money during planting season so that they can buy fertilizers, then visits the same farmers during the harvest to collect potatoes. She and her husband own a car, which he uses to transport the potatoes. Aurea needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy potatoes. She dreams that her children will become working professionals, to have good health, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. Aurea es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Aurea viaja a las ferias de la región todos los días por época de cosecha en donde compra papa, cereales, también en época de siembra da dinero adelantado a los agricultores para la compra de abonos y luego en época de cosecha va a recoger los productos, para el traslado de los productos tiene un carro que es conducido por su esposo. Aurea necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa. Los sueños de Aurea son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener buena salud y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Akwasi

texts.en:
Akwasi A. is a thirty two year old single father with one child. He lives with his child and younger brothers at Abofour in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Akwasi has been a carpenter for the past six years and carpentry has been his main occupation and sole source of income for his family. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of furniture. He produces dinning tables, sitting room chairs etc... He has recently begun selling grocery products like sugar, evaporated milk etc...from his shop.

Akwasi's lack of adequate working capital does not allow him to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This situation slows down his work because he has to wait for funds from his customers before any work can begin. He requests this loan to enable him to procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sand paper etc... to improve his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income and ensure a better living for his family. Akwasi belongs to a village bank called ‘Fear Not’.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sand paper etc.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya is a married woman who lives alone and works hard for the good of her three children. The  training she has given her children allows her to count on their strong support in working the fields. Zulfiya’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her, and they have gathered many lessons during this time that they will use when they form their own households. What Zulfiya urgently needs right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for the care of their crops, so that they can produce a product that meets the demands of the market. Zulfiya doesn’t just need good land; she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Nhev

texts.en: Nhev S. Nan, 29, lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making about $15 in revenue per day. Her husband earns $3 a day working as a security guard. This couple has two school-aged children. They need a loan so they can start raising pigs for additional profit.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 35 years old and married with four children. She has a retail business selling yam tubers, and has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan amount of 50 000 NGN to purchase more yam tubers to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yam tubers to sell

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.ru: Саиднисо женщина , которая кредитуется с 2007 года.Сначала своего бизнеса у Саиднисо оборотный капитал составлял не большую сумму.А на сегодня его оборотный капитал увеличился в несколько раз.Это вывод того, что она использует кредит на расширение своего бизнеса.Саиднисо  живёт в городе Чкаловске, и торгует также на рынке города Чкаловска.Привозит товар с Бишкека сама два раза в месяц.Параллельно с улучшением её бизнеса у неё улучшилось семейное состояние.Муж работает на заводе специалистом- механиком, но его заработная плата не хватает на полное хорошее проживание.Поэтому в помощь ему Саиднисо каждый день сидит и торгует на рынке.
texts.en:
Saidniso is a woman who has been a borrower since 2007. When she started her business her working capital was not large. Today, her working capital has increased several times over. This is the result of her using credit to grow her business. Saidniso lives in Chkalovsk and sells at the Chkalovsk market. She brings her products from Bishkek herself twice a month. In parallel to improvements in her business her family situation has improved. Her husband works at a factory as a specialist-mechanic, but his salary is not enough for a full, good lifestyle. This is why Saidniso helps him by sitting and selling everyday at the market.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Раджабова Фируза проживает в районе РУдаки. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Работает врачом в местной амбулатории. Кроме того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот в торговле лекарствами, планирует получить кредит. Поэтому и обратилась к нам за кредитом. Имеет частную аптеку, которая работает для населения кишлака. Это дает возможность жителям своевременно оказать первую помощь себе и своим близким.
texts.en:
R. Firuza lives in the Rudaki region. She is married and has six children. She works as a doctor at the local clinic. In addition, in order to increase turnover in medicine sales she plans to get a loan. This is why she has turned to us for a loan. She has a private pharmacy which works for the village residents. This allows residents to provide timely first aid to themselves and to those close to them.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Toun's Group

texts.en:
