This small loan is for four women who live in the province of Siem Reap in Cambodia. Mrs. Toun K., 24, has been recruited by the other members to be the group leader. Presently, she owns a workshop where she and her husband make Khmer noodles to sell out of their home. She also sells her noodles to regular customers who are market sellers who come to buy in bulk at her house.

Toun K. ran out all of the necessary raw materials from her stock. Because she lacks the capital to replenish her stock, she is applying for a loan to purchase rice for making noodles to sell.

The other three borrowers jointly taking this loan are:
Toun T., who will use the loan to buy a motor she can use to support her business and for her family’s riding needs.
Sok K., a chicken seller who will use the loan to purchase a motorbike to transport chickens to sell more quickly.
Sin C., who sells Chinese noodles in the market and who will use the loan for capital to begin raising pigs at home.

loans.use: To purchase rice to make noodles to sell

loans.name: Bal Qeis Group

texts.en: Bal Qeis is the leader of Bell Qeis group. There are three members in this group and each of them wants to take out a loan for her business. Bell Qeis wants a loan for her husband's fruit and vegetable shop. Allyia wants a loan for her husband's car parts shop. Soeiullah wants a loan for her tailoring business. They are requesting a group loan of 20,000 AFN and they are very thankful to AFS and to Kiva lenders who support entrepreneurs all over the world.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga raises hogs in her village located in the mountainous municipality of San Agustin, Isabela. Hog raising is one of her family's sources of income that she patiently maintains. She is 56 years old and married to Rolando. The couple is thankful because they are blessed with three children. All three are married and living away from home.

Dominga is requesting a loan amounting to 8,000 Philippine Pesos as additional capital for her business. She believes that the loan will be a big help in maintaining her hogs and in meeting their needs. The couple doesn’t want to depend on their children’s financial support, thus they are doing their best.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en: Edward K. is the leader of Zibula Atudde group in Mityana. He is a hard working and devoted member of his lending group. Edward has had a produce selling business for over 10 years whereby he buys produce from fellow farmers and sells again to the traders in the various markets and trading centers. He has a store where he stocks his produce for easy access. He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for his stock so that he will be able to make more profits that can enable him to care for his family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda B. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Melinda owns and operates a business raising native chickens for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Melinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Melinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith A. started raising pigs since 1993. She is 39 years old mother of 4 children. She said that her business is doing well until now. She has a barn at the back of her house and currently raising 5 pigs for fattening. She wanted to buy more piglets to grow her business even more, that is why she requested a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. Receiving this loan is really helpful because this is already Judith A.'s  life, to grow pigs.

loans.use: piglets and feed

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: D. Julienne est née le 16 juillet 1947 à Cotonou. Julienne est mariée et mère de 6 enfants, tous scolarisés. Julienne est allée à l’école mais n’a pas fini le cours primaire. C’est la couture que Julienne a fini par apprendre comme métier. Cependant Julienne n’a pas exercé ce métier de couture. C’est au commerce que Julienne s’est finalement donnée. Julienne vend divers articles: tissus, huile végétale et autres biens qu’elle distribue à ses clients à crédit. Julienne vend aussi à manger dans une baraque non loin de chez elle. Julienne sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Julienne was born on July 16, 1947 in Cotonou. She is married and the mother of six children who are all in school. She attended school but didn’t finish primary school. Sewing is what Julienne finally came to learn as a trade. Yet she has not worked in sewing. Ultimately, commerce is what she has devoted all her time to. She sells various items: cloth, vegetable oil, and other goods, which she distributes to customers on credit. She also sells prepared food in a stall not far from her home. Julienne is requesting financial support from ALIDé for bolstering her working capital, so as to respond better to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, 50-liter drums of vegetable oil, and some cloth

loans.name: Mrs. Seang Lay Oeng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seang Lay O. is the group leader who has been selected by the five members in Angk Svay Chek village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Seang Lay O. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5 acre) field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this planting, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad affect on her crop. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and, with the rest, she will hire laborers to work on the field.

Mrs. Seang Lay O. is a 27-year-old widow with a child who is too young to work or study because the child is only two years old.

Two members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to help with her rice field

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna M. is from the village of Mitan-ag, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and is married. Edna owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas and vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Noraida

texts.en: Noraida T. is a 62 year old transport service operator living in a Habitat for Humanity village in Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila. She lives with her husband and three adult children. Noraida owns and manages a fleet of motorized tricycles. She has three units of tricycles plying the Baseco-Delpan-Divisoria route. She has been in this business for three years now. She employs two drivers. She earns a total of close to P 12,000.00 every month. From her profits, she was able to improve their house. She has just finished paying off her latest loan from CCT. She is now applying for a new loan in the amount of P 12,000.00 so she can have enough funds for the mechanical maintenance of her fleet. She will also purchase spare tires and other parts. Noraida is looking forward to buying her 4th tricycle unit soon. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Mechanical maintenance of tricycle fleet

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn A. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Manuel Alonzo

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 20 años de edad, que vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de un mes de nacido en casa de su suegra en el sector Ucupe, en el distrito de Lagunas, ubicado a 35 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años trabaja como mototaxista, empezó alquilando mototaxis y desde hace un año pudo adquirir una propia gracias a su esfuerzo. Este negocio es la única fuente estable de ingresos con el que cuenta. Por otro lado trabaja eventualmente como obrero agrícola.

Debido al tiempo de uso otorgado a su vehículo Manuel está pensando en brindarle un mantenimiento general para que continue operativo por lo que está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es construir su casa propia e instalar una bodega. El es un joven trabajador y que siempre afronta responsablemente los retos que le presenta la vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, 20, lives with his wife and one-month-old newborn son in his mother-in-law's house in the Ucupe sector, Lagunas district, which is 35 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a mototaxi driver for the past 3 years. He started with leased vehicles but a year ago was able to buy his own, thanks to his work effort. This work is his only stable source of income. He also works occasionally as a temporary farm worker. Due to the heavy usage of his vehicle, Manuel needs to take it in for general servicing so that it will continue to operate. This is the reason behind his first loan request of 500 new soles to Edpyme Alternativa. His greatest hope is to build his own house and install a store. He is a hard-working young man who responsibly faces the challenges that life presents.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For mototaxi maintenance.

loans.name: St. Theresa Group

texts.en:
Belinda is twenty–two years old. She is single and has one child who is in school. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coast in the western region of Ghana and the main occupation in this area is fishing businesses.

Belinda runs a store in the community. She is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Theresa and the members of the group are mainly traders. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
K. Yusuf is 46 years old, has a secondary technical education, and is married with three children. He lives in the town of Kanibadam, Tajikistan.

Yusuf has a grocery store and has been in this business for five years. He plans to use the loan to increase his product selection. His store is located ten kilometers away from the center of the region and is one of only two stores in the village that sell food products to local residents.

Because the stores in the center of the region close early, residents returning from work cannot always purchase necessary food items. Yusuf’s store takes into account the needs of the clients and is open until late evening, giving residents the opportunity to purchase necessary products.

On the eve of the New Year Yusuf plans to restock his products to meet all the needs of his clients. Be an important part of the growth of Yusuf’s business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of his goods

loans.name: Heydi

texts.es: Heydi A., es soltera, habita en la comarca Villa Álvarez, vive en la casa de sus padres, realiza estudios de secundaria,  su actividad principal es trabajar en  las actividades del campo con su padres, ella es una mujer dispuesta a salir adelante, con su inventario actual del ganado que ella posee de herencia de su papá, Heydi necesita del crédito para realizar la compra de 3 ternero desarrollo, para engordarlo y obtener mejor ingreso cuando ellos alcancen su peso optimo para ser comercializado durante el año, esperando que este un precio favorable, para ganar, estos nos va ayudar para salir adelante con el núcleo familiar y mejora la calidad de vida, ella es una joven que necesita tener su propia económia, para en el futuro poder ofrecerle algo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Heydi A. is single and lives in the region of Villa Álvarez in her parents' house. She has a high school education and makes a living working in the field with her parents. Heydi is a woman very determined to make headway, and currently has an inventory of cattle that was handed down from her father. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase three calves to fatten so she can earn more income when they reach their optimum weight and she sells them during the year. She's hoping to get a favorable price to earn more, and this will help her family make headway and improve their quality of life. Heydi is a young woman who needs to have her own finances so in the future she can provide for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepción

texts.es:
El Señor Leonardo de la Concepción M. es cliente activo de este mercado desde hace 20 años tiene un negocio de venta de productos ferreteros y conforme a las temporadas le mete a su negocio diferentes productos para aprovechar las ventas.
El señor M., es casado solo tiene un hijo a su cargo y su esposa, trabaja fuertemente desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde diario para llevar el sustenta a su casa.
Este financiamiento ella lo Saco para surtir su tramo de mochilas de diferentes estilos ya que empezaba la temporada de clase.
texts.en:
Leonardo de la Concepción Murguía has been an active client in this market for 20 years. He has a business selling hardware products. He carries different seasonal products in his business to take advantage of the sales. Mr. M. is married and is raising one child. He and his wife work very hard everyday from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon to support the household. This loan is to stock his backpack shop with different styles now that the school season has started.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hardware products and backpacks for classes

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
To earn a living in Sapele, Adeline sells sarongs at retail prices. Her customers are usually women and young girls. She hopes to expand her business and attract more customers. She is seeking a loan in the amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.

Adeline is married with four children. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a hardworking woman, who is determined to lift her business and family above poverty.

She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Khikmet

texts.en: Khikmet J. operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation 20 years ago. He is a 45 year-old father of three children whom are currently in school. He sells products like rice, canned foods, drinks, cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies and beverages. With the loan, he wants to buy more of these and other products to increase his stock of goods. With increased stock and increased varieties, Khikmet hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of his children. He would appreciate your assistance very much. He wants to provide his children with university education. Khikmet is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuff

loans.name: Roeurng

texts.en:
The photo is of Mr. S., age 39, at his house. He is married to Vat, 33, who is a good homemaker. He also cultivates a rice crop to earn a living. This couple has given birth to four children who are now of school age.

In order to make a daily income, S. delivers rattan cupboards and firewood to sell directly to his customers’ houses. In addition, he has a knowledge that he uses to examine the villagers’ animals for extra profit.

S. has an old cultivating machine that he uses in his farming business; unfortunately his machine often breaks down during use. S. will be using his loan to repair his broken machine and with the rest he will mend his old motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair his broken cultivating machine and to mend his old motorcycle

loans.name: Chandrawathi

texts.en:
Chandrawathi is a 57-year-old married woman living in Akurassa in southern Sri Lanka with her husband. They do not have any children.

Chandrawathi has several lots of land that contain paddy farms (flooded parcels of arable land used for growing rice and other semi-aquatic crops), which she first began cultivating ten years ago. In her business she works hard and enjoys it. She is honest and very enthusiastic about her business.
 
Chandrawathi has asked for a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to expand her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To develop her paddy farm

loans.name: Matiasa

texts.es:
Matiasa pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Matiasa tiene 39 años y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales depende todavía de la socia, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, pollos y chanchos y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta de ropa, ella vende sus productos en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. 

Matiasa es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar chanchos y gallinas. 
 
Matiasa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Matiasa belongs to the borrowing group “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” with partner organization Asociación Arariwa. Matiasa is 39 and has five children that depend on her. She lives in the community of Inquilpata in the district of Anta in the department of Cusco. Her principle economic activity is the sale of small animals, for example guinea pigs, hens and chickens, and pigs. Her complimentary economic activity is clothing sales. She sells her products at the Fair Grounds at the Country Community of Inquilpata-Anta on Fridays. Matiasa is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman that finds every opportunity to get ahead and with her daily strength helps her family at every opportunity, she needs this loan to buy pigs and hens. Matiasa is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to completing the payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Matiasa needs the loan to buy pigs and hens

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita E. is from the village of Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While it is not her only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Juanita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services, to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as payment for tuition fees for her son's education. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for a house renovation. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Juanita from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for house renovation

loans.name: Helen's Group

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Dioyo. She is 43 years old. Helen is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Helen is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling "Nipa," a native roof in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2003, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,850 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional rice for consumption. 

Helen is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living standards. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for "nipa" (native roof) making.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 32 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 5 years. His eldest child is attending school.

Joel is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for five years with only one employee. His products are tea and milk which he sells locally. His biggest challenges have been lack of a market for his milk and lack of enough feeds for his dairy cows.

Joel has requested this Kes 50,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will assist him in educating and providing food for his children. In future, he would like to acquire a dairy cow that produces at least fifteen liters of milk daily.

Joel is requesting Juhudi to assist him in acquiring quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Dieudonne

texts.fr:
COuturier de 44 ans,marie et pere de 3 enfants,age de 10 a 26 ans, ayant arrete ses etudes tres jeune par manque de soutien, il rentre dans un atelier de couture pour un apprentissage durant deux ans ,a la fin de sa formation il  ouvre son propre atelier avec une machine a coudre et une somme de 20000 frs .
Il a une grande clientele,ses recettes sont en moyenne de 12000 a 20000 frs par jour.
Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir , il pense a renforcer en achetant des pagnes de differents motifs pour faire des ensembles dames, hommes, des chemises, des rouleaux de doublure, de la vegeline; des lots des fils de differents couleurs , des fermetures et des lots de boutons.

Pour accroitre son affaire , il veut faire des tenues pret a porter pour hommes, femmes et enfants,les vendre a des bon prix abordables, il veut faire connaitre ses produits a travers le pays , se faire un nom, pour que partout l'on parle des ses tenues a travers tout le pays.
Pour l'avenir il a le desir d'ouvrir un grand atelier de Coupe-couture -exposition et vente.
texts.en:
This 44-year old tailor is married and the father of three children ages 10 to 26. He quit school when he was very young for lack of support, and started working in a sewing workshop for a 2-year apprenticeship. At the end of his training, he opened his own workshop with a sewing machine and 20,000 francs. He has a lot of customers and his revenues typically reach an average of 12,000 to 20,000 francs per day. With the loan he hopes to receive, he plans to strengthen his activities by purchasing African print cloth in different patterns to make outfits for men and women, shirts, bolts of lining material, some vegeline, lots of thread in different colors, fasteners and buttons. In order to expand his business, he wants to make ready-to-wear clothes for men, women and children and sell them at good, affordable prices. He wants his creations to be known all over the country, make a name for himself, and have people talking about his clothes everywhere in the country. In the future, he would like to open a large workshop dedicated to cutting and sewing, displays and sales.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase African print cloth, fabric and lining by the meter; vegeline, thread, fasteners, and buttons

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita M. is from the town of Centro Norte, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 35 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Juanita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,100 PHP a month. Juanita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jessillo

texts.en:
Jessillo S. is from the town of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Jessillo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jessillo owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jessillo has been engaged in his business for more than three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jessillo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessillo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jessillo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jessillo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ping's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who live in Preak Be village, Kandal province. Mrs. Ping H. is a group leader who was born in 1957. She was selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses. 

She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family, while her husband, Mr. Keng Yen, is a laborer. Her problem is that her home is too old to live in. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Ping H. is applying for a loan to fix her own home. She is the mother of a child who is a support taxi driver.

loans.use: To fix her own home

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia C. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Serena, Brgy. Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a tailoring business. Her husband Franco, who is 58 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 5 children who are between 27 to 33 years old. 

Virginia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Virginia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,000 PHP, increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing 19,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for a new sewing machine and inventory for the general store. She wants to continue to save up for future home repairs and other uses. 

Virginia C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchasing inventory for general store and sewing machine for tailoring business

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. prepares 'banku' at Elmina. Araba has received senior high education. She is divorced and has two children. Araba has been selling 'banku' (a local dish made of fermented corn dough) for ten years now. She responsibly uses her income to educate and feed the household. Her loan will be used to purchase more bags of maize for 'banku'. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to invest in the cooking of other foods to bring variety into her cooking.

loans.use: purchase more bags of maize for 'banku'

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
DAVID ANTONIO C. P., Trabaja como Vigilante en el Mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua.
el prestamo solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construccion , es casado y padre de familia de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, a tenido tred creditos con la institucion y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
David Antonio C. P. works in Managua as security guard in the Roberto Huembes market. 
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials. He is married and father of two school aged children. He has been granted three loans by this institution, and they have all been used to make improvements in his house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to remodel his house.

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en: Cherry Mae T. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Cherry Mae is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Cherry Mae operates a motorcycle/tricycle transport service. Cherry Mae has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Cherry Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Mae is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the first loan taken out by Cherry Mae from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are currently in school. Joan has a business of a food stall, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joan hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Joan hopes to own a motorcycle.        

Joan is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: Food

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim S. is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She has a partner in her husband, a disabled person who stays at home to do the housework. This couple is married and blessed with two children. One child helps to contribute to the family livelihood by working in a garment factory. 

To make a living, Yim S. always relies on using her old bicycle to transport the used goods that she buys, going door-to-door around the commune and which she then resells to earn income. Yim S. will use her loan to purchase more items for her used-goods business.

loans.use: To purchase items for her used-goods business

loans.name: Dedé Akofa

texts.fr: Akofa a 45 ans et est mariée. Elle a en sa charge 3 enfants.  Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants, elle fait la vente de produits d’alimentations générale. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend au marché local d’Akodessewa. Elle compte dans cette activité 15 ans d’expérience. Le crédit sollicité permettra de satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Akofa is 45 years old and married. She cares for three children. To improve the living standard of her children, she sells grocery products. She gets her supplies at the great market in Lomé and retails at the local market in Akodessewa. She has more than 15 years' experience in this business. She applies for this loan to satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey, 60, is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya.  He has been farming for the last five years and employs one worker. He grows potatoes, maize, beans and wheat which he sells at the local market.  He is a retired teacher, and apart from farming he depends on his pension to meet his family's needs.

He recently completed a loan from Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 45,000 KES.  Now he wants to borrow 80,000 KES for his fish farm.  He says that this loan will help him expand his business and increase his income enabling him to improve his family's standard of living. 

His primary challenges have been poor weather conditions, pests and diseases which affects his production.

Geoffrey is married with five children, who are adults.  He says Juhudi is working with farmers at a grassroots level, and he is happy about that.

loans.use: For fish farming.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in the province of Kompong Tom. Since 2005, Sen S. has owned and operated her farmland to cultivate a rice crop, from which she earns a daily income. Sen S., 38, is a married woman and mother of five children, all of whom are single, and live under her managing. Her husband works as a local carpenter in Our Sousbay village. Usually Sen S. generates around $2.50 a day in profits to meet the needs of her family. This rice-harvesting season Sen S. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice to store and then sell when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.name: Luz Dolly

texts.es:
Luz Dolly D. J. es una mujer emprendedora que siempre ha trabajado para aportar con los pagos propios del hogar, por ello, desde hace 7 años decidió crear su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes en la que vende diferentes productos. 

Con el fin de comprar más productos y adquirir estantería para mejorar la presentación de sus productos, Luz Dolly necesita de un crédito para lograr este objetivo que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y caminar hacia su gran sueño: llegar a tener un Supermercado reconocido en el municipio.
texts.en: Luz Dolly D. J. is an enterprising woman who has always worked to cover her own household expenses. For this reason, seven years ago she decided to set up her own business: a grocery store in which she sells different products.  Luz Dolly would like to buy more products and acquire some shelving to improve the presentation of her products.  She needs a loan in order to achieve this goal that will allow her to increase her sales and take a step further towards her biggest dream: to own a well-known supermarket in her town.

loans.use: To acquire merchandise and buy shelving

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu T. N. is 37 years old and has 2 children who both attend school. Being a farmer, she grows rice, onions and potatoes in a paddy of 4,500 square meters. Her agricultural products are used to meet her family's needs and are also sold in the market for daily income. Lieu T. N. has been a SEDA client since 2004 and is always a good group leader. This year, she wants to expand her farming with more varieties of vegetables; therefore, she wants to have a loan of 6,3220,000 VND to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to produce a high yield crop.
010140070005-4784

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are 3 and 1 years old. Her husband makes a living as a farmer while she has owned a general store for the last two years. Epiphanie is applying for this loan to buy new items to sell to her customers, and plans to use her profits to continue expanding her store.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cleny

texts.es: Cleny, de 36 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Enrique de 42 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que Cleny realiza, es el cultivo de café, cacao, achiote y plátano, es así que todas las mañanas junto a su esposo, sale a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del buen cuidado que les brinde dependerá la calidad de los productos que llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y darles el cuidado necesario, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos de productos que lleva son muy pesados. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en la limpieza de sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Cleny, age 36, is a kind and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Enrique, age 42, and their five beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Cleny’s work involves growing coffee, cacao, annatto, and bananas. Every morning, she and her husband leave to go to their fields. Cleny knows that the quality of her products depends on the good level of care that she provides. Once harvested, her crops are sold at the market in the city of Pichanaki. What she enjoys most about her work is sowing her fields and providing her crops the care they need. She has been farming for twelve years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products since the sacks of produce can be extremely heavy. Within time, she hopes to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Cleny is saving so that she can submit her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. She is pleased to be a member. The loan of 2500 PEN that she is requesting will be used to invest in the clearing of her cacao fields.

loans.use: To pay workers to clear her cacao fields.

loans.name: Nao's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen members. Mrs. Nao, who was born in 1966, is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members.

Mrs. Nao is a widow with four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factories while the others are students and also support their mother by farming. 

Mrs. Nao is a farmer.  She owns a plot of land, which she uses to grow bananas and potatoes for a living.  She doesn’t have enough money to grow her crops, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for cultivating bananas.  The rest of the loan she will use for growing potatoes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for cultivating bananas and potatoes.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es: Nazario, de 32 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá Yolanda a la que cuida con mucha dedicación pues ya es anciana. Ambos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca. La actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, desde hace 15 años comenzó a sembrar producto oriundos como: papa y arveja, en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, pero según cuenta; en campaña agrícola alquila terrenos en el caserío de “Huacas”, donde siembra en mayores cantidades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder comercializar siempre sus sembríos, pues a pesar de lo inestable que es el mercado, él siempre encuentra ganancias, ya que hace secar la papa por un periodo determinado para luego venderlo como semilla cuando está tiene menor precio de compra en el mercado. Asimismo trabaja como peón en diferentes cultivos, donde le pagan S/. 25 soles por día, de esa manera gana un dinero extra. Su principal preocupación es la falta de más terrenos agrícolas, ya que alquilando gasta más dinero, por ello está ahorrando lo necesario para poder comprar una. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde trabaja con ahínco para el desarrollo de su asociación, pues es parte de la junta directiva. Nazario, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, asimismo en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico; que esparcirá en sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Nazario, age 32, is a hard-working single man.  He lives with his mother, Yolanda.  He takes care of her with great devotion because she is elderly.  They both live in their own house in the rural area of Villa Visca.

He is a farmer.  He started growing native crops like potatoes and peas fifteen years ago on his own land.  He says that during the farming season he rents fields in the rural community of Huacas, where he plants in greater quantities.  What he likes most about his work is always being able to sell his crops.  In spite of the instability of the market, he always gets income.  

He dries the potatoes for a specific amount of time, and then he sells them as seeds when he can get a better price for them  at the market.  He also works as a field worker on different fields where they pay him 25 soles per day.  This way he earns some extra money.

His biggest concern is the lack of more farming land.  Renting costs him more money.  That is why he is saving what he needs to be able to buy land.

He belongs to the Villa Visca Communal Bank.  This is his tenth loan with MFP.  He works earnestly for the development of his association.  He is part of the governing board.

Nazario will use the requested loan to buy two bags of pea seeds.  He will also buy various sacks or organic fertilizer, which he will spread over his potato crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer for his potato crops.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre soltero de 29 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, es propia y cuenta con todos los servicio ( agua, luz y desagüe) en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican principalmente al comercio y turismo.
Luis  es propietario de juegos infantiles (camas elásticas para que los niños salten), esta labor lo realiza desde hace algunos años en el parque principal de ese distrito, para quel os niños puedan acceder al juego tienen que pagar 1.00 un nuevo sol, éste negocio en la actualidad se ha ido incrementando especialmente los fines de semana y en días festivos.  Al tener mayores ingresos de su negocio el puede   solventar sus gastos y necesidades.
El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles y su destino será para comprar otros juegos para niños innovadores para que tenga más acogida su negocio y seguirá prosperando, tratando de mejorar la calidad de vida de él y la de sus padres.
Luis es un hombre muy responsable y conocido en el medio por ser trabajador  y buen hijo al estar pendiente de lo que necesitan sus padres.
texts.en:
Luis is a single man, 29 years old, and he lives in his parents' house. It is his own house and it is equipped with all the services (water, electricity and sewage). It is located in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, in the province of Chiclayo. The population of this district are primarily involved in commerce and tourism. 

Luis is the owner of a children's game park (trampolines for kids to jump). He has had this business for a few years at the principal park of the district. The kids who want to access the part need to pay 1 neuvo sol. Business has been increasing especially during the weekends and on holidays. With an increase in income he is able to cover his expenses and provide for his needs.

The loan which he requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) is in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles and it will be used to purchase other and innovative children's games to bring more attention to the business. he will continue to prosper and he will continue to improve his quality of life and that of his parents. 

Luis is a very responsible person and known in his line of business to be a hard worker and a good son for providing his parent with what they need.

loans.use: to purchase new game park attractions.

loans.name: Bikorwa Group

texts.fr:
Odette est une commerçante âgée de 36ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle  fait le commerce de restaurant depuis 2 ans alors qu’elle faisait le commerce de détail avant de commencer cette activité. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants âgés respectivement de 15ans, 13ans, 7ans et 3ans. Trois sont à l’école. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e primaire. 
 
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital et agrandir son activité pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle espère que son business va croitre considérablement pour vivre plus aisément et acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Bikorwa».
texts.en:
Odette is a 36-year-old merchant residing in the township of Rugombo in western Burundi. She has been in the restaurant trade for two years, and was in retail before starting this activity. She is married and a mother of four: her kids are respectively 15, 13, 7 and 3 years old. Three of them attend school. Her own education went up to the fifth grade of primary school.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her capital and extend her activity to make large profits. She hopes for her business to grow considerably, so that she can live more easily and purchase a lot on which to build her own house.

She is a member of the "Bikorwa" community group.

loans.use: to increase his capital and make a large profit.

loans.name: Ibeth

texts.es: En el Municipio de San Jacinto es muy conocido  el negocio “Tienda Andrea”  actividad que es la fuente de ingresos de Ibeth y de sus hijos que se encuentran  en las edades de 2 a 19 años y que surgió después de haberse dedicado por mucho tiempo a la fabricación de artesanías, actividad intrínseca en la cultura de esta población. Tienda Andrea fue ideada por Ibeth aprovechando que le ofrecieron un local en calidad de arrendamiento en un sitio donde estaba ubicado una tienda y con el apoyo de su familia y el trabajo de Ibeth fue impulsado este punto comercial, que en la actualidad vende víveres, ranchos, bebidas, enlatados, embutidos y en general artículos de la canasta familia; sus principales clientes son las amas de casa que están ubicadas a su alrededor, para quienes Ibeth adapta unidades de medidas, el peso y la cantidad a sus posibilidades de compra. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio, hasta lograr ofrecerles a sus hijos las mejores condiciones de bienestar que sus fuerzas le permitan, para que estudien y sean exitosos en un futuro. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará artículos de primera necesidad que rotan rápidamente y necesita surtir con ellos como el aceite, jabón, arroz, azúcar, refrescos y bebidas. Su sueño es generarles a sus hijos posibilidades de estudios superiores y tener su propia casa;  mientras esto ocurre Ibeth continua esforzándose en su diaria actividad y generando una rentabilidad no menor de un 13 % que planea aumentar junto a su capital de trabajo, con los financiamientos que desde ya ha iniciado, a través de su credikiva.
texts.en: The “Tienda Andrea" is well known in San Jacinto.  It is the main source of income for Ibeth and her children, who are between 2 and 19 years old.  She started the business after spending many years making handicrafts, which is an intrinsic part of the area's culture.  She started Tienda Andrea because she was offered a lease on a shop.  With her effort and her family's support, Ibeth opened this shop, where she sells provisions, food, drinks, canned goods, dried meat, and articles of daily use.  Her main clients are housewives living nearby, to whom Ibeth sells in small quantities so that they can afford it.  She wants to increase her business so she can offer her children a better quality of life and give them the opportunity to study and be successful in the future. This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy staples that sell quickly and are in great demand, such as oil, soap, rice, sugar, and drinks.  She wants her children to go on to higher education and have their own houses; while this is happening, Ibeth will continue working hard so as to keep generating a profit of no less than 13%, which she wants to increase together with her working capital and the funds she is receiving from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy oil, soap, rice, sugar, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en: Lorie is 42 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver and she helps him support their family by selling different kinds of beauty products, including cosmetics and perfumes. She has been in this business for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional items to sell to her customers. In the future, Lorie dreams of starting a second business so that she can generate more income to support the needs of her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.en: Rosa is lives in the town of Danli in southern Honduras where she earns a living by making women’s clothing as well as offering seamstress services. Rosa has been engaged in this line of work for the last 38 years and has a reliable customer base made up of teachers and students in the area. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 to purchase materials needed for making and repairing clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, pins, and sewing needles.

loans.name: Rolem

texts.en:
Rolem is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Rolem has a retail shop that sells snacks, biscuits and breads. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and  beverages.

Rolem is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Baliyeijukira  Kiseke Group

texts.en: Sarah is 41 years old, married, and has 5 children, aged between 17-22 years, living in her own permanent house in Hioma, Uganda. For 10 years, Sarah has been operating a bar and shop. From this business, she has been able to educate her children. She faces a challenge of defaulters, but hopes to expand her business to a wholesale status. Sarah wants a loan to buy more mobile phone airtime, beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soap, soda and mobile phone airtime to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a una de las miembros, la cual escuchó del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y luego de eso juntó a sus amigas y vecinas del barrio y de allí surge el grupo denominado Mujeres Trabajadoras, el cual está integrado por 16 miembros. Todas trabajan de forma solidaria y honesta. Ellas se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables en cuanto al cumplimiento de sus obligaciones.
La presidenta es la señora Olga, es una señora muy alegre, responsable, trabajadora, ella vive con sus hijos en su humilde casita. Ella es modista, comenta que tiene mucho trabajo y que día a día lucha con miras hacia un solo objetivo, el cual es brindarle a sus hijos un futuro mejor y una vida digna y decorosa. Su principal sueño es que sus hijos se conviertan en grandes profesionales y que por medio de sus estudios sean alguien en la vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, kits de hilos, agujas y demás que son elementos indispensables para su profesión
texts.en:
This committee came together thanks to one of the members who heard about the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” [Enterprising Women] Program and she gathered a group of friends and neighbors to form a group that they called “Mujeres Trabajadoras” [Working Women] and which has 16 members.  They all work together in an honest, mutually supportive way.  They define themselves as hardworking women who are responsible with respect to their obligations.

Olga is the President.  She’s a cheerful, responsible, hardworking woman living with her children in a humble little house.  She’s a seamstress and she comments that she has quite a bit of work and that she strives day to day with just one goal in mind: to provide her children with a better future and a proper, decent life.  Her main dream is that her children become great professionals and that through their schooling they become someone in life.

She asks for the loan to buy fabric, thread kits, needles and the other indispensable items needed for her profession.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, pins and others.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 43 years old, she lives in San Carlos, Tukuran, ZDS. She is a married woman with 2 children, her children are all studying. Aside from her income a month, she is engaged in a business in cosmetic sales. She's been doing this business for 22 years and earns 14,000 a month. She has requested a loan for 49,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. 

She's been a member in Paglaum MPC since 2008, and used loans 10 times. She has had a good performance in the center.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, es madre soltera de dos niños de 9 y 17 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y una tienda, este negocio inicio por su madre, lo atiende de lunes a domingo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de tomates, repollo, arroz, aceite, pan, gaseosa, frijoles y jabón, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, manteniéndolo surtido de todo lo necesario para os clientes.
Las aspiraciones de María es continuar en su negocio, crecer como microempresaria y velar por las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María lives with her family. She is a single mother of two children, ages 9 and 17. Maria sells fruit and manages a store, a business that was started by her mother. She works from Monday through Sunday.

María is currently requesting a loan to buy tomatoes, cabbage, rice, oil, bread, sodas, beans, and soap. This purchase will help to improve her business and maintain her inventory so that she can provide for all of her customers’ needs.

María’s aspirations are to continue her business, to grow as a small entrepreneur, and to secure the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, rice, oil, bread, sodas, beans, and soap.

loans.name: Dionita

texts.en:
Dionita is a married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is engaged in rice farming and hog-raising businesses. Dionita's husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. She helps plant rice crops and keep the farm free of weeds and pests. She also raises pigs in their backyard.

Dionita requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and seeds. She hopes to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
La formación el presente comité inicio gracias a una D. las miembros, ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona. Ellas tienen actividades diferentes algunas emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo. El comité se Denomina Mujeres Luchadoras están en el Tercer Ciclo   con 15 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables entre ellas, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor para realizar actividades para el Grupo.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Mercedes, quien se dedica a la venta D. ropa hace ya un tiempo, nos dice que por medio D. su trabajo y sacrificio ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Una D. sus metas es seguir creciendo por medio D. su negocio, lo cual podrá hacer invirtiendo en el.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas D. todo tipo, como ser remeras, pantalones y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The formation of this existing committee came about thanks to one of its members. She contacted her neighbors and friends in order to start this local committee. They have different business activities. Some have started a new venture while others have an established source of income. This committee is named “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Women Fighters) and is starting its third loan cycle with 15 members. The group is known in its neighborhood for being unified, supportive, and responsible. The members possess a great entrepreneurial spirit as they engage in their group activities.

One of the members is Sra. Mercedes, who has been selling clothes for some time. She says that through her work and sacrifice, she has been able to move forward and help her family. One of her goals is to continue growing through her business, so she wants to be able to invest in it. She is requesting a loan to buy clothing of all types such as t-shirts, trousers, and other items so that she can restock her inventory and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing of all types to sell.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew, a farmer, is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya. He is aged 36 and has been in farming for 7 years. His produce of milk and maize go to the local market where he runs a milk retail business. Andrew has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow and give a boost to his dairy output. He also wants to buy a cereal-grinding machine and transportation to make it easier to get his goods to the market. A poor road network makes delivery of supplies to the market costly. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their support of farmers

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Marites has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Marites is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, vive con su familia y una hija, ella administra una tienda donD. ofrece productos no perecederos que son necesarios para los hogares en el día a día.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. arroz, aceite, frijoles, maíz, productos enlatados, y más para surtir el negocio, mejorando así el servicio hacia los clientes y con oportunidad D. generar mayores ventas.
La aspiración D. Gregoria es que su negocio crezca, además D. que su hija tenga todo lo necesario para poderse desarrollar académicamente.
texts.en:
Gregoria sells staple foods.  She lives with her family and a daughter and she manages a store that offers non-perishable products that are everyday necessities for the home.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, beans, corn, canned goods, and more to supply her business and improve the service to her customers so that she can generate more sales.

Gregoria’s dream is that the business grows and also that her daughter has all she needs to be able to develop academically.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, beans, corn, and canned goods

loans.name: Jeyssi

texts.es: Jeyssi, de 21 años, es una mujer alegre y extrovertida, además de ser trabajadora y empeñosa. Vive con Juan, fruto de esa unión tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, al cual  quieren mucho y el es su motivación. Juntos habitan en su casa propia que logró comprar con el apoyo de su pareja. La actividad que realiza Jeyssi es la venta de comidas, tales como Juanes tacachos, empanadas y refrescos, para lo cual cuenta con un puesto de venta en el mercado informal de su ciudad, negocio que le traspaso su abuela. Su actividad empieza levantándose muy de temprano y se dirige a su puesto de venta, llevando toda su comida ya preparada la noche anterior, quedándose a vender hasta el mediodía. Tiene 2 años, y cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá en la preparación de la comida, pero en la venta lo hace sola. Comenta que le gusta cocinar, además  de los ingresos económicos  con los cuales se pudo comprar algunos artefactos electrodoméstico, para su hogar. Su plan es ampliar su negocio y poner un negocio de venta de cervezas y gaseosas, en la cual atenderá su hermana. Este será el primer crédito con la institución MFP, está contenta de tener acceso a una línea de crédito, para avanzar con su negocio, por eso dice será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de una refrigeradora, cerveza y gaseosas para inciar con la venta en su casa.
texts.en:
21-year-old Jeyssi, is a cheerful and outgoing woman who is hardworking and earnest. She lives with her partner Juan and they have a 1-year-old son who she loves very much and he is her motivation. They all live together in their own home which she managed to buy with the support of her partner. 

Jeyssi sells food, such as juanes and tacachos (regional dishes), pies and refreshments. She inherited the business from her grandmother and has a stall in the informal sector of their city. Every morning, Jeyssi wakes up very early and goes to her stall, carrying all the food that she already prepared the night before. She stays at the stall until about noon to sell her products. Her mother helps her to prepare the food, but she sells the products alone.  

Jeyssi says that she enjoys cooking, and with the income she makes she has been able to buy some electronic appliances for her home. Her plan is to expand her business and start a second business selling beer and soft drinks, which her sister will look after. This is Jeyssi's first loan with the MFP institution. She is pleased to have access to a credit line to advance her business, and she says will be punctual in paying her dues. With the amount requested, Jeyssi will invest in buying a refrigerator, beer and soft drinks to commence sales from her home.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. Муборак является матерью троих детей. На сегодняшний день она открыла дилерский центр, где она продает сим карты, занимается пополнением баланса мобильных телефонов. Кредит просит для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Muborak lives in the Hamadoni area. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of three children. To date, she has opened a shop where she sells SIM cards and engages in topping up services for cell phones. The loan request is to expand her activities.

loans.use: to repair the premises and purchase new SIM cards

loans.name: Théophile

texts.fr:
Théophile est  un homme âgé de 52 ans. Il est marié  å un/e informaticienne/Revendeuse et a 03 enfants.
Théophile travaille comme revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 1996. Il vend dans une boutique et achète les produits à Lomé.
Théophile a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d'acheter plus de marchandises.
texts.en:
Théophile is a 52 year old man. He is married to a computer specialist/retailer and has 3 children.

Théophile has been working as a retailer of general food products since 1996. He buys the products in Lomé and sells them in a shop.

Théophile is asking for a second loan through WAGES in order to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy general food productis

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saúl es un joven de 22 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Saúl está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de frijol, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Saúl aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. 
Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.
Saúl es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Saúl is 22 years old and lives with his family in a community in the south of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on agricultural activities, including planting root crops, coffee, corn, beans, and raising livestock.  

Saúl is requesting a loan of ₡500.000 (five hundred thousand colones) to maintain his crops with fertilizer and fungicides in order to protect his bean seeds, since it is a reliable and sustainable alternative.  With the fertilizer, Saúl increases the soil's capacity to absorb different nutrients, and the fungicides are used to avoid the appearance of fungus in his crops, so that his customers don't run the risk of getting sick when they eat his food.  

This is how he provides quality products to his customers, and he meets his proposed sales goal every month.  He is also able to meet all of his obligations and bills in order to improve life for his large family.

Saúl is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, one of the 150 community loan organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres al Poder” están en el Quinto Ciclo con 17  integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, que diariamente se esfuerzan para poder cambiar la vida de sus familias. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de salir adelante y de crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Una mujer muy trabajadora es Sara, quien se dedica a lavar ropas, comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que día a día lava muchísimas ropas y eso es muy agotador, pero nos dice que no se cansa, ya que por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y sacarlos adelante. Ella dice que su trabajo es muy dignificador y por sobre todo honesto.
Ella pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para poder comprar suavizantes para ropas, jabones en polvo, desinfectantes y demás artículos que utiliza para el lavado de las ropas.
texts.en:
The committee is called "Mujeres al Poder" [Women To Power] and is in its fifth loan cycle with 17 members. It is a group of very responsible and hardworking women who make the effort every day in order to change their families' lives. They joined together with the goal of getting ahead and of growing, not only financially but as people. 

One very hardworking woman is Sara who devotes herself to washing clothes. She comments that her work is very demanding since she washes a large amount of clothing every day and it is quite exhausting. Nevertheless she tells us she does not get tired because by her work she has been able to help her family and get them ahead. She says that her work is quite dignifying and above all, honest. 

She asks for help from the foundation and from Kiva so that she may buy fabric softeners, powdered soaps, disinfectant and other items she uses in the washing of the clothes.

loans.use: to purchase fabric softeners, powdered soaps, disinfectant and other items.

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
Las poderosas se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que una de las miembros del grupo contactó con la asesora de la fundación  para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el tercer ciclo del programa de la fundación.
Mercedes es una de las integrantes de este sacrificado grupo. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de helados, negocio en el que le va muy bien, en especial en este tiempo de mucho calor.
