She has been running a mini wholesale shop in Shaurimoyo for a period of 12 years and earns a profit of KES 10,500 per month. Shaurimoyo is a densely populated estate just few kilometers from Nairobi city centre, and she has many customers.

Jane was introduced  to KADET Ltd. by an existing client of KADET, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 70,000 from KADET. She intends to use the loan to add more stock such as maize flour for KES 20,000, cooking fat worth KES 10,000, wheat flour worth KES 20,000, and rice worth KES 20,000. 

She will save the anticipated profit  to pay school fees for her children.

In the future Jane plans to grow her business and eventually open a complete wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock to the mini wholesale shop

loans.name: Ba

texts.en: Ba T. N. is 47 years old and has 2 children, one of whom is attending a  training course on driving. Ba T. N. is a farmer. Her main activities focus on growing rice, corn and vegetables and raising pigs for meat. She has operated this business for ages and it provides food to support herself and her family. She also sells her products in order to have cash to pay for daily expenses. Ba T. N. has been a client of our credit program since 2006 and has been a good group leader. She now wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Kihinet Group, Kihihi

texts.en: K. Eunice is the leader of Kihinet group in Kihihi. She is 43 years old and married with 4 children, all in school. Eunice has a poultry business in Karere trading centre where she keeps layer chicken that produce eggs for sale. She has been in this business for 10 years and she is able to make 100,000/= as weekly profits. Eunice is also involved in the sale of produce like coffee, bananas and millet which also contribute to her monthly income. She started her poultry business with capital from selling produce. Her dream is to see her business as well as her family expand in future. In the meantime, she has bought land for agriculture and now needs a loan to be able to buy more chicks for farm expansion.

loans.use: Purchase more chicks for her business

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is 28, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 7. Both of her children are enrolled in school. 

Aline's husband is a seller of building materials, and Alien sells beans, sugar, rice, tomatoes, and other vegetables at her shop. Aline has been in this business for two years. 

With this loan, Aline will buy additional inventory for her shop, and with the profits, she hopes to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy additional beans, sugar, rice, tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda, de 39 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Andrés de 41 años y sus 3 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor educación. Trabajando arduamente, Lucinda ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora y media para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa, arveja, habas y olluco, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Paralelamente a esta actividad, ella tiene un restaurante, negocio que le ayuda mucho en sus ingresos, puesto que su establecimientos es muy concurrido por sus vecinos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 31 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, las cual les pueda ayudar a mejorar su economía. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas semillas para sembrar, además comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 39 years old.  She is a very loving and hard-working mother who lives in her own home together with her husband, 41 year-old Andrés, and her three children who she would like to provide with a better education.

Through hard work, Lucinda has ensured that her farm provides her with the products she needs to support her family.  Before the first rays of sun are visible, she leaves her home and walks for nearly an hour and a half to reach her farmland where she grows potatoes, peas, beans and olluco (a native tuber), crops which she then takes to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma to sell.

In addition to this, Lucinda owns a restaurant.  This business helps her a lot in terms of income since her establishment is very popular with her neighbors.  What Lucinda most likes about her work is cultivating her land because she feels that she is putting it to good use.  She has been in this business for 31 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce to Tarma since the sacks she carries are very heavy and make her very tired.

Over time, Lucinda would like to set up a grocery store which will help her to improve her financial situation.  This is her tenth loan from MFP.  She is very happy to be able to access this loan and she would like to thank all those people who will make it possible for her to receive the money that she needs.  Lucinda is a very well-respected member of her community bank because of the order that she brings to the meetings.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy new seeds to sow.  She will also buy sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy potato and pea seeds, and sacks of manure

loans.name: Trey's Group

texts.en:
Four people form this group loan. Mrs. Trey is the group leader selected by the other members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Trey, who was born in 1975, is a widow with three children who all are students and also help with their mother's business.

Mrs. Trey is a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to support this business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food. Aside from pig breeding, she also works as a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Doña Vicenta R. S., tiene 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos, 3 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración de canastas de plastico, lleva 6 años de experiencia en este oficio, cuenta con el epoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la artesanía también a la satreria y la confección de tejidos.

Deciden solicitar un prèstamos para compra de terreno, el préstamo será para ajustar el precio que tendrá el predio que van a adquir, lo cual no dudan que es una inversión rentable. Ya que de esta forma de incrementar su patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Doña Vicenta R. S., age 46, did not have the opportunity to get an education.  She has five children, three of which are in school.  She makes plastic baskets for a living and has been in this business for six years.  Her husband, who produces fabric and is a tailor, also helps her with her craft.

They decided to request a loan to purchase land.  The loan will be used to adjust the price for the property they buy, which they believe will be a profitable investment.  They hope to increase their family assets in this manner.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 36 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Ella desde algunos años se dedica al bordado de vestidos, actividad que le demanda prácticamente todo día, puesto que debe ser muy minuciosa en el acabado. La manera de trabajar de Ana consiste en recibir pedidos de diferentes comerciantes, quienes le dan cierta cantidad de prendas para que Ana pueda adornarlos con diferentes y novedosos bordados y hacerlos más llamativos. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le permite poner toda su creatividad en los trabajos, realizándolo a su propio gusto, sin embargo la parte difícil radica en esforzar su vista para ensartar las mostacillas con las que adorna sus prendas,  puesto que estas  son muy pequeñas. Es su quinto crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará materiales para el adorno de las prendas que le dejan y así lograr mejores resultados.
texts.en:
36 year-old Ana is a very humble and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home and what she wishes for more than anything is to do well in life.  For some years she has been embroidering dresses.  This is an activity that takes practically all day since she must be very meticulous in putting the finishing touches to her work.  The way Ana works is that she receives orders from different salespeople who provide her with a certain quantity of garments for her to decorate with different and original embroidery work.  Her job is to make the garments more striking.

Ana enjoys her work a lot because she is able to put all her creativity into it, doing the work according to her own taste.  However, the difficult part of her work is having to strain her eyes in order to string the beads with which she decorates the garments because they are very small.

This is Ana's fifth loan from MFP and she has always been very punctual in making her repayments.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy materials for decorating the garments that she is given, so that she can obtain better results.

loans.use: to buy materials for embroidering garments

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala, 21, is a very ambitious mom who lives with her two kids and her husband Rami who is a carpenter in Al Zarqa. 

Hala turned a part of her house into a small grocery store three years ago. Most of her neighbors comes to buy from her since she is the closest to them, and she has been providing them with the products they need. She uses kindness in dealing with her customers. 

Hala has applied for a loan to buy more products that people are asking for, so she can get the profit she needs to open a bigger grocery store outside her house.

loans.use: To buy more products that people are asking for

loans.name: Mujeres Al Desarrollo Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Mujeres al Desarrollo se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Canaria, Distrito del mismo nombre, inicia su sexto ciclo con 13 socias, las cuales tienen diversos negocios. Luisa, es socia del Banco Comunal, esta casada y tiene 02 hijas D. 24 y 26 años quienes son estudiantes universitarias en la capital. Si bien su familia se encuentra establecida en Lima, Luisa se dedica a la venta D. comida hace varios años en Canaria, para poder acompañar a su padre que tiene una avanzada edad y se reúsa a viajar. Luisa pese a estar separada D. su familia y extrañarla constantemente, lucha para salir adelante y se siente apoyada por los créditos que obtiene a través D. Finca Perú. Luisa solicita un préstamo para comprar víveres para su negocio D. comidas. Luisa tiene como sueño que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en: The Mujeres al Desarrollo ("Women Development") Community Bank is found located in the Canaria community, in the district of the same name. It's beginning its sixth cycle with 13 member, who have diverse businesses. Luisa is a member of the community bank, is married and has two daughters who are 24 and 26 years old and study at universities in the capital. While her family is based in Lima, Luisa has been dedicated to selling food for various years in Canaria so she can accompany her father who is elderly and refuses to travel. Luisa hates to be separated from her family and misses them constantly. She fights to get ahead and feels supported by the loans that she obtains through Finca Peru. Luisa is requesting a loan to buy groceries for her food business. Luisa's dream is that her daughters become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale products.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a dairy farmer who lives in the west Kenyan town of Kitale, where he has made a living as a farmer for the last 10 years. His farm produces milk, maize, vegetables and beans, all of which he sells in the local market. He mainly depends the income he earns in this market to meet the needs of his family. He is applying for a loan for 83,200 Kes from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure two dairy cows. His goal is to increase his income by having more milk to sell. A higher income will also allow him to buy more animal feed and treat the diseases which affect his farm's output. Gilbert is 37 years old,  married and has seven children, all of whom attend school.

loans.use: To buy and insure two dairy cows.

loans.name: Sarita Noemí

texts.es:
La señora  Sarita Noemi vive en la cuidad de Managua se desempeña 
Es madre de familia de dos menores doña Sarita visito nuestras instalación para solicitar un crédito para  ya que necesitaba el crédito para completar el dinero para la compra de un terreno. 
La señora agradece a ceprodel por el crédito que le dieron por que gracias a el va a poder hacer la compra de su terreno.
texts.en:
Sarita Noemi lives in the city of Managua.  She is the mother of two minor children.  

Sarita visited our office to request a loan.  She needs this loan so that she can pull together enough money to buy a piece of land.

Sarita is grateful to Ceprodel for this loan, because it will enable her to complete the purchase of this land.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 35, is the married mother of four children. She is a boutique owner and a tailor in Mariakani and her business has been in operation for the last eleven years. Her business has been doing well.

She is a KADET client and this marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase an overlock and zigzag machine for her tailoring business.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady and to offer the best life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock and zigzag machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Wladimir Ivan

texts.es: El señor Wladimir es transportista propietario y tiene mas de  20 años con esta actividad, el vive en la ciudad de el alto con toda su familia, su trabajo es muy sacrificado, puesto que trabaja desde las primeras horas de la mañana hasta las 22:00 pm, todos los días, junto con su esposa se dividen los gastos familiares, con mucho esfuerzo han logrado sacar a su familia adelante ahora la mayoría de su hijos son profesionales y ayudan con los gastos familiares, don Wladimir sueña con que todos sus hijos puedan ser independientes y tener una profesión, por eso se esfuerza todos los días para que no les falte nada. Don Wladimir solicita crédito en la institución para el mantenimiento de su  movilidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Wladimir is an owner and transportation services provider with more than 20 years in this business. He lives in the city of El Alto with his whole family. His work requires much sacrifice given that he works from the early morning hours until 10 p.m. every day. He divides up the family expenses with his wife, and with much effort they have been able to get their family ahead. Now the majority of his children are professionals who help with household expenses. 

Don Wladimir dreams that all his children may be independent and have a profession. To that end he makes the effort every day so they may not lack for anything. 

Don Wladimir seeks a loan with the institution for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es: Marlin, tiene la edad 25 de  años, está casada y vive con su madre y tres hijos. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de novillos para el engorde. Ella cuenta con un potrero a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con pasto  para su engorde más rápido. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de novillos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marlin, who is 25 years old, is married and lives with her mother and three children. With this loan she hopes to buy young bulls to fatten up. She has a pasture in her possession and she expects to feed them grass to fatten them up more quickly. She wants her animals to have the ideal weight for their later sale at the local market or in other areas in the region. 

She wants to generate the majority of the profit for her well-being and that of her family, in addition to growing her business of raising young bulls. This is the first loan that she's received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy young bulls.

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en:
Aizada is the leader of this group. She is 36 and married to a car electrician. Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and a son. Her daughter studies at school and her son is preschool age (under seven). Aizada works as a cook in the poultry factory, but at the moment, she is on maternity leave. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase building materials to repair the house. In the future, Aizada wants to give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe de 47 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto con su familia la cual está conformada por sus 2 hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica a la venta de deliciosas pupusas. Ha trabajado duramente para sacar adelante a su familia. Para Morena lo más importante es que sus queridos hijos puedan tener lo necesario en educación y alimentación. Su familia es la que la impulsa a seguir  trabajando duramente para poder darles el pan de cada día. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pupusería en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, queso, chicharon, etc. para contar con suficiente materia prima a la hora de realizar las deliciosas pupusas y poder ofrecerlas a los clientes que frecuentan el negocio de Morena. Tiene plena confianza que su esfuerzo valdrá la pena y podrá lograr su objetivo. Cabe mencionar que Morena está muy agradecida con  INTEGRAL ya que en el pasado le brindo su ayuda para poder invertir en el negocio y gracias a Dios los resultados fueron muy buenos, espera en ésta ocasión superar esa experiencia
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe is 47 years old.  She lives in her own house with her family, which is comprised of two children.  The children are 10 and 5 years old, and they go to school.

She sells delicious “pupusas” (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans).  She has worked hard in order to get her family ahead.  The most important thing to Morena is that her beloved children are able to have the necessary education and nourishment.  Her family is what drives her to keep working hard in order to be able to give them their daily bread.

This has motivated her to request this loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan is to invest in her pupusa business by purchasing the needed ingredients like corn, rice, beans, cheese, and fried pork rinds, etc.  Morena is then able to sell the pupusas to the customers that frequent her business.  She has every confidence that it will be worthwhile, and she will be able to reach her objective.

It needs to be mentioned that Morena is very grateful to INTEGRAL because in the past they gave her help in order to be able to invest in the business.  Thanks to God, the results were very good.  On this occasion she hopes to surpass this experience.

loans.use: to buy  the needed ingredients like corn, rice, beans, cheese, and fried pork rinds, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 51-year-old farmer who lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She hires farmers from her town to help till her land. Rice is her main crop. 

She also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Maria has requested a loan to purchase feed, fertilizer and other farm supplies. Maria hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase feed, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado San Blas, es D. la Ciudad D. Caacupé, está integrado por 14 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que día a día luchan por poder darle a sus familias todo lo mejor. Ellas son todas vecinas y amigas D. esa ciudad, todas son muy conocidas en el barrio por el trabajo en conjunto que realizan.
La señora Irma es la presidenta D. dicho comité, vive con su marido e hijos, se dedica a la venta D. ropas. Formó parte D. su grupo ya que es la primera vez que alguien se acerca a ofrecerle una ayuda para aumentar sus ingresos. Comenta que por medio D. su trabajo logra ayudar a su familia con los gastos D. la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para el abastecimiento D. su negocio por medio D. la compra D. ropas, con lo cual podrá cumplir con sus clientes y tener más variedad.
texts.en:
This committee is named “San Blas” and is from the city of Caacupé. It consists of 14 hardworking and determined women who strive day after day to proviD. all the best for their families. They are all neighbors and friends who live in the city. All of them are well-known in their neighborhood for the work they perform together as a group.

Sra. Irma is the president of this committee. She lives with her husband and children. Irma sells clothes. She joined this group because someone, for the first time, offered her assistance with increasing her income. Irma says that through her work, she has been able to help her family with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan for restocking her business, so she will buy clothes in order to complete the orders from her customers and offer them more variety.

loans.use: to buy clothing for eventual resale.

loans.name: G.s. Los Amigos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Amigos lo conforman  Jorge Luis, Mariela, Ana y Francisco. El señor Jorge tiene 27 años. Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio que es la venta de huevos al por mayor y al detalle, sus ventas las realiza en su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante, tiene 6 años de tener este negocio. Mariela tiene 28 años se dedica a la venta de artesanías de manera ambulante, sus compras las realiza en el mercado. Ella dio inicio con el negocio desde hace 2 años, fue con ayuda de sus familiares que la apoyaron con el capital inicial para que saliera adelante y además recibió ayuda de otros comerciantes que tenían experiencia en este medio. Ana Patricia tiene su negocio que es la venta de nacatamales, frijoles y elabora sopa, esto varia diariamente buscando lo que el  cliente quiera. Su mayor desafío es realizar la compra de equipos para el negocio debido a que actualmente no tiene y tiene que usar los utensilios de su casa. Ella inicio el negocio con ayuda de su papa que le aparto capital de trabajo para que ella trabajara y saliera adelante debido a que en nuestro país es difícil conseguir empleo. Francisco el señor se dedica a la venta de huevos de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación. El señor solicita este nuevo crédito para invertirlo en su negocio y surtir mas el mismo, además que al realizar compras grandes obtiene descuentos que no tiene cuando compra al por menor.
texts.en: The communal bank "Los Amigos" is made up of members Jorge Luis, Mariela, Ana and Francisco. Jorge is 27 years old.  He requests a loan to invest in his business selling eggs at wholesale and retail. He makes his sales from his house, and also in an itinerant manner.  He has had this business for 6 years.  Mariela is 28 years old and has a business selling handicrafts.  She buys her products in the market and sells from place to place.  She started up this business 2 years ago; her relatives helped her  by contributing the startup capital so that she could get the business going.  She also received help from other merchants who had experience in this line of work.  Ana Patricia has a business selling nacatamales (a traditional Nicaraguan tamal), beans and soup.  Her menu varies daily in order to accommodate the demands of her customers.  Her main challenge is to buy equipment for the business.  At this time, she does not have this equipment and so she uses utensils from her house.  She started this business with the help of her father, who set aside working capital so that she would be able to work and get ahead, since in this country it is difficult to find work.  Francisco has a business selling eggs from place to place, and also from his house.  He requests this new loan to invest in his business and stock it with more eggs; the loan will also allow him to make a big purchase and obtain a discount that he could not get if he buys the eggs at retail.

loans.use: to buy eggs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old and is married to Michael. They live in Kakamega and have one grand child.  Grace has a charcoal business, which she has been doing for the past six years. 

She has applied for a loan to enable her to buy materials for making the charcoal burners.  She hopes to be the leader charcoal dealer in her town.

loans.use: To buy materials for making charcoal burners

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es: María, solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para la tienda como aceite, gaseosas, jugos, refrescos, dulces, churros, estos productos le ayudan para atender la demanda de los clientes. El préstamo anterior se noto bastante que el inventario de María aumento, cambiando la manera de atender a los clientes, y el movimiento en las ventas fue mayor.
texts.en: María is asking for a loan to buy stock merchandise for the store like oil, soft-drinks, juice, refreshments, candy and snacks which will help her meet customer demand.  It was quite noticeable that María’s stock inventory increased with the previous loan and sales were better.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor sigue participando en el banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Victor nació en la ciudad de Chinchero de  la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y tiene 44 años edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Victor sigue dedicándose al brindar servicio de transporte urbano en su propio taxi. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio y le va muy bien. Victor requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. 
 
Victor se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victor continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Las Palmeras” (The Palm Trees), which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. He was born in the city of Chicero in Urubamba Province in the Department of Cusco. Victor is 44 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children.

At the moment, he continues to provide urban transportation services with his own taxi. Victor has been providing this service for several years and has done very well. He is requesting a loan so that he can maintain his vehicle.

Victor is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Clara has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Clara has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Clara hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo ya que necesita comprar dos llantas y repuestos para su vehículo de uso empresarial (taxi), él se decidió por la buena atención de la institución y por la necesidad de dar a su vehículo el mantenimiento adecuado.
Los efectos que Carlos ha tenido con los préstamos ha sido favorable ya que le ha permitido mantenerse y apoyar a su familia de una mejor manera, este avance le ha permitido la decisión de adquirir su propia vivienda con el fondo social, aunque por el momento no la habita porque todavía falta los servicios públicos como agua, luz y teléfono.
texts.en:
Carlos is asking for a new loan because he needs to buy two tires and repair parts for his vehicle that he uses in an entrepreneurial way (as a taxi).  He decided to do this because of the attention he got from the institution and out of need to give his vehicle some needed maintenance.

The effects of the loans have been favorable for Carlos and they have allowed him to support his family in a better way and acquire his own home with public funds.  He still does not live there because running water, electricity, and telephone services have not been installed.

loans.use: to maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca tiene 57 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Zope, ahi vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Francisca se dedica desde hace unos tres años a la compra y venta de pescado y camaron, sus ventas las realiza a vendedores de mariscos del departamento de comayagua, tambien vende a los pobladores de su comunidad, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado y camarones ya que tiene un varios pedidos grandes y no tiene capital suficiente para cubrir dichos pedidos.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para salir adelante con su proyecto, que es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Francisca, 57, lives in the village of Zope with her husband and two children. For three years Francisca has been buying and selling fish and shrimp. She sells to the seafood vendors in the state of Comayagua and also to people in her town. 

She will use the loan to buy fish and shrimp because she has several large orders and doesn't have enough capital to complete them. Her goal is to keep working so that she can move forward on her plans to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who has a business selling fruit and fresh fruit juices. He operates his juice corner in the market where he serves his customers with fresh fruits and fresh juices. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits and another juicer machine that will allow him to offer juices to many customers at one time. 

She herself also works and operates an embroidery and sewing business. She is very passionate about her work and offers good quality work to her clients at reasonable rates. She charges PKRs 150 for each dress. The income she earns helps her pay utility bills and manage other household expenses.
 
She has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Due to financial constraints, Robina couldn’t provide education facilities to them. 

Her husband has been operating his business for the past many years. Robina is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for him and that it will increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To buy fruits and another juicer machine

loans.name: Yhon Oscar

texts.es:
Yhon Oscar  tiene 22 años de edad, él vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.

"Yhon conduce una mototaxi, se dedica a este trabajo 10 horas diarias, en un día Yhon puede atender a 50 clientes  y esto le permite ganar hasta S/. 40 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/.60 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales   y para  invertir en el negocio, el cree que le va bien debido a que es cordial con los clientes.

Yhon está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado el podrá pagar la inicial de su mototaxi, con esta mejora ya no tendrá que pagar alquiler ya que no contaba con una propia y así poder seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir  su gran sueño: Tener una empresa de mototaxis."
texts.en:
Yhon Oscar is 22, and lives in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, close to four hours south of Lima, the capital of the country. It is celebrated by Peruvians as the "The Land of the Sun."

It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007, and 6.9 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps especially, as the source of the traditional national drink of Peru, pisco. The home and business of the client is found in this warm and arid climate.

Yhon drives a mototaxi. He works 10 hours a day. In one day, Yhon can serve 50 customers, and this allows him to earn up to 40 soles a day and on a good day, he can earn up to 60 soles. This helps him meet some extra household expenses, and allows him to invest in his business. He thinks that it's going well due to the fact that he is friendly with the customers.

Yhon is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the support he has been offered, he will be able to make the down payment on his mototaxi. With this improvement, he won't have to pay to rent it anymore, as he didn't have is own.  In this way, he will be able to continue saving to fulfill his great dream, "To have a mototaxi company."

loans.use: To make a down payment to purchase his mototaxi.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 45 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children. Lorna works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 2,500 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Lorna has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: This is 43 year-old Joseph. He is married, and has 4 children aged 14, 11, 6, and 2yrs. Joseph established his  provision business. He began his business because he wanted to get a reliable source of income which he can use to provide livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.Joseph now requires a new loan in order to purchase more provision for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Joseph plans to open stores in different market areas and educate his children to university level. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Delia has a shop that sells charcoal. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more firewood to make charcoal.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: buy firewood to make charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nonvigbe Group

texts.fr: NONVIGBE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Lydie Claire (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 47 ans. Lydie Claire a arrêté l'école. Lydie Claire est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Dominique. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Lydie Claire et son mari. Pour cette raison, Lydie Claire vend des tissus par la technique de distribution, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Lydie Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Lydie Claire sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVIGBE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçu antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine aged 34 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 11 years.2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children and to buy a cow.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: She trades in dried pepperand other farm spices. She purchases pepper and other perishable farm produce from farmers. She dries them and then sell them to institutions including hospitals, clinics and schools. Her activities are very helpful to the farmers as she assist to address the post harvest losses of her client farmers by given them prompt incomes and also support the chain of distribution as a key link between the farmers who are the producers and the institutions who are the consumers.She therefore has a ready and availble market and constant cash flow in her business. Rebecca has also participated in the TEACH lending skills programme and has developed a simple marketing plan that enables her to market her wares easily.She therefore needs KIVA loan funds to further improve her business.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda began selling perfumes and cosmetics two years ago for another person, who paid her a small percentage of the sales she made. She decided to apply for a loan to acquire credit for the purchase of products by Yanbel, a line of cosmetics and perfumes. She has been running her own business for a year as a microentrepreneur. The business has allowed her to generate more income for her family. Now she sells all types of cosmetics, fashion accessories and perfumes, particularly to the ladies of her neighborhood.

Glenda is applying for credit so that she'll be able to expand her business by buying products wholesale. She has noted an increase in demand and wants to be able to satisfy her clients by offering more products, and a greater variety of products.

Glenda is 48 years old. She is raising three children; only two are still in school. Her husband works as a mechanic and helps her in her business. With this investment, they hope to increase the profitability of the business, and as result, to further improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Glenda se inicio vendiendo perfumes y cosméticos desde hace 2 años para otra persona que le proporcionaba un mínimo porcentaje de utilidad. Ella decidió solicitar un préstamo para obtener crédito en productos de la línea Yanbal, que es una proveedora de cosméticos y perfumes. Ella ha manteniendo su negocio propio desde hace un año como microempresaria, el mismo que le ha permitido generar mayores ingresos para su familia. Ahora vende todos tipos de cosméticos, bisutería y perfumes, particularmente a sus vecinas de la comunidad.

Glenda solicita crédito para poder incrementar su negocio con compras al por mayor. Ella ha notado que su demanda ha aumentado y quiere poder satisfacer a sus clientes con más variedad y productos.

Glenda tiene 48 años y tiene 3 hijos que están a su cargo, pero solo 2 que estudian. Su esposo labora como mecánico y la apoya en su negocio. Espera con la inversión realizada mayor rentabilidad y así mejorar mas su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau works as a day laborer and his wife plants vegetables to sell. They have two young children, and their income is $12.50 per person per month. They want to borrow $75 to buy one more cow to raise.

loans.use: Sau would like to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Rosalba Irene

texts.es:
Rosalba comes from Escobedo in Nuevo León. She is married and has a 20 year old son and a four year old daughter. It was because of them that she started her own business 15 years ago, selling hamburgers and tacos. Her husband is a taxi driver but his earnings are not enough to cover all the household costs. Rosalba started selling food from her house and then she got a cart which she can move around and sell food from.

Rosalba would like a loan of $750 which she will use to buy tables, chairs and some metal poles which she will use to refurbish her business. She hopes it will keep growing and that with this refurbishment she will have more space in which to serve her clients better. She will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Help Rosalba to improve her business. She and her family sincerely thank you for any help you can offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalba es originaria de Escobedo, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene un hijo de 20 años y una pequeña de 4 años de edad, ellos han sido el motivo para iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de hamburguesas y tacos desde hace 15 años, su esposo es taxista pero el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar. Rosalba inició con la venta de comida en la cochera de su casa, después pudo adquirir un carrito ambulante equipado para realizar sus ventas.

Rosalba está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mesas, sillas y una malla metálica con la que remodelara su local, ella espera continuar creciendo y con esta remodelación tendrá más espacio para poder atender bien a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Rosalba a mejorar su negocio, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: Refurbishment/Remodelación

loans.name: Nisa

texts.es:
Señora Nisa belongs to the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 61 years old, and is the mother of 6 children. Her husband works at a small farm on a mountain, where after 20 days he can be flown down to his family and give them what little money he has earned. But, given the daily needs of her family, Nisa worked herself up to open a small grocery since the block already had a school. For this she solicited her first loan of 300 Sol (US $94 approx.). The recent loan granted to Nisa by Manuela Ramos in the sum of 2,000 Sol. (US$630 approx.). will be used to purchase 6 boxes of soda water, 2 sacs of sugar, 3 boxes of milk, 1 box of treats, 1 pack of biscuits, and 5 bags of water in satchels. Nisa is very happy to be able to contribute economically to her household. In addition, given the fierce heat in her region, that she can attend to the children, who need a lot of liquids to sate their thirst. Now, the grocery provides for the family's daily expenses and they have no trouble waiting for the arrival of her husband. She counts on the help of her children, who without neglecting their studies help attend to the grocery.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nisa pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 61 años, y es madre de 6 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en la chacra en el monte, quien después de 20 días pueda estar alado de su familia y darles el poco dinero que consiguió, pero como las necesidades son diarias, es así que Nisa se anima a poner una pequeña bodega ya que a media cuadra está una escuela. Para ello solicitó un primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.). El reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 (US$ 630.00 aprox.) será utilizado para comprar 6 cajas de gaseosas, 2 sacos de azúcar, 3 cajas de leche, 1 caja de galletas, 1 paquete de golosinas, y 5 bolsas de agua en saches. Nisa está muy contenta por que también puede apoyar económicamente en su hogar, además, dado al fuerte calor en la zona pueda atender a los niños que requieran de bastante liquido para aplacar la sed. Ahora la bodega les da para los gastos del día y así no tienen ninguna dificultad de esperar hasta que llegue el esposo, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos que sin descuidar sus estudios atienden la bodega.

loans.use: Purchase of essential products

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ms. Ana Patricia, single mother of three, had a job that didn’t bring her much income in order to care for her children, so she began selling food among her neighbors in order to better provide for her children and in this way, little by little, she began her own food business and increased her income. She also took advantage of this opportunity to sell seasonal clothing to her clients. Thanks to this activity she has been able to pay for her children to attend school.

However, Ana Patricia continues to struggle in order to move her children ahead and it is for this reason that she is asking for a loan of $300 dollars to be reimbursed in a 6 month period. With this money Ana will be able to buy a stove and other items in order to offer items sold during a local holiday called “The Day of the Dead” for her clients. With your help, Ana Patricia will be able to have materials to sell and in turn pay for her children’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ana Patricia madre soltera de tres hijos, tenía un trabajo que no le dejaba muchos ingresos como para poder mantener a sus hijos así que empezó vendiendo comida entre sus vecinas para poder mantenerlos y así se estableció poco a poco como un negocio de comidas, e incrementando sus ventas y además aprovechó para ofrecer entre sus clientes ropa de temporada. Gracias a esta actividad a podido costearles hasta hoy los estudios a sus hijos.

Sin embargo Ana Patricia sigue luchando para sacar adelante a sus hijos y por lo tanto hoy está solicitando un préstamo de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, Y con este dinero Ana podrá comprar una estufa y enseres para poder ofrecer el día de muertos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ana Patricia podrá tener material para vender y así poder pagar los gastos de su hijo.

loans.use: Buy a stove in order to sell more varieties of food

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sroeun K. (age 28) and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Sroeun and her husband (age 31), have been married for eleven years and have two sons, the older of whom studies in primary school in the village.

She is requesting this, her second loan from Maxima, to prepare a second loom and to buy thread for weaving. She has been weaving, a skill she learned by apprenticing on a nearby island, since she was fifteen years old. She has since taught her husband to weave and he will use the second loom. He also works at construction, farms, and raises cows. As is almost universal for Cambodians, Sroeun’s main goal is to maintain or expand her business so she can support the studies of her children.

loans.use: To purchase thread for weaving and to set up a second loom

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru:
Hakim U. has been selling nuts, garlic, potatoes, turnips and fruit vinegar (circo) for 28 years. He has been a MicroInvest borrower since 2002 and has shown himself to be a responsible borrower. Hakim learned about MicroInvest from a loan officer. Due to the loan he was able to increase his purchases from wholesalers and increase his profits. Sometimes he travels to Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan to purchase products.

Hakim is a family man and has 3 children. His son helps him in his business. In the future he plans to pass on his business to his son. Hakim will use his Kiva loan to expand his inventory and support his fast product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Умаров Хаким, продает орехи, чеснок, картошку, репку и фруктовый уксус. (сирко) на протяжении 28 лет.В Микроинвесте он кредитуется с 2002 года и проявил себя как ответственный плательшик. О нашей организации услышал от займового офицера.Благодаря кредитам он смог закупать больше товара у оптавиков и соответственно иметь большую прибыль. Иногда он сам ездить за товаром в Узбекистан и Киргизистан. Он человек семейный и имеет 3 детей.Сын помогает по бизнесу. В будушем он прланирует передать совй бизнес сыну. На займ с КИВЫ он хочет увеличить объём товара потомучто сейчас он имеет быстрый оборот.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Selling food is a very common business in the city of León, Nicaragua. There is a lot of competition and the great majority of places that sell food are of excellent quality. Conscious of this, Mrs. María Isabel Millón has dedicated herself to the job for the past 30 years in order to support her son. Through this work María has been able to pay for her son's schooling and his home needs.

She began the business with 4,000 córdobas (approximately $200 dollars), and she has worked with Ceprodel in order to obtain loans that have greatly benefited her locale. Through these loans María has increased her earnings and purchased raw materials in larger volume in order to make food. As of date she has repaid 14 previous loans through Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de comida es un negocio muy común en la ciudad de León ya que existe mucha competencia y la gran mayoría de los lugares donde se vende la comida son de excelente calidad. Consiente de esto, la señora Maria Isabel M. se dedica desde hace 30 años a este negocio para apoyar a su hijo en las necesidades del hogar y el pago de los estudios

Inició su negocio con un capital de C$ 4000 (Cuatro mil córdobas) y ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo créditos que han beneficiado grandemente su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y adquirido mayores volúmenes de materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Actualmente su record crediticio es de 14 créditos con Ceprodel

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making food

loans.name: Elias Jose

texts.es:
Elias P., is a 25 years old young man, who got married at a very young age and who lives with his wife and two children in Ticuantepe. To support his family, Elias works the land with his father-in-law who yielded a portion of his land sp Elias could harvest pineapple and thus to support them to do well and advance in life. As a good son-in-law, he works on his crop and supports his father-in-law, as his wife takes care of the children and the home. In order to have another source of income, Elias works with wood in a carpentry. He needs the loan to buy supplies to maintain his crop, which is important to harvest a high-quality product and therefore, ask for a better and more competitive price. A successful crop will allow him and his wife to buy school supplies for their children and some household goods for his wife and the home.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Elias P., es un joven de 25 años, que a muy temprana edad se caso y habita con su joven esposa y sus dos niños pequeños en Ticuantepe, para mantener a su familia trabaja la tierra con su suegro quien le cedió 2 manzanas de tierra para cosechar piña y así apoyarlos a salir adelante, como buen yerno trabaja su cosecha y apoya a su suegro ya que su esposa se mantiene al cuido de los niños y el hogar. Como otro ingreso trabaja con madera en una carpintería ahora necesita su préstamo para comprar insumos de mantenimiento de la cosecha que es importante para lograr un producto de alta calidad y le puedan pagar un mejor precio por su cosecha que le permitirá comprar a sus hijos los materiales escolares pendientes y algunos enseres para su esposa en la casa.

loans.use: To Buy Supplies for Crop Maintenance

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina has a tailoring business on Kampala Road that has been running for 15 years. She sits just outside in the corridors with her colleagues, where their customers meet them. She is 39 years old and married with 3 children, as she caters to her sister who is in Form 2. Her husband, a water engineer, has been a great help, mostly in those times when she did not have access to loans, but still he is supportive. She needs a loan to enable her to buy more materials for sewing that she can sell to her customers.

loans.use: Georgina needs a loan to enable her to buy more cloth material for sewing that she can sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Mariam M.. She is married and has 3 children aged 2, 7 and 15. She has 4 more dependents who live with her because they are street children. In 1996, Mariam established her café business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more kitchen utensils. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot, sticky dough, made from maize flour), a plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensil.

loans.name: Luz De Lourdes

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz lives in the "14th of February" neighborhood, is 35 years old, married, and has three children in school. Her husband works at a business as an accountant and supports the household's income needs.

Luz has a general store and also sells clothing and other articles. She has four years of experience and began with her own money. The loan that she is requesting is for cash to invest in whole grains and purchasing clothing that will fill her general store. That way, she will be able to offer her customers a wider variety of products that are useful to them. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, gaining more customers, and provide her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Luz habita en el barrio 14 de Febrero, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, con tres hijos que están estudiando, su esposo trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como contador y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Luz tiene una pulpería y también vende ropa y otros, ella tiene cuatro años de experiencia y comenzó con fondos propios, con el préstamo que le otorguen es para capital de trabajo en la inversión de granos básicos y comprar ropa para tener llena la pulpería y poder ofrecer a sus clientes diversos productos obtener mas utilidad. A futuro es incrementar el negocio y captar más clientes y brindar a sus hijos estudios.

loans.use: Purchase whole grains and undergarments for her shop
